question_list.author: MikeAq
question_list.text:
Mr. Thistle, what's this all about?
All our rules you dismiss — baldly flout.
I have read your epistle;
It made my hairs bristle.
I'm blowing the whistle — you're out!
question_list.question: Does Mr. Thistle follow our rules?
alternate_answers: Mr. Thistle does not follow the rules consistently. He often disregards them without explanation or justification.

Based on the limericks provided, the question appears to be about the limerick that mentions "Mr. Thistle". The relevant limerick is:

"Mr. Thistle, what's this all about? 
All our rules you dismiss — baldly flout.
I have read your epistle;
It made my hairs bristle.
I'm blowing the whistle — you're out!"

This limerick suggests that Mr. Thistle does not follow the rules, as the speaker is blowing the whistle on him for dismissing and flouting the rules.

question_list.author: MikeAq
question_list.text:
To compose a morose epicedium
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium.
question_list.question: How can one brighten one's torpor and tedium?
alternate_answers:
The limerick suggests that composing a morose epicedium (a funeral song or poem) can help brighten one's torpor and tedium. The limerick states:

"To compose a morose epicedium 
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium."

So the answer is that writing a moderately melancholy funeral poem or song can help alleviate boredom and listlessness, according to the limerick.

Compose a morose epicedium.
Craft a sad dirge, not too mournful,
Just medium, not scornful,
To lift your spirits, a musical medium.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Give me seeds and you'll soon see me sowing.
Give me plants and I'll soon have them growing.
I'm a gardener, me,
With green fingers, you see.
Show me weeds, though, and I'll show you hoeing.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The element gallium? Ga.
The element barium? Ba.
In that element club,
There is dubnium — D(u)b,
Which some still call "hahnium". Ha!

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
My soccer team boasts a back four.
That's a sporting, defense-minded corps:
In a line, this quartet
Tries to counter each threat
And so not let the other side score.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When you're plunging a grommet in place,
Does a rivet-hole-reamer lose face?
Both their unions' bosses
Will call all the tosses:
Demarcation disputes, case by case.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'd been courtin' my wee bonny cummer
On a brae in the warm of midsummer.
"Dinnae dae that," she cried.
When for seconds I tried,
"Wanty bolt!" Then she fled. What a bummer.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A dancer I glanced at by chance
Was engaged in a vigorous dance.
I was itching to learn
'Til I chanced to discern
All the ants crawling out of her pants.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Aborticides—where do I start?
Just their mention drives people apart,
As pro-lifers entreat us:
"By killing a fetus,
You're stopping the beat of a heart."

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A geneticist, name of O'Day,
Interfered with his own DNA.
Chromosomal deletions
Produced strange secretions
(Of what, I prefer not to say).

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
With some candies, on Valentine's Day,
You might hope that you'll get all the way.
Though they make a sweet start
On your paramour's heart,
They will not guarantee the entrée.

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
"It's too salty," the critic opined;
His review was not meant to be kind.
"It's not that I'm fickle—
It tastes like a pickle!"
The corned beef was overly brined.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An Assyrian's bad catatonia
Got worse with his double pneumonia.
Feeling overly spent,
Off to Akkad he went
For treatment in North Babylonia.

limerick_list.author: Lanny
limerick_list.text:
Mary's parents expressed consternation
When she majored in art conservation.
Then they learned Art was wealthy—
And old and not healthy—
And bragged of her fine education.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In the pen, many prisoners curse;
Their despair's making matters much worse.
But a few of them might
Come to poetry night,
Where each inmate cites captor and verse.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
In the City, and feeling the pressure?
Come north, where the atmosphere's fresher!
We have crumbly cheese
And a Cat that will please
With its grin, in this county of Cheshire.

limerick_list.author: Dick C. Erd
limerick_list.text:
Earth's Creation in four thousand four
Took six days to complete, Ussher swore.
Do not teach evolution:
God's perfect solution
Could never evolve any more.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Downtown Phoenix, a hot summer's day:
August's torrid inertia holds sway.
A large flash mob assembles
Dons gear that resembles
Banditos', then stages a play.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
As the Beatles continue to crack,
Paul produces a plan to Get Back.
But the tensions intrude:
John and Yoko pose nude,
And the two of them struggle with smack.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The crew of the ship gave a roar
When they heard "Let the ee-eagle soar":
Along for the journey
Was US Attorney
General Ashcroft! (They'd heard him before.)

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
An arachnid now lives in my john.
I don't want to make her move on.
Her ways when she's spinning
Are charming and winning —
She's weaving her spider salon.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm a lover of Boston baked beans.
It's a food fit for kings and for queens.
If I ate all I pleased,
Till my appetite eased,
I would never fit into my jeans.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Did some dognappers send you a threat
That they'd dognap (make off with) your pet?
You're upset, I can see,
But don't fret because he
Is well-guarded; that pet they won't get!

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
If you're looking for work, you should know
Many companies offer good dough
Just for joining their teams.
And the best jobs, it seems,
Have the greatest such golden hello.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Enoptomancy doesn't come free.
Fifty bucks is my usual fee.
You ask if you'll wed
Someone skillful in bed?
Let me check.... Holy moley, it's me!

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
A caddy's your guide, on the links,
To how the green rises and sinks.
He'll carry your clubs
Up the hills, through the shrubs,
And carry you home after drinks.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
First sharp objects, no nail files to use.
Shoe bombs next, you must take off your shoes.
Then it's liquid and gel;
To enplane now is hell—
What comes next? Time to go on a cruise!

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
If you're packing, but sacking is lacking,
'Cause racking needs stacking with backing,
Then cardboard's the thing
(With a good length of string) —
Stop slacking and snacking; get cracking!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dephlegmation's a process of note
Once defined in a word, and I quote:
"Concentration." It's true.
It has nothing to do
With the process of clearing one's throat.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Their new primetime reality show
Was, believe it or not, a real go.
It premiered Christmas Day
And, I'm sorry to say,
It's about stealing gifts. (Ho! Ho! Ho!)

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The surf-boarders shout, with great glee,
At the long, curling waves of the sea;
And the high glassy green
Makes the combers' deep sheen
A fine picture, when seen on TV.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"With a luggage cashier I'm obsessed;
Can you help keep my feelings suppressed?"
"To seem chaste as a monk
Keep your gaze on a trunk."
"Sure—I'll fixate my eyes on her chest."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Chinchillidae: family name
Of some bushy-tailed rodents of fame
For the beautiful fur
That can make a girl purr,
But to kill them for fur, sir? A shame!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
For the Kingsmen, a stroke of good luck —
By all rights, "Louie Louie" should suck:
Just one take, mike too high,
Garbled lyrics — that's why.
What a fluke then that gold would be struck.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mama bolti laid eggs in a pile,
And stayed close as they hatched in the Nile.
She swam north and swam south
With her brood in her mouth,
But she lost them whenever she'd smile.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Paki-bashing's still heard in some pubs,
China-bashing in upper-crust clubs.
Guiltless people, you'll find,
Are insulted, maligned.
It's as cruel as face-to-face snubs.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I think apples are better in strudels.
I want them now, oodles and oodles.
They smell so good baking
Don't waste your time making
Dull treats without dough for your poodles.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
What's the fuss? Just an old wedding ring.
Not much value—how much would it bring?
I can face that you're gone;
Guess I'll just leave it on.
It's my right. I've grown used to the thing.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Amalthea, huge Jupiter's moon,
Orbits twice for each Earth solar noon.
An asteroid captured,
With Jove she's enraptured.
From Io, now sulphur-bestrewn.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
NASA's orbiting telescopes' flight
Can help bring new planets to light.
Though astronomers may
Spot false positives, they
Are not often mistaken — they're right.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
"When a gem like a diamond's been cut
Into numerous facets, then what
It is suitably named
Is a brilliant," exclaimed
The gem dealer, "a stone you can strut!"

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
It's not brains that define a go-getter,
Since the cleverest folk can be wetter
Than the foggiest day.
And that leads me to say:
Knowing more doesn't mean knowing better.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dan Two Trees, the chief of the Sioux,
Was asked for his favorite hue.
He glanced, by and by,
At a pale patch of sky,
And then smiled as he said, "Baby blioux!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Where the growth was removed, there's a gap,
So I've wrapped it—it's held with a strap—
And the skin that's nearby
Isn't strong, so I'll  try
A repair with a large distant flap.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
The bankers aren't paying their tailors,
As the credit crunch turns them to wailers.
Who will give them a cent
When we all know they've lent
Countless billions to trash for their trailers?

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"There's no will; and this sad situation
Costs cash and delay and frustration.
Lest an heir should declare
That you've not taken care,
There's insurance to buy: Bond of Caution."

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
"Dearest friends; let us dine! As it's said,
Together we'll sit and break bread!"
Though a meal seemed a nice
Way of breaking the ice,
He served beans; we broke wind there instead.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Those are sentries patrolling that base;
You'll never slip into the place.
You've got guts, I suppose,
But that skin—it just glows.
Please indulge me by corking your face.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Jay was famous and proud; life was glittering
Until his indictment for littering.
"Let the public exult!"
He declared. The result:
Jay's empoisonment—yes, his embittering.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
A boiled sweet (to us Yanks, it's  hard candy)
Is a treat that some children find dandy.
 But your dentist will say
You should keep well away.
 Chew sugarless gum or drink brandy.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was startled! My knees turned to water.
"Disembossom yourself from my daughter!!
Take your hands from her breasts
And, although she protests,
Reinstate that nice bra that I bought her!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dissociative fugue is the kind
Where the patient runs off, tries to find
A fresh life—something new.
When you ask: "Who are you?"
Where's his memory? Left it behind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The deadline is close, and I'll bet
That our project is not ready yet.
We'll assemble our crew
And work frantically through
Until dawn—yes, we'll have a charrette.

limerick_list.author: Frank Hubeny
limerick_list.text:
A cute bird with thick bill to crack seeds,
That's the bullfinch. It helps control weeds.
"It's a sparrow," you say,
But the finch says, "No way!"
It's respect that this tiny bird needs.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Any exercise wheel with a squeak
May result in a rodent that's sleek,
But the nightly disturbals
Engendered by gerbils
Subvert any slumber you seek.

limerick_list.author: 7thsibling
limerick_list.text:
There was a young lady from Kalisz
Who tended to, well, apple-polish.
She'd fawn and she'd flatter
With sycophant patter,
To find favor with men large and smallish.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
"Crazy cookie" they call me. It's wrong.
"Flaky fruitcake" as well. I am strong.
I'm a cake and accept
I've been raised quite inept,
For my mum was a wafer too long.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
For a pump stock we need water quick,
And a blast hole will best do the trick.
For a tunnel or mine
Where a blast we'd confine,
Drill a hole for a dynamite stick.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
We define equinoctial year
As the time our terrestrial sphere
Takes to orbit the sun
On its annual run,
Timed from spring to spring equinox. Clear?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the dumpster behind my dad's store
We threw garbage and trash and much more.
What the shop couldn't sell
Dad would keep for a spell,
Then he'd toss it—that's what the thing's for.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We drove from Sorrento, en route
To Cosenza, in Italy's boot.
In that town, rather small,
We found lodging and all,
Dined on vino, spaghetti, and fruit.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
On a ledge there's no "squeezing in ledgeways";
By a hedge there's no "squeezing in hedgeways".
But sneak in a word
With a chatterbox bird
Then you've managed to "squeeze it in edgeways".

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I found a false widow," Nell said,
"In a cupboard." "Her husband's not dead?"
I replied. "Tell me how.
Is she living there now?"
"It's a spider. You've rocks in your head!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My name has been dragged through the mud,
Since my daddy, the duke, was a dud:
His conviction for treason
Remains as the reason
I suffer corruption of blood.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The bahut's medieval and French.
Small enough to slide under a bench,
It's a chest that would hold
Household objects of old,
Like the thimbles and threads of a wench.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The director said, eyeing her rear,
"Let's examine your profile, my dear."
Clearly being no slouch
On his new casting couch
Is the way to advance her career.

limerick_list.author: rusty
Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A soldier writes home in a letter
That's officially read by a vetter.
This censor deletes
Any talk of defeats,
Since the less about that, well, the better.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Brenda Sue is now pregnant, alas,
And I feel like a dummy, first class.
"When you're having your fun,
Use a condom, my son,"
Said my dad. "Always cover your ass!"

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
I put cart before horse, that is so.
It's on purpose. I think you should know
That this harmless old drudge
Will not shift, will not budge —
In my dictionary, that's where they go.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
No capsules: I choke and get queasy.
Find pills that dissolve, and I'm easy—
Some disintegrable med
That won't mess with my head.
Help me quick, Doc. I'm dopey and sneezy.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
When I tell you a joke, you don't laugh;
Yet your brain, say my medical staff,
Shows electrical glee,
As they clearly can see
With the electroencephalograph.

limerick_list.author: beejay
limerick_list.text:
Bacillophobia's really bad news:
It's when germy things give you the blues.
It cuts down on noshing;
You're always hand-washing.
(Locus classicus: see Howard Hughes.)

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
"Put your grapes in the calathus, son,"
Said an Ancient Greek mother.  "It's one
Of those baskets you see
That is shaped like a vee.
Toting fruit on your head can be fun."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Like stars of a bright constellation,
In reciprocal astro-location,
Two objects may be
Correlatable. We
Use this term to describe their relation.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
The deergrass that grows by my curb
Is a western perennial herb.
Often, mule deer consume it;
With a bright purple bloom, it
Grows tall and it looks quite superb.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I got sweatpants for Christmas (Fantastic!)
For those rare times I'm feeling gymnastic.
But what makes them so great?
Well, the way I gain weight,
They'll still fit since the waistband's elastic.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Aspiration refers to the puff
That we make when a stop's not enough—
Why the p that's in pit
Is unlike that of spit—
But its conscious control can be tough.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If you've learned ancient Greek, do your best
To remember, when taking a test,
All its alphabet, friend,
From beginning to end:
Alpha, beta... click here for the rest.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
C's a sequence that's Cauchy, we'll see:
Choose a D, any distance, and we
Can find element n:
For all greater m's, then
| C(n) – C(m) | < D.

limerick_list.author: PdeG
limerick_list.text:
I wish our affair hadn't started:
It has left me so hurt, brokenhearted.
Can't you see that I find
Your sharp words are unkind?
I am glad we have been far aparted.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
Argentinian australs are dough
That you spend at a store or a show.
 A financial inspection
 And austral projection
Tells kids what they'll get when you go.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
Walk upon floating logs, make 'em twirl!
As we ride down the river, we birl.
Rolling oak, spinning pine —
Done to tree trunks, that's fine;
But felonious done to a girl.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Two spoked wheels, a small seat and a chain,
And a frame make a bicycle: plain,
But effective. Astride,
Pushing pedals, you ride
Till your bum says it's time to abstain.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
My mother just said to me "Son,
I think daughters-in-law are no fun."
"Well, Mom, maybe that's true
But like Dad I made do
And agreed to get married to one."

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
I said, "Fetch me a chessboard," but he
Instead brought a cheeseboard to me.
Though it first seemed a shame,
Still, I wanted a game,
So played Gouda to Queen's Roquefort 3.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The ballot in Michigan's vote
For the Dems has omissions; of note,
No top-tier Obama,
No Edwards — no drama.
The chance Clinton loses?  Remote.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though it lessens wheels' splashing, my fender
Has not quite the force to engender
In my heart or my mind
Loving thoughts of the kind
I'd assign to the class that's called tender.

limerick_list.author: geniuswaitress
limerick_list.text:
At the office, a young CPA
Came costumed as Lady Jane Grey.
"Afternoon, Mr Lee."
"How'd you know it was me?"
"Um... you wear that same dress every day."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The man's on paternity leave,
But he has other tricks up his sleeve.
He has had the  brass neck
To head off on a trek
On his own. Yes, it's hard to conceive!

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Ignoring his deep sense of doom,
Young Napoleon stomped round the room
(Crushing crates as he went),
Asked what dualin meant,
And found out when the case went ka-BOOM!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I must leave you, at once — double quick!
Yes, the time's come: I'm cutting my stick.
I'll depart straight away,
No, I cannot delay,
As I fear I'm about to be ... blairrghh!

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Diureticalness makes for some piddle,
Pointing Percy at porcelain, widdle,
The need for a tinkle,
A Jeremy Sprinkle,
A leak, or a wee, Jimmy Riddle.

limerick_list.author: RGiskard
limerick_list.text:
In the pale early light, my DeLorean
Raced quickly on roads Ecuadorian.
The sun rose in the skies —
And good God, my poor eyes!
I was blinded by sunshine aurorean.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's an anticoagulant drug,
Just what's needed for saving this mug
Who has dangerous clots.
Give him Coumadin—lots!
If we don't, we'll be pulling the plug.

limerick_list.author: Margaret Ford
limerick_list.text:
I agree there's no use feelin' bitter
(And I've never been known as a quitter),
But if relatives diss me
They'll probably miss me,
'Cause I'm gonna block 'em on Twitter.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
There's corned beef on rye, there's pastrami;
There's bagels and lox, and salami.
I'm down at the deli
Indulging my belly.
Some halvah I'll shlep home for mommy.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
An engineer (rare for technicians)
And a physicist — not two physicians —
Won a Medicine Nobel
For the scanner, so well
Known as CT, to check Doc's suspicions.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Little letter, you mAy be the best,
For it's true thAt you Are 'fore the rest.
Though in AbrAcAdAbrA
You're lAuded, cruel zebrA
'EntAils' you — you form its Arse-crest!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
In a galaxy far, far away,
There's an evergreen herb, so they say.
Taxonomical data:
Galax urceolata,
Like the one in southeast U.S.A.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
My birthday's not hard to remember;
It comes 'round each year in December.
My interests are various—
I'm pure Sagittarius
The Archer (we start in November).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Seminarians cried to the cleric:
"Our dorm's got a stench atmospheric!"
"Your classmate is ill
With an ailment that will
Cause a stink, as his flu's dysenteric."

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
How the mayor did bellow and shout,
"All you Eagles and Masons, get out!
You Odd Fellows leave town.
We give Elks the thumbs down.
Dislodgment, that's what we're about."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Most equivocatory speech he's made yet:
He said nothing he'll live to regret.
"Failing snags, we'll proceed,
If all act as agreed…
That's unless there's a credible threat."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
She sat by the sea, scanned the sky,
Seeking sea eagles soaring on high.
Asked why she so sat,
Said she's paid to do that:
"Simply erning a living, is why."

limerick_list.author: SusanL and mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Old Blue Eyes canorously crooned,
And the ladies, enchanted, all swooned.
There's no doubt he could sing;
When he paired up with Bing,
Every girl in America mooned.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A disease of the crotch, Cupid's itch,
Is a minor catastrophe which,
Be it crabs or the clap,
Has you caught in a trap.
STD treatment can be a bitch!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As the wind picked up speed and blew blusteringly,
We clutched one another, bunched clusteringly.
As we tried to walk back
Through the gale's strong attack,
All our muscles were mobilized musteringly.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
An extreme of alarm's when you're freaked:
An over-the-top fear that's peaked
To the point of the loss
Of control (you're not boss
Of emotions), like  fear voiced or shrieked.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Auxerrois, white or gris, may be known
To the well-informed vintner alone:
Not a great famous wine,
But it's doubtlessly fine,
From its burgundy grapes so well grown.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
When cattle let warble flies ride,
They lay eggs; maggots burrow inside.
Then these cattle grubs feast
On the flesh of the beast,
Often spoiling the meat and the hide.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Counted cross-stitch? Its heart is a chart
Full of symbols, the craft's signal part.
A vast palette of flosses
And stitches like crosses
Make a mighty fine stand-in for art.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Take aluminum, cobalt and nickel;
Add iron and copper (a trickle).
It's magnetically active
(Like women, attractive:
But alnico isn't as fickle).

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
What a dire rear! Whew! I can tell it —
As that diapered kid seeps, I can smell it.
"So, does diarrhea trouble you?"
Asks old Dr. Deblieux.
I say, "Just when I'm trying to spell it."

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
"My good fortune or, simply, good luck
Was in meeting Amanda," said Chuck.
"I'm sure you'll believe me.
She'd never deceive me.
If she did, I would clearly be stuck."

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Superfino arborio rice
Makes risotto especially nice.
Adding mushrooms is fine,
And we always use wine.
"Take your time" is my final advice.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Teachers not letting schoolchildren fail,
Judges giving light terms served in jail —
When they coddle (protect
With great care), they expect
That good conduct will always prevail.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Little Elton, the one-legged elf,
Struggled hard to reach food from the shelf;
But all help he'd decline
With, "I'll manage just fine.
I can do it: I fend for myself."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
I'm a cartophile; show me a map
And I'm happy as any a chap.
Be it old, be it new,
What I'm yearning to do
Is procure one to view. Verbum sap.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm flat broke and for help I entreat.
In my kitchen there's nothing to eat.
I've no money to feed
My old dad; we're in need,
So I beg and I plead in the street.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There are asteroids hurtling through space.
If one hits us, it's sure to erase—
Kill us all—every place,
Without leaving a trace.
Buy insurance (sign here) just in case.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Life in Switzerland's navy is nice,
But if action's your aim, best think twice.
For to set ships in motion,
You first need an ocean.
We're a force that's all gravy, no rice.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Let's exagitate Steed for his deeds.
A grave censure's the treatment he needs.
Plus he'll stay on the hook
For the money he took,
Irrespective of how much he pleads.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Called my wife: "Can you bail me out, Marge?
I've been nailed on an A & B charge."
"That's assault again, Lou?
Mixed with battery, too?
You're more grief than you're worth, by and large!"

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
The clackety metrical feet
Of the train, as I curl on my seat
In a travel-worn heap,
Almost lull me to sleep
With a cadenced and rhythmical beat.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The gewgaw's a fun thing to play:
Hold by lips (against teeth), pluck away,
Move the tongue to change pitch.
Now when I have the itch,
I twang Mozart's sonata in A.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
So you're building in haste with no mockup?
Left your flat in a rush; didn't lock up?
The result, you can guess,
Is a big, royal mess
That a bystander might call a cockup.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
When the Agency propped up a guy
Named Bin Laden, 'twas done on the sly.
With our help, an armed threat,
Now he's too hard to get,
And the blowback's now why our troops die.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The coyote brush spreads itself wide
In the desert where animals hide.
It's an evergreen shrub,
Not your everyday scrub,
Having flowery shows to provide.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Highly civilised, small and bright pink;
Mouse-shaped persons, long-nosed — they can think.
Clangers talk with a whistle,
But I'm quite sure that this'll
Not stop them from getting a drink ...

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Wrote a book, but don't know what comes next?
Get a book agent, send her your text.
If she knows how to schmooze,
Buys the publishers booze,
Then your writing career won't be hexed.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
The system with ten as its base
Is called decimal. But if each space
Holds a power of ten square,
That's centesimal, where
It's one hundred that's used in ten's place.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
When the bughouse is swarming with bugs,
Is the patient, sedated by drugs,
Happ'ly shooting the breeze
With the spiders and fleas?
On his haziest days, he just shrugs.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
A security leak quickly reaches
The chief of detectives, who screeches,
"Get cracking, my corps.
Get advice — find a whore.
Get an expert in zipping up breaches."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Good Fortune, you're love at first sight.
Babe, I'm counting on you — get it right.
What else can I do
But encarnalize you?
Luck, be a lady tonight.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The earth was primordial slime,
But dried to a sweltering clime.
Then it rained and it rained
Until nothing remained
Of the antediluvian time.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Charles Coulomb, French Engineers' Corps,
Invented and used—to explore
Unknown forces—a balance
That's torque-based. His talents
Set his flag for long at the fore.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A bursectomy: not what you'd do
If research on live birds you eschew.
The bird's bursa (small sack)
Of Fabricius (health pack)
Is destroyed — then research will ensue.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You're abusing my spousal largesse
When you're spending de trop (in excess),
Going over our limits.
My bank account's grim; it's
A balance near zero—a mess!

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
At a tavern in Spain there's a rota:
When a guest doesn't finish his bota,
In turn, every waiter
Gets sooner or later
To drink it — and then dance the jota.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Her designs vaguely formed, she set out,
No more wit than a damp April sprout.
Then she patterned her goals
Off the wisdom of polls.
From damned clueless, she's warped to devout.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Double-density disks have more room,
In fact twice as much space, I assume.
I could show how one packs
Stuff in narrower tracks,
But the format has since met its doom.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Obama has made it! Good news!
The US got a president who's,
With sincere perseverance
And dark-skinned appearance,
Won more votes endorsing his views.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Gynostemium: column uniting
The stamen and pistils, delighting
All florists. Gynoecium
Joins the androecium,
As in orchids—result: most inviting.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
In winter, whenever I could,
I kindled my stove. It felt good.
I used natural fuel
And began, as a rule,
With some culpons: small segments of wood.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"Off to Cordoba," M bade me hie.
Go to Mexico, not knowing why?
Argentina? Or Spain?
By a boat, bus or plane?
I need intel to work as a spy.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Emulation denotes the endeavour
To equal or better whatever
Your rivals achieve,
And it helps to believe
That you're cunning, and not merely clever.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Dieffenbachia, popular plant:
Grown indoors it's a beauty, I'll grant.
But I nibbled on some;
Now it seems I'm struck dumb —
I would tell you some more, but I can't.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
Were you deaf, or ignoring me, mister,
When I said stay away from my sister?
Now you're gonna get bloody.
(If ignorance, buddy,
Is bliss, I'd guess you'd be a blister.)

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"A hung parliament? Surely you're jokin'!"
Yes, the voters of Britain have spoken,
And they all disagree.
Sounds normal to me—
Who says our democracy's broken?

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
This handbasket's shaped like a melon—
Disaster-bound, mastless. Magellan
Couldn't sail this ungainly
Contraption—it's plainly
Well-suited for going to hell in.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
To be Christian, how do you begin?
You accept Jesus Christ, then you're in.
You've transgressed; you're impure—
But the "baptism cure"
Will now cleanse your original sin.

limerick_list.author: GAD
limerick_list.text:
Gather 'round this electric invention!
It improves health and muscular tension
Through induced stimulation
Known as faradization,
Curing ills far too sundry to mention!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Good luck if you try to tell jokes
To some agelasts (humorless folks).
They are all out of whack
With a levity lack.
Not one crack of a smile will you coax.

limerick_list.author: jayrusalem
limerick_list.text:
A stockbroker parent, ol' chap,
Will share slang with you—learn it ASAP.
A biter of ankles
Means "kiddie who rankles."
(Though in stocks, it's a term for small cap.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend Bernie, though bright, as a rule,
Is ejected from classes at school.
He's a cut-up; each joke
Makes us laugh till we choke,
But his clownishness brands him a fool.

limerick_list.author: Tana
limerick_list.text:
My old house has developed a slant.
I've tried to repair it, but can't.
The whole problem, it seems,
Are some holes in the beams
That were made by a carpenter ant.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My grandfather slyly reminds me
That he hopes that the Yankee team signs me.
And while Cleveland's the worst,
I said yes to them first.
Still… it's only my promise that binds me.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm stunned by the awesome array
Of bridgework we're seeing today.
My dentist now fusses
With girders and trusses,
When once his concern was decay.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
The Czechs who inhabit Bohemia,	
The offbeat who love academia,
Souls unconventional
(Multi-dimensional),
Gypsies, and artists extremia.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Small-town opera: we wanted to sing
A new aria writ for the king.
And then just as we'd sought,
The king's conscience was caught.
In this hamlet, the play's not the thing.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's that flying above, in between
The high branches? A green Philippine
Parrot's kept us enthralled.
Seems a cagit it's called,
But to cage it would really be mean.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"What's a bolter?" you ask? "What's the deal?
Did he bolt things of copper or steel?"
Not at all. He (or she)
Had this job: oversee
All the sifting of flour or meal.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Deep within your computer I hide,
And my usefulness can't be denied.
From the memory I choose
All the data you'll use—
Your address bus, I'm many bits wide.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In Bilbao some inhabitants shun
Learning Spanish and live by the gun.
They're resolved in their bid
To be free of Madrid,
So their culture can Basque in the sun.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Okay, students, now let's be meticulous
Concerning the Latin colliculus.
It's a small elevation
Above any station —
Not railway, you dolt! That's ridiculous!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The teenager titters and teases
With skirts to her knees, as she eases
Her feet into hose
Known as bobby socks—those
Reach her ankles; in winter, she freezes!

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
At Altamont Raceway, the Stones
Had Hells Angels protecting their bones.
Then the bikers, in rage,
Killed a fan near the stage—
Outdoor concerts were now combat zones.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Tonight, after work, I am shopping
For tools to assist me in lopping
The top off my hedge—
Like a bill, with an edge
Called a bill-hook, for cutting and chopping.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A chauvinist swine named Devine
Feels that women are basically fine
In his bedroom or kitchen
(Except when they're bitchin'),
And for hanging his shirts on the line.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Fluid ounces, pounds, measures like these
Most folks globally see with unease.
Understand cubic inch?
In the States, it's a cinch.
Other places, think 16 cc's.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
As the son of a slavegirl, Blind Boone
Never had that proverbial spoon,
But, with talent in bags,
He made riches from rags
As he artfully tailored each tune.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Surf's up!" Need I say any more?
We all jam in the jeep for the shore.
If we're crowded and  cramped,
We don't notice, we're amped—
Energetic and hyped to the core.

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
Politicians who vote for a war
After dodging one, decades before,
Earn the "chicken hawk" name;
It's a label of shame
For behavior that's hard to ignore.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Asked Horsa, 'A Welshman, hwæt's him?'
Said Hengest, 'Look West to the rim
Where the Christians cringe
In their wild Celtic fringe:
He's an Irishman who cannot swim.'

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
It seems that whatever I say,
My support keeps on ebbing away.
I must try to connect,
Earn the voters' respect,
Or they'll throw me from office one day.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
You'll be waylaid and robbed if you seek
A new house. You'll be 'left up the creek'
In the wild ambuscade
The home market has made—
That's unless you've the wealth of a sheik.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Honey, what happened next?  Let me guess!
But first, where did you get that cute dress?
This soufflé is divine—
Sweetie, pass me some wine—
Now, where was I, my dear?  (I digress.)

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
If you're making some abrogative laws,
Your intent is abolishing flaws.
You can swiftly revoke
Rules that served as a joke,
Or support for one's personal cause.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
Transferases we prefix amino
(The transaminase enzymes that we know)
Promote amination.
Will this explanation
Make me a Nobel nominee? No.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Radiation? The treatment is gross!"
Jodie said; she was feeling morose.
"Since I've been diagnosed,
The effect I fear most
Is the total, the cumulative dose."

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
We are nine wickets down; just stay calm.
Needing thirty's no cause for alarm,
For the game can be won,
Just be ready to run
On ball six; for the bowling I'll farm.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The three Graeae shared one roving eye,
Maybe gray, like their hair. Scarce supply
Let a bright, crafty youth
Hold their eye and sole tooth
As ransom for knowledge. How sly.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Artist Thomas Hart Benton, with zest,
Painted life in the rural Midwest;
And he found he could sell
All his paintings quite well,
But the cowboys and landscapes sold best.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
I'll call acrocyst simply a sac
Which all the non-hydroids will lack,
And which ova pass through,
In my aim to eschew
Zoological yakety-yak.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My body's not toned, somewhat plump.
I don't jog and no iron I pump.
Still, this dadbod of mine
All the gals say is fine.
(Doesn't hurt that I'm richer than Trump.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our curriculum's blended, holistic,
But our dean finds that witless, simplistic.
He commands: "Departmentalize,
And thus transcendentalize!"
I find his position sadistic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The Phocidae surely are  peerless.
You can tell they're true seals, as they're earless.
Each waved at our skipper
A black, shiny flipper,
As they swam near our boat. Man, they're fearless!

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Willem Kolff showed that dialyzation
Could replace failing renal filtration;
And he did it, what's more,
In the thick of the war,
While resisting the Reich's occupation.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A chaiwallah's something to be
If you're eager to earn a rupee.
It's his job to serve up
A delectable cup
Of that sweet, spicy Indian tea.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
That mistake ought to make your face red; it
Was hard not to laugh when you said it.
A face saver supplies
The excuse (maybe lies)
That is keeping your street-cred in credit.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We ordered our drinks long ago,
But the service is hopelessly slow.
We'll more quickly imbibe
If we slip him a bribe—
Some baksheesh. Have ya got any dough?

limerick_list.author: rbalexx
limerick_list.text:
Though I'm bone tired and feeling quite sick,
Since you're here, there's a bone I must pick
With you, as your kid
Threw a rock and then hid.
Fix the glass.  As for him, use this stick.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
The frame of this clamp forms a C;
Screw it closed—it resembles a D.
It holds tight when I glue
What I've broken in two.
It sure suits that ol' task to a T.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I ship liquor abroad by the quart,
Packed in crates labeled Products for Sport.
With officials I struggle,
As bribes I must juggle."
"Do you smuggle?" I shrug. "I export."

limerick_list.author: agingjb
limerick_list.text:
Cadmium orange, it's said,
Isn't needed by purists; instead,
Here is more than a hint:
When a fruit needs that tint,
Mix cadmium yellow and red.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
An ampulla? A flask made of glass.
And?  A cruet that priests use in Mass.
Now, since Jack there in back
Answered "membranous sac",
He will move to the head of the class.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Get a room," said my mom.  "I suggest
That to go somewhere private is best.
Though your kissing's okay
As a public display
Of affection, put petting to rest."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Fizzy bubblement garners attention:
Flash and swirl's the coquette's best invention.
If done well, it attracts
Sparkling gewgaws and acts
That yours truly's too proper to mention.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
A new donor of blood, Percy Peters,
Was assailed by computerized meters.
He was giving and kind,
Yet those brutes didn't mind
When they took his young life (and six litres).

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
"Can you not find a sure way to cure us
Of this dastardly tapeworm coenurus?
It has given us staggers,
More deadly than daggers!"
Baa-ed the sheep, "Farmer Jones, reassure us!"

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
The savant further claimed and appended,
"No rational person's offended
By truth that I speak.
More on issues you seek?
You're a more-on.  (No pundit intended.)"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When two variates vary in tandem,
Statisticians can help understand 'em.
Correlations between
Deviations from mean
Make covariance measures non-random.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Your music's too loud — get a clue!
'Cause you're making the rest of us stew.
Would some dynamite chase
Out your bass-thumping case?
Why not see what your boom box can do?

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
"My bodily fluids are ready,
And I bawdily want you," said Freddy.
"Your bawdy request
Leaves me oddly distressed
In my body," said Greta, unsteady.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Now that weeks of your work have been missed,
Staying home, you can make your own list.
You're in lockdown, on furlough,
With oodles of Merlot.
No wonder the nation's half pissed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm so smart, I beat God playing chess!
I'm so dumb, to a child I regress.
I'm so brilliant, I'm solar!
—You say it's bipolar
Disorder I've got? How'd you guess?

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Traffic slows to a halt and that's that.
Cars can't move, so you're stuck there and sat
In a gridlock where you
Have to stew in the queue
Till it clears. Then you head for your flat.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
"My life," said the bug, "is bucolic,
Because I am ametabolic.
I'm not rearranged,
My form is unchanged.
Metamorphosis? No!  I just frolic."

limerick_list.author: OxfordVictor
limerick_list.text:
Under absolute privilege, you
Can just say what you like: I can't sue.
I may strongly deny,
But no action will lie,
Even though what you say is untrue.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Crossing-over's the swapping of genes.
Growing cells can display what that means:
Equivalent snips
Of chromosome strips
Interchange, though they're packed like sardines.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At Dee's party, we'll happily maffick.
Her book that is biogeographic
Is grand; it tracks species
In space and time. Gee, she's
The maven of animal traffic!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
You're puzzled and can't understand
How your broker lost twenty-five grand?
When he'd pick out a stock,
It would sink like a rock.
Now his brokerage wants to expand.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What goes down, then goes up, then goes down?
It's the average of Wall Street renown,
Called Dow Jones. This device is
An index of prices
That causes a smile or a frown.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
When you're centrally placed you are able
To converse with more folks at your table.
And in politics too,
The more centrist your view
The more people will listen, not label.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Columbia, NASA space shuttle,
Encountered a problem quite subtle.
When foam struck its wing,
Thermal tiles took a ding;
It contrived all our high hopes to scuttle.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Agapornis (or African lovebird):
That fig-eatin' high-up-above-bird!
	He takes up a wife
	And keeps her for life,
Unlike that adulterous dove-bird.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
In astrology, ages ago,
The word cardines surely you'd know.
It meant "cardinal points"—
The celestial joints;
With some guidance, your future they'd show.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You're a drunkard, my friend, on the brink
Of disaster; it's worse than you think,
If when ending a snooze,
It's not coffee, but booze
That's your eye-opener—very first drink.

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
For the wrinkles she wants to erase,
She gets botulin (only a trace!).
If the needle should slip
To her shoulder or lip,
She'll be pouting and wearing a brace.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
"All these spikelets have florets, my dear,"
Said the grain farmer showing the ear,
"And each has to compete
In this tight spike of wheat.
(Only plump ones will pay for my beer.)"

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
David Bowie is dead, a Blackstar
Up in space. Ziggy's played his guitar.
Half the world is laid Low
Now that all of us know
Bowie no longer Is, yet we Are.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"On your cornea's edge there are pits,
Shallow dellen, which need a quick spritz,"
Says my doctor, while snipping
The sclera and quipping,
"Here's mud in your eye!" as he spits.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I asked questions, at first, to romance her:
"What's your vice and your birthday?"  Her answer:
"By tobacco I'm beckoned,
And June twenty-second."
"How appropriate, then.  You're a Cancer."

limerick_list.author: Anonymity
limerick_list.text:
The cotton plant's seed is the source
Of gossypol—I feel remorse;
Now my sperm count is nil.
Damn that gossypol pill!
I should've used condoms (of course).

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
The curse would pass over and spurn
Every house that had blood on its durn.
Then said Pharaoh: "Depart!
I'll give you a start…"
The Jews left old Egypt astern.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A shut-in who lived in a hut
Liked to gaze at the waterfront, but
When the trees grew to block
His nice view of the dock,
Chopping all of them down was clear-cut.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
I derive just a scruple of pleasure
From knowing apothecaries' measure.
That three of their drams
Equal twelve metric grams
Is a fact I can tell at my leisure.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
To frolic means gambol or play
In a lively or spirited way.
Most gambols are merry
And therefore are very
Much fun to indulge in each day.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Double eagles are mentioned in wills
Although face value's just twenty bills.
Each such coin in your hand
Should fetch over a grand.
Got a box? Move to Beverly Hills.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My sagacious old grandmother said,
"You should never eat crackers in bed,
As the crumbs on the sheet
Make you itch, head to feet.
Eat them down in the kitchen, instead."

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
There she stood, blushing bride, in the church.
For the groom her folks went out to search.
By his absence was he
Flagged conspicuously.
Yes, he'd left that poor girl in the lurch.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When we get to the zoo we make bee-lines
For the cheetahs and tigers—the felines,
Our favorite mammals—
Not llamas, or camels,
Or manatees, orcas, or sea-lines.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Extracting cube roots to infinity
Can help to preserve your virginity.
When given to boys
This chore removes noise
And creates a more peaceful vicinity.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Acanthi are famed, for a leaf
That's a classical sculpture motif.
These mauve and white bloomers
(According to rumors)
Look great as a teddy bear brief.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
When we feared that Katrina might kill
Ole Fats Domino (hardly a thrill),
How we wept and we moaned!
How we welled up and groaned!
How we cried upon Blubbery Hill!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Blue Boy, I'm sure, thinks he's cute
In his 12-button velvety suit.
Is that make-up he's wearing?
And check out his bearing—
That pose! And those shoes! What a fruit!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Old Sunderlin had a long beard;
For decades it hadn't been sheared.
Facial hair grew around
Him and wound to the ground
'Til one Monday he just disappeared.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
Val
limerick_list.text:
So your gums went all puffy and red,
And your molars were pulled from your head?
Grin and bare it; though plastic,
Your smile's still bombastic
With dentures now gleaming instead.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
She effaced herself, modest and shy;
And when pressured would meekly comply.
One assertiveness course,
And she filed for divorce,
As she calmly took leave of her guy.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
That foolish coyote can't crack me,
Though he constantly tries to attack me
With anvils and kits
That explode into bits.
I'm the best, ne plus ultra, and acme.

limerick_list.author: Graig Gigol
limerick_list.text:
On his birthday, King Henry the 1st,
After eating some Cajun-spiced wurst,
Said, "We thought for a 2nd
It was juicy; we reckoned
We would eat it to lower our 3st."

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
If you're quizzed on the celiac trunk
In a test, then you're possibly sunk.
It's an artery seen
Near the liver and spleen.
Say 'a celery tree' and you'll flunk.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Moshe tore up his cultural roots.
Being German, he reasoned, best suits.
But the Waffen-SS
Called him "Jew" nonetheless,
And he died hanging up by his boots.

limerick_list.author: Jayson Lockwood
limerick_list.text:
This relationship has no longevity,
Though we talk and share moments of levity.
There's one fault, in my eyes;
You're of adequate size,
But apply it with frustrating brevity!

limerick_list.author: poi
limerick_list.text:
If you notice a six-carbon group
Sharing one big covalent-bond soup,
The shape of that thing,
Which we call benzene ring,
Is a planar hexagonal loop.

limerick_list.author: Miss Mimi
limerick_list.text:
Our choir is a little off-beat,
And the sermon?  You'll squirm in your seat.
If you live through all that,
There'll be cookies and chat—
Our coffee hour cannot be beat!

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
A cinema not-so-resplendent
Presents us with films independent.
It's a 100-seater,
This little art theater,
With only one ticket attendant.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
If it's craniosacral, the nerve
Will facilitate functions that serve
To allow us to rest,
Get aroused, and digest—
Several functions I'd like to preserve.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Having failed at attracting a quorum
To the "Manners and Etiquette" forum,
The group fell to blows
While comparing their clothes —
A deplorable breach of decorum.

limerick_list.author: PdeG
limerick_list.text:
It is strange what we hear in a name.
Force of habit is, maybe, to blame.
Breast of lamb we may eat.
Chest of lamb isn't meat,
Though no doubt it would taste just the same.

limerick_list.author: Anonymity
limerick_list.text:
Ergosterol stubbornly dwells
In the membrane of all fungal cells.
It's in yeast. It's in mold.
It's the sterol, I'm told,
That an azole-based medicine quells.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Word shortening's a practical wheeze
To make everyday speech flow with ease.
E.g. glamorous — glam:
That describes what I am.
Dazzling; gorgeous and ready to please.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Is there anything vague or obscure on
The dendrites attached to your neuron?
They bring messages in,
So protect them from sin:
Don't you turn any porn that's impure on!

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
The letters Cu stand for copper,
Or cuprum if you are more proper.
But now when you send
A quick text to your friend,
Saying cu, they serve as a stopper.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
I had been in the crow's nest awhile,
Looking out was my duty: espial.
I was bored, I suppose,
When I yelled, "Thar she blows!"
I got ten of the best with no trial.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
If your BP, too high, is at fault,
Eating fat and fried food you must halt.
Are you stressed? Wear no frown.
Do you smoke? Cut it down.
Start a diet — and eat much less salt.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Said the doc to my overwrought missus,
"False pregnancy, that is what this is.
One can't get with child
From a love life that's mild,
Comprising just pats, hugs and kisses!"

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
The pitchman extolled with great urgency
The strength of his product's detergency.
"Not only for stains,
It can even clear drains:
It will tackle your cleaning emergency!"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
An old scroll suggests Jesus was wed.
Scholars argue about what it said.
Sacred mysteries inside
Or a list from his bride:
Five fishes and two loaves of bread?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Hemophilia, Glanzmann's, leukemia,
HIV, and aplastic anemia.
Every one's a disease
Of the blood—as are these:
Thalassemia, polycythemia.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
As he sought something striking and new,
Richard Dawkins appeared a bit blue.
Then, surveying the lab,
His eye lit on a crab —
Did the shellfish gene give him a clue?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
That great book that I bought when in town
I'd espied way up high by the crown
Of an arch in the store.
This thick tome I adore —
Anti-gravity. Can't put it down.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
In April of 1906
San Francisco was knocked off its bricks.
When the big one hit town
It took everything down
To a jumble of mortar and sticks.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The king, once empow'red and anointed,
Was left, when his time was appointed,
After furies' four horses
Had run their four courses,
Unmanned, disembow'led, and disjointed.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
I'm twilight concealing the pimps.
I'm the dusk for crepuscular shrimps.
I'm the gloaming for Scots
And, like babies in cots,
Around Dartmoor I'm sometimes called dimps.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He's a Bolshie, my former friend Fred—
A card-carrying commie, a Red,
An admirer of Lenin.
You'd need antivenin
To clear these ideas from his head.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB and skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Doggone Feds say my taxes are due.
Doggone creditors threaten to sue.
Doggone salespeople phone—
Folks don't leave me alone.
When I'm gone, dawg, those hassles are through.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
You can call me a tomboy, but gee,
What I think when I look at a tree
Is, "How high can I go?"
So the first thing to know:
Is it climbable?  Let's go and see.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An archchamberlain works for a king
In those states that to monarchy cling.
His role may be vital,
But not so his title—
An archsteward's the very same thing.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
An eleve (pupil or learner)
May not be a genius like Turner.
For example, at school,
I liked acting the fool—
Joked around, but of work was a spurner.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
The king in his coffin reposes
On a catafalque covered in roses.
Thus lifted on high
He offends not the eye
And, moreover, offends not our noses.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Dilacerate? Tearing apart—
Here on corpsie I've made a nice start.
As a cannibal cook,
First the bones I unhook.
All my methods are here on this chart.

limerick_list.author: Harper
limerick_list.text:
When alarum is called in a play,
The cast scurries every which way.
All the actors take flight
As if in great fright,
And the villains get cleanly away!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A curmudgeon has angioplasty,
And finds his angina has passed. He
Is free of the strain
Of the cardiac pain
And the pills, but he's still a bit nasty.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Though the car-buying gurus suggest
Many dozens of things you should test,
I'm a Coke-drinking man
And a cupholder fan:
If one's handy, forget all the rest.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Bears are plantigrade quadrupeds – ooh!  —
Got four legs and go sole-walking, too.
They're carnivorans, but
That's not open and shut:
Giant pandas eat mainly bamboo.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Though I really don't want to intrude,
Your bdelygmia (hatred of food)
Is a shame, I must say,
For you're wasting away
From the meals you've completely eschewed.

limerick_list.author: Doug Smeath
limerick_list.text:
When giving a public address,
Don't get yourself bogged down in stress.
Just speak with precision
And try to envision
The crowd in a state of undress.

limerick_list.author: Evan Schiller
limerick_list.text:
The baritone range is depressed —
Sure, it's deeper than most of the rest.
But it simply can't face
That the deepest is bass,
And it's no good to be second best.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Last year, down in west Cameroon,
Many folks got wiped out by typhoon.
In the blink of an eye
Lots of genes went "bye bye."
Genetic drift:  when some genes just "self-prune."

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Though our love-making session was done,
You did not have to just cut and run.
It made me red-faced
When you left in such haste—
I'd just mused about names for our son...

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Polly proffers huge platters of endive:
Bitter veg into which rarely men dive.
Though that green's not a hit
For most guys, I admit
When I'm drunk into it I can then dive.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
You teed off for a round at the club,
Then nipped out for a round at the pub,
But showed little remorse.
Now you're banned from our course.
You have acted delinquently, bub.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Angelenos are given to boast
Of their warm, sunny home on the Coast,
But they all will be humbled
When earthquakes have rumbled:
LA will be nothing but toast.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You've no doubt that your Bob is a sneak.
And his nurse—Oh, my God!  That physique?
One could laugh at your fear
That he'll leave you "some year"—
She's seducing him now as we speak.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
For breakfast, here comes Aunt Jemima;
She knows that I'm no wisenheima.
Her syrupy grace
Stuffs a hungry man's face.
There's no waffling — no food is sublima.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Aluminum sulfate I'm scanning.
In paper it's used, and in tanning,
And there even may be
Al2(SO4)3
In your water.  Just ask City Planning.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
At great cost you've contrived to allay
All our fears, so we ought to repay
You for making a stand
On behalf of us and
Your resulting expenses defray.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"When the hoopla abates, then I trust
We will see things more clearly.  The dust
Will have settled.  The light
Of the future shines bright."
(Good thing time heals our utter disgust.)

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
My entire frame's itching; it's chewed
By a mite (Doc says scabies — seems rude).
Crotamiton's Doc's pitch
To put paid to my itch.
His plan: "Slather your body, while nude."

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
In a language like Classical Greek,
Use the aorist verb form (how chic!).
It gives no indication
Of an action's duration
Or completion, thus adding mystique.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
A bull terrier's anything but
A great beauty. This ill-favoured mutt
Shows a shortness of leg,
Has a head like an egg,
And keeps his eyes practically shut.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You'll remember Cain, Abel, Eve, Adam,
The First Children, the First Sir and Madam.
Eve 'n' Adam asked God
To please give them the nod:
Beget kids — so they went out and had 'em.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The daffodils Wordsworth espied
Lived till summer,  then  all of them died,
But the ones in his head,
Till the old man was dead,
Went on dancing, like phantoms, inside.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Then he slaughtered a hapless phoebastria,
As he thought it might have dextrogastria.
Was its stomach displaced?
But he foundered, disgraced,
And went down like the M.S. Lancastria.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Adam chastised his wife for her slight.
"Evie, eating that apple's not right!"
"Don't scold me, my dear,
That cute snake made it clear
We'd gain wisdom, so here, have a bite!"

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A small sign said DK on that car,
But the driver, though seen from afar,
Didn't look like a Dane;
It was disc jockey Jane
I had met once in Spain, in a bar.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Called stormcock (she sings in the rain),
She eats berries and worms, in the main.
Miss Li'l Thrush should beware —
She's become now more rare.
Endangered? She's gone down, the draine.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
What a prize you are—state of the art,
Rare and sweet as a raspberry tart.
Your fair features torment
Me—with marzipan scent.
Bella Coelia, you're breaking my heart.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Aging hippies remember it well.
Country Joe and the Fish gave a yell
To the peace-and-love throng,
Near a half million strong:
"What's that spell?! — What's that spell?! — What's that spell?!!"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
As our steamer's provisioned and coaled,
A harsh drama is seen to unfold.
Dockers lading supplies
Meet a sudden demise:
Heavy cargo's crashed hard to the hold.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
It's a cinch that the ball fell behind
Where our tennis court's vividly lined.
I'm astounded—it sounds
Like he found it in bounds.
I'm convinced that the linesman is blind.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Best advice? I'd stay out of her way.
She debuts tonight: Boston Ballet.
Let her weep, rant and vent;
It's forbearance well spent.
She's consumed with excitement today.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
"Stones are cumbrous," says Sol, "as a rule.
This huge sandbag? A load for a mule.
But both burdens combined
Are less weighty, you'll find,
Than the heavy brute wrath of a fool."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"Hey! This land is your land and my land,"
Said the King to the people of Thailand.
"But I can't stand the heat
So I plan to beat feet
To a temperate clime in Rhode Island."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Bed 19's 85. She said, "Please,
Doctor, help me," but nobody sees
Just what's wrong, so to me
It's just COPD,
As in "chronic old person's disease."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A stray bullet struck down Tarleton's horse.
Then his British and Loyalist force,
With their sabers, attacked
And, in butchery, hacked
The surrendering men — no remorse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A caftan is long and it's wide;
It has plenty of volume inside.
Mine's enough room for two,
So remember when you
May be seeking a good place to hide.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
N objects are ordered, and you
Switch consecutive pairs two by two.
All reorders you get
Will comprise a new set
Called an alternating group when you're through.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend, the cryptographer Schroeder,
Labored long to become a decoder.
Day and night he'd be slaving,
Not bathing or shaving,
So I knew he was there by his odor.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Its small rounded leaflets appear
Like buttons on fronds, but it's clear
That the plant button fern
Still has plenty to learn:
No buttonholes anywhere near.

limerick_list.author: Randall Hamilton
limerick_list.text:
I caress her so softly and caringly;
She recoils and she leers at me glaringly!
She clearly detests it!
She never requests it!
(I only attempt it quite sparingly.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though she isn't a frequent complainer,
Jane was pained as she spoke of her drainer:
"Sure, the pullet was yummy,
But the draining board's gummy,
And the chicken fat's clogged up my strainer!"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Oh, the agony felt when you left!
Excruciation! Alone and bereft,
How can I explain?
Like a sharp, acute pain:
Just imagine my heart with a cleft.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Dichromats see limited color:
Only two.  Such a view must be duller.
Without reds, greens, or blues,
They miss critical cues
And might choose the wrong shirt, paint, or cruller.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Uncle Stan's not my favorite man.
I avoid him whenever I can.
He's a doubter, a skeptic;
He's dour, dyspeptic.
I'm glad that he's moved to Japan.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'll be dropped BTWside some day.
I can tell BTW people say,
"Your Miss Muffet will steal
Daily curds for her meal
Yet, quite honestly, still BTW."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We're withdrawing; the purchase fell through.
There's a lien and huge tax bills are due.
Till those loads came to light,
We were sold on the site.
The encumbrances darkened the view.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our new goalie came cheap at the price.
On each shot, tight as white is on rice,
He maneuvers and blocks
In the red-bordered box.
In his crease, he's the king of the ice.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Deviation's my now-and-then style:
Consternation in friends makes me smile.
Though I'm often more normal
(To the prom I went formal),
I exorbitate once in a while.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Cook some sugar-cane juice in a still —
What comes out is the pride of Brazil.
All the people's demands
For the 4000 brands
Of cachaça, distillers fulfill.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Those who dis the Olympics won't know
That its discus sport's this: discus throw.
They also won't know a
Top-notch discus thrower
Will throw a great discus-based show.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A garroter is one, it would seem,
Who deals death in a way most extreme.
His poor victims expire
As a rope or a wire
Is pulled taut round their necks, though they scream.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We Pittsburghers never complain
That the name of our U. is Duquesne.
Though an underschooled esne
Might venture doo-KEZ-nee,
doo-KAIN's what we say without strain.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
With my pound I can now buy much less,
So I cannot afford a new dress.
If I just buy the sleeves
Then the shortfall it leaves
Will be barely enough to impress.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
At Hungary's heart, east and west
Of the Danube, lie Buda and Pest,
Below forest-lined bends
Where the river bed wends
And where wild Magyar tribes came to rest.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though this photo is blurry and smeared,
It reveals that, alas, as I feared,
That sea mammal, for real,
Is not a true seal,
But a sea lion. See? It is eared!

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
The beggar who lived by the city gate
Had a fault that no virtue could mitigate:
You'd to open your purse
And give alms, or he'd curse
You most heartily, i.e., delitigate.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
When Jason's friend Jay moved away,
He'd not see him for many a day.
Now that Jay has moved near,
(This is touching!) it's clear:
Through adjacency, Jason sees Jay.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
I may look like a cabbage (a fool),
But no way I'm as green as that, cool?
Just try pulling a fast one;
You'll find it's your last one.
I'll smack you so hard that you'll drool.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
An aroma so putrid — it meant
That the family had reason to vent,
"Why must visitors squeal
That we make the paint peel?"
In their genes is the trace of descent.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Amazon River will swell
When the weather is rainy as hell,
And then up to the skies
Thirty feet it will rise,
Plus it might be the longest as well.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Fearsome Chlodovech, King of the Franks,
Cut his way to the top of the ranks.
And in Rome's ruination
He founded a nation,
As Frenchmen remember with thanks.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
On the day that Matilda gives birth
Comes a moment that fills her with mirth:
As her husband talks wildly
Of angels, she mildly
Smiles, as she's more down to earth.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Naval ensigns have history to thank
For the name of their rather low rank
(Like a second lieutenant) —
They'd take the ship's pennant
(Her ensign) on deck as she sank.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
An unfortunate lady named Ella
Was given the push by her fella
On account of B.O.;
She just didn't know,
Because her best friends wouldn't tell her.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Submerged in the lake was my Honda,
Then crushed by a large anaconda.
He swallowed my car
And grew larger by far.
He combatted his fat with Jane Fonda.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
It's not hard to commute in D.C. —
A free ride when you're with the VP.
But steer funds to the Hill
And you're jammed there until
You agree to say, "Please pardon me."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
While re-sanding our old hardwood floor,
I found dust very hard to ignore.
Now my new dustless vacuum
Sucks all to the back room.
Extraction has lessened the chore.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In this demiworld, hoodlums and thugs
Have a culture that's centered on drugs.
Each develops a need—
Whether weed, H, or speed,
And for money to buy it, each mugs.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Proper diallel mating dictates
That each female gets two or more mates.
Then offspring are tested;
An answer requested:
Which parent is transmitting traits?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In front of this vast congregation,
I confess that I practice cenation
Three times daily. It's true,
And I hope you do too!
When we don't, we're inviting starvation.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I love cackle fruit, scrambled or fried,
With a few greasy links on the side.
Said my doctor, "You need
Fewer eggs in your feed."
"Oh, I'm eating more tofu," I lied.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A chara's a term that you might
Start a letter with if you're polite
And you're Irish, refined,
Of a business-like mind,
And Acushla just wouldn't seem right.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Christmas Day's celebration told how
Christ the Saviour was born. Sadly now
From September the shops
Gaily pull out the stops
To sell all that four months will allow!

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
I know there is not much regard
For the old and archaic decard,
But you do save a letter.
(Does that make it better
Than its synonym cousin discard?)

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Apantomancy's seeking a vision
To forecast your future condition.
An animal's actions
Or random distractions
Can guide a forthcoming decision.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Though Joe by the circus was hired,
Of his flying fear they'd become tired.
Now the cannonball king
Has just had his last fling—
And this time, he's really been fired.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The batter is digging right in,
So the fun is about to begin.
I'll be brushing him back
With a pitch he can't whack—
Baseball music to tune up his chin.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When Chaucer said something was drad,
He implied that its outlook was bad.
It was something that's dreaded,
Like being beheaded.
That clear? Just a tad? Well, I'm glad.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE and zqms
limerick_list.text:
A commemorator, that's what I am.
I commemorate Walter and Sam.
I've a Facebook page for them,
For the crowds who adore them:
The two look so cute in their pram.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Telling pooches to cwtch means "lie down"
When you're each in some cushy Welsh town.
If you want to look butch,
Then you'd better not cwtch
The dogs' owner—he'll shoot you a frown.

limerick_list.author: Jeter Coffee
limerick_list.text:
Road repairmen, named Willie and Walt,
Had their paving work come to a halt.
A huge chunk of the street
Slowly sank 'neath their feet.
"Don't blame me, Walt, that's your big ass fault."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Try counterpulsation and start
Getting help for your overworked heart.
A perfusion device
Pumps your blood in precise
Pitter-patters—it's state-of-the-art!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Want a  tan that can't fade for the beach?
A new product's within easy reach.
Try the handy Tan Fast Stick—
Results are fantastic!
Big bonus: the color won't bleach.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Adhered algae is fouling my yacht.
The crud's glued to my hull; it's near shot.
Add the barnacles, slime
And now tubeworms and grime—
My retirement is going to pot.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A fence or a border or bound
Can be said to contain or surround.
It might stop an escape,
Or, like bright yellow tape,
Limit crime scenes where bodies were found.

limerick_list.author: jsymmetry
limerick_list.text:
Any travel by air is my bane,
If by chopper, balloon, or by plane.
Once a friend turned to ash
In an aerial crash,
I decided to stick to the train.

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
When you're not feeling quite up to par,
And you've woken too early, by far,
What you need is caffeine!
Skip the milk, keep it lean,
And head straight for a large café noir!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Their demeanor's no longer benign.
They've turned fractious, unruly—the swine!
For disorderly mobs,
I've acquired from my jobs
Ways and miens to snap fools back in line.
