limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Carl Jung said that getting to know,
Through our middle-aged years as we grow,
Gender features we hide
(They're our opposite side)
Will free energy sleeping below.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
My child, you're now post-adolescent,
But your parasitism's incessant.
This host (half facetiously)
Fears you'll autoeciously
Live here until you're senescent.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You can call me an ass or a knucklehead,
Or a dope, or a dupe, or a chucklehead,
But to do so's not nice,
So I'll offer advice:
Just declare I'm your sweet honeysuckle-head.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
You cattails and rushes love muds
Where the earth periodically floods.
You're emergent; why care
If a pond is down there,
When your stalk's high and dry with your buds?

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
A novice French cook who was flustered
In making his very first custard
Used a hot bain-marie,
A device from Paris,
So his custard can now cut the mustard.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Our last port's where we'll wait out this gale.
Through a porthole, I just saw a whale!
This porthole's astarboard,
While the place we last harbored
Is leftward: aport. Let us sail.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Buckle bunny: a rodeo groupie
Who's willin' to give you some whoopee
Of a sexual sort
For the buckle you sport.
She's the schtuper and you are the schtupee.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
One's beliefs are both firm and held strong.
Though there's often no clear right or wrong,
Our free speech is the key,
And when we disagree
It's OK, if we still get along.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
If a bolshie Belfaster or Scot
Is ill-tempered or tetchy, then what
He'll be called is carnaptious
(Without being captious),
Whether having conniptions or not.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Our spinoff is carryin' its weight;
Time to allocate funds, no debate.
What we need is a loan...
Charlie? Hand me that phone.
Tinkers Bank?... Jacques Lemond... Allô, Kate?"

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
My name is an alias. Whether
I like being free of the tether
A real name can be
Is what I mean to see,
For I'm somebody else altogether.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm this website's main animateur.
Come on in! You'll enjoy us, I'm sure!
Writing limericks is clearly
A skill you'll love dearly,
An addiction for which there's no cure!

limerick_list.author: Jeff Russell
limerick_list.text:
If away from the earth you are fleein',
That direction is called apogean.
That's from apo, "away",
And the earth's g-e-a,
And the end of it all is a wee n.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
My new dip, I am told, is unholy.
It's agave and yucca, not slowly
But hastily thrashed
In a stir-fry, then mashed.
They say I should not wok amole.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cryoglobulins? Folks never cheer 'em
Or go near 'em—please not in my serum!
In the cold they form clumps—
Little bleedings and lumps
In one's skin and one's joints—so we fear 'em.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
As he readied himself for the plunge, he
Surveyed with misgiving the bungee.
He'd been told, "Some guys retch;
It's a heck of a stretch —
But the ground around here's really spongy."

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
My business is cold packs.  I'm selling
Bags of ice that can help reduce swelling.
Sadly, sales aren't so hot;
Guess the fact I forgot
To invest in a freezer is telling.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Encephalalgia (bedtime malaise)
Is my wife's new excuse. Through this phase
I'm frustrated and huff
At the latest rebuff...
And I dream of our pre-headache lays days.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A cryptogram's written in code.
Which, of course, is a difficult mode
To decipher. I try
As the hours fly by,
And by midnight, I'm fit to explode.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A pirate who's skillful can drub,
With his club, any guy in the pub,
Then induce the battalions
That guard Spanish galleons
To welcome him into their club.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Theodoric?  You're viewed with disdain.
Joan, the miller's wife, thinks you're insane,
As her daughter now pays
For your bloodletting ways.
There's no humor in draining a vein.

limerick_list.author: OxfordVictor
limerick_list.text:
My sycophant friends form a throng
Who'll agree and concur, though I'm wrong.
Whenever I speak
They'll never critique—
Concordantly nodding along.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
For a fast-paced romance, once he's met her,
Frank says contact by email is better.
But this PC-mad male
Forgets girls never fail
To be touched by a hand-written letter.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
A regrettable part of reality:
Meeting those with a twisted mentality
Who choose to use force
As a matter of course
And ignore the resulting brutality.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
There once was a farmer named Jim
Who beamed, full of joy to the brim,
When he saw udders swell.
Bovine dames rang his bell.
(We don't know what the cows thought of him.)

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Hid beside those troops standing inspection,
Our gunners escape their detection.
We'll chew them to bits
With an enfilade: blitz
Them with fire in a lengthwise direction.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Once you've found perfect joy in her kiss,
Take her home to meet Momma and Sis.
Married bliss you'll enjoy.
If she bears you a boy,
Please invite me (don't miss!) to the bris.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
This follow-my-leader we're playing
Involves no political swaying.
We just copy each stunt
Of the person in front:
He dictates; we pursue him, obeying.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
With triglycerides way off the chart,	
And HDL low, you might start
On clofibrate, a med
That physicians have said
Is a drug that just may save your heart.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Becky, how do you want the CDs?"
She replied, "Ditrichotomous, please."
Said our dad, intervening,
"Your sister is meaning:
In groups of some twos and some threes."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The disabled list reads A to Z:
Torn Achilles, the flu, twisted knee.
When a sprain or condition
Strikes any position,
A reliable bench is the key.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Work together! I'll wash and you dry,
And these dishes will practically fly.
From our chores we won't shirk,
"Many hands make light work":
We'll be done in the wink of an eye!

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
You've a crescent-shaped flaw, they advise.
Very close to the blind spot it lies.
It's Bjerrum's scotoma,
Observed in glaucoma,
A defect affecting your eyes.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
He's a backslapper, always the life
Of the party: he flatters your wife.
Just be careful that he,
With his compliments free,
Is not slyly concealing a knife.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On the Nile, you are likely to see a
Graceful sailboat. I'm sure you'll agree a
Lovely picture 'twill make,
If a snapshot you take
Of the boat that folks call dahabeeyah.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
It's a town in Nebraska, and he
Starred as Hawkeye in M*A*S*H on TV.
Here's a third and last hint:
This girl sang for a stint.
The name Alda applies to all three.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Out in Ferguson things were not right.
There was violence most every night.
The phrase "Hands up! Don't shoot"
Had become the salute
Of some citizens both black and white.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Your erroneousness? Hopeless, I fear.
You're proved wrong, yet you still persevere.
You're so badly mistaken,
Yet choose not to waken.
I'm sorry, we're done with you here.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
"Mrs. Blake, indeed, things are amiss:
 You've a block in your bundle of His.
 My advice must be heeded —
 The right pacemaker's needed;
 Then you'll live to one hundred in bliss."

limerick_list.author: Kim Le
limerick_list.text:
In a club in the forties he sat—
Of those swingers, the funkiest cat.
He would play bebop jazz,
Soulful, rhythmic pizzazz.
Man, that bebopper never played flat.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
A spider was seeking a treat. It
Found a butterfly, hoping to eat it.
But that butterfly oozed
Some acraein.  Confused,
That arachnid retreated and beat it.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"I'm perfectly sober!" he thundered,
But given his colour, I wondered.
His face a bright pink,
He made straight for the sink,
Held the sides, leant his head in and chundered.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The conman is quick to befool
A new mark; he will use any tool.
He'll concoct a sly ruse
To bemuse or confuse.
It's a hoax; don't be taken to school.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lose a limb? You will need a prosthesis,
As your cells, using cytokinesis,
Can't replace a lost leg—
Though they can make an egg.
This we study in Peg; she's our rhesus.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Five years' harvest: it's time to start over.
Next season, this field will grow clover
(Fixing nitrogen while
Making honeybees smile),
And I'll use it to exercise Rover.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A coder who's cursed with malaise,
And improvident programming ways,
By a slip of his hand
Wrote an "or"  for an "and".
Now his site has been down for six days!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Your hearing's so keen and acute
It has brought you a certain repute.
When I secretly pass
Just a smidgen of gas,
You're so shrewd you can hear my astute.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Say "ab urbe condita". Why?
It's what A.U.C. means to imply.
Count from Jesus' premiere:
Rome was built in that year
Minus DCCLIII.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"Cleopatra: I'll grab her and squeeze her,"
Mused Julius, then bade his men seize her.
Cleo doubted he'd sate her.
"I'll make my Marc later,
But for now I'll just tease this old geezer."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Like puppets they sit on his wing,
Apparatchiks restrained by his string.
Willing jokers and knaves,
Mindless flunkies, and slaves
To the fellow who thinks he's a king.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A chipmunk is little and furry,
And always, it seems, in a hurry.
I guess he's the prey
Other creatures waylay.
Is he tasty in pastry or curry?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Who knows binary numbers?  It's true
That my students who do are darned few.
Take a show, now, of hands:
See, 1 gal understands —
Now 1 more, so in total that's 10.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
A call is a useful device
To buy stock at a specified price,
Before expiration,
With no obligation
To buy if the market ain't nice.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
If your transport of ions is poor,
Your disease will be hard to endure.
Channelopathy strikes
At your cellular dykes,
Which don't work if they're made too secure.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
My mother is driving me crazy!
Always screaming, "My God, you're so lazy!"
What's her beef? Goodness me,
I get home before three,
And by noon I'm as fresh as a daisy.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
In The Student Prince movie it's not
Edmund Purdom (the Prince) who has got
A voice that pure and rich,
No – it's Mario's, which
Being audio-dubbed, hits the spot.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A roisterin' Croat named Goran
Loved drinkin', an' gamblin', and whorin'.
Balkin' friends voiced distaste
At his lewdness and waste.
He assured them, "They're all worth explorin'!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When your deadbeats owe varied amounts,
Your balance sheet might well announce:
"These payments have stalled."
This figure is called
An allowance for doubtful accounts.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
At tennis I lose, I regret—
Every point, every game, every set.
Why my lack of success?
I get "butterflies"—yes—
And am frightened to come to the net.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Edward Benjamin Britten can thrill,
And his England can claim that he will
Fill the bill and will last
As a great—won't pass fast.
His bold music's not run-of-the-mill.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Artful painter of color and light
With his work, Debussy's such a bright
Shining light in the list
Of composers who kissed
All our ears, putting hearts all aflight.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Don't go home yet—the night's not complete:
There's an after-party; join me, my sweet.
Bring your high from the rave,
Clean forget to behave,
And mix sweats with the showbiz elite.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In "he said it to her" quotes we share
From the lives of this unlikely pair.
In a myth it's related
They quite often dated,
The bishop and actress so fair.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
A new husband, who yelled himself hoarse,
Screamed, "It MUST be a matter of course.
With no coffee filter
A brew is off-kilter.
I swear this is grounds for divorce!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Her evening gown, silver and black,
Has a boat neck.  (She's proud of her rack!)
Running shoulder to shoulder,
It makes my lust smoulder.
It's deep in the front and the back.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Feeling hands in his pants, front and rear,
Roger paid close attention, no fear,
As, with care not to nip,
She released his stuck zip
(And she'll take a close look once it's clear).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This image, on screen, of a cruller
Is too bright; its true hue is much duller.
Since it's made up of dots,
You can mute many spots;
That's the beauty of nonsolid color.

limerick_list.author: cecelia
limerick_list.text:
A musician whose features are flat
Will never look sharp in a hat,
Though it's natural when hot—
Accidental  or not—
To let your hair down and sing scat.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A hard-throwing pitcher is Lee,
Whose fastball is real hard to see.
On this toss to the plate,
I unloaded too late,
And the ump pumped his fist with, "Strike three!"

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
My advice, while I live on this earth,
To all ladies is, give a wide berth
To men who are sweaty,
With hair like a yeti
That covers an oversized girth.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
There's a rhyme starting "Hey, diddle diddle."
And some stuff 'bout a cat and a fiddle,
And a dog and a spoon,
And a cow and the moon,
But who's diddling who? That's the riddle.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
There was something about uncle Vlad
Made our villagers fear they'd been had.
His fanged teeth, long black cape?
Puncture marks on the nape?
What possessed them to think Vlad was bad?

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
There are times when I feel sort of grim,
In my pity pool taking a swim.
I awaken each dawn
All alone.  Red is gone.
I get bluer just thinking of him.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
She grew careless. Her husband, on spec,
On her movements decided to check.
She was caught in the act,
In flagrante, and cracked,
"This is not what it seems, dear—aw, heck!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When from Egypt the Israelites fled,
Did they cross what is known as the Red
Sea? I'd say, "Yes, indeedy!"
But was it the reedy
(Calamiferous) waters instead?

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Bulbs belong in the soil, I recall;
And yet here on a stem? Sure they're small,
But these bulblets all grow
Where it's not apropos.
I'm surprised they develop at all.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
European, North African, Asian
(Southwest): all are places Caucasian.
That the white race arose
In the Caucasus shows
How a Caucasoid's not Australasian.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The conference wants a reaction
To her speech. I was bored to distraction,
Bored right out of my skull.
Soporifically dull,
This speaker brings on stupefaction.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Casablanca is ageless they say.
It's a true patriotic display.
Its agelessness means
That each one of its scenes
Reflects values still valid today.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The boards creak, and at first we deduce
That the flooring's installed to be loose.
Thus intruders are thwarted,
Assaults are aborted—
Or perhaps that's a floorer's excuse.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
He never ate birds' nests or whelps
While in China, our champion Mike Phelps.
He admits just one vice:
"Racing dolphin's quite nice—
You don't have to swim fast, but it helps."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In this moth family, one special genus
I seek with devotion and keenness.
I'll surely feel high a day
That I meet with Arctiidae:
Empyreuma, as lovely as Venus.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Bambi's dead—sadly roadkill, I fear.
It's called "venison," just to be clear.
Took a rump steak—the cut
From the animal's butt.
(Why at home, on the range, there's a deer.)

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
A parcel was given to me.
I was curious — what could it be?
But Mum said, "Just rip off
The cord and then strip off
The enwrapment, boy — then you will see!"

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
It's not quite according to Hoyle,
But let's soon set ourselves this new toil—
Let us rhyme Sherlock Holmes
Into anapest tomes
As by Conan and Christopher Doyle.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
There are things we were not meant to know!
Our design's for the LORD to bestow.
Do not tinker with life!
We shall bring nought but strife
If we gene-splice! Begone, GMO!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The automatist's very emphatic
That our actions are all automatic.
But if he's correct
About cause-and-effect,
Then why's our behavior erratic?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You've a fungal infection? That's rich!
Chromoblastomycosis? A bitch!
I'll be spreading the word
Right away: "Have you heard?
Joe's got warts on his legs and they itch!"

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Arabian jasmine's the scent
That I wear to a special event.
Not just known for its smell,
It makes great tea as well.
Think I'll plant some right here, near my tent!

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
You're ecaudate. The word makes you quail?
That just means you're without any tail.
Though in your case I'd guess,
Since you lack all finesse,
It just might mean with women you fail.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Ken Bradshaw, that Texan, the boss
Of all surfers: Instead of a hoss,
He rode a huge wave
That proved he was brave
With a record. He gathered no moss.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Ashkenazim are human Mom's team,
So I'm Jewish, or so it would seem.
But on beagle Mom's side,
We're distinct, bona fide
Mejicanos with years of esteem.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
It's a property held by a gene,
But just what does allelism mean?
Being one of a set
Whose distinct members let
Variation between us be seen.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
We won't win with one last desperate lunge.
Our chances have taken a plunge.
Let's admit our defeat
Since it's clear we won't beat
Our opponents. Let's chuck up the sponge.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Moctezuma said, "Here's ahuacatl,"
Speaking Nahuatl, with stops far from glottal.
Some conquistadors heard
Avocado. My word —
Oily lawyer juice, straight from the bottle!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our affair shouldn't cause you anxiety;
I'll conduct it with perfect propriety,
Biosocial—and it
Will be fully legit—
Love your bio, and crave your society!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Romanesque? To such churches I nod.
Though their scale may be massive, it's odd
That their style is immortal;
Curved archwise, each portal
Invites us to celebrate God.

limerick_list.author: Robert Reynolds
limerick_list.text:
If you're looking for that which can ale you,
Something stout without doubt can regale you.
The surmise of the cops
That you're subject to hops
Doesn't have to be something to jail you.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
I'm an early adopter: I got
This new gizmo before it was hot.
I obtained one before
They were in every store.
But the very first? No, I was not.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
When the butcher proposes to cleave
That beast that he might call a beeve,
It's a bovine he prunes;
It is not Ward and June's
Young son Theodore. (This should relieve.)

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
I'm working today, though it's Sunday.
It's really not much of a Funday.
But these limericks that rhyme
Sure do help pass the time,
And I'll publish them, maybe, come Oneday.

limerick_list.author: Wattlebird
limerick_list.text:
The brave coureurs des bois scouted west
By canoe, distant trading obsessed.
These young men took a chance
In the woods of New France.
Known as wood-runners, furs were their quest.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
For a change to what's shown on TV,
These small disks have their place—as you'll see
When the weather is bad,
And the kids drive you mad,
Peace descends with a new DVD.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
His temper's stretched taut at the seams;
Shattered sleep is confounded by screams.
Formless visions, vague fears
Were the salt in his tears,
Amorphously haunting his dreams.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Not a braggart, I'm never a boaster;
Still my face graces Ride-a-Way's poster,
'Cause the size of my grin
Is as wide as the spin
From the hills and the loops of their coaster.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm sorry, this doesn't make sense.
Though your talent, I'm sure, is immense,
Fifty bucks for a kiss?!
Yes, you're beautiful, miss,
But I just can't afford the expense.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Mild-mannered reporter Clark Kent
Showed a friend how a hero's pose went:
"So here's the trick, Jimbo:
The stance is akimbo,
With hands on hips, so, and arms bent."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A troublesome jackanapes, Clarence,
Had lax and indulgent-ish parents.
Accepting such aesture
Was once called digesture:
Unwarranted brooking, forbearance.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A New Yorker and MTA rider,
I'm a gal people call an "East Sider."
I proudly reside
On Manhattan's East Side,
And Fifth Avenue? That's the divider.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
Afropop's not a cola Ebola,
Like a soda consumed in Angola.
It's pop music they play
In an African way.
It's heard worldwide. Now where's my payola?

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The word aardvark is Dutch for "earth pig."
Most pigs, though, have noses less big.
So when seeking ants out,
It makes use of its snout.
Doing elsewise would be infra dig.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The man's dewy-eyed troops of believers—
Are they blind or naïve self-deceivers?
Moonstruck babes in his thrall,
They're apologists all,
Deferential as drooling retrievers.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I knew early on, beyond doubt,
I was gay, and I wanted to shout,
But I hid.  My best friend
Said, "This torture must end,
So wherever you are, please come out."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a flaw I've just now put my paw on:
Inside straights I seem always to draw on.
I'm a mutt who loves cats.
Friends say, "Leave them!" and that's
A real bone of contention to gnaw on.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
The skipper grabbed hold of the wheel.
"Damn  it! Helmsman," he said. "What's the deal?
Go below if you can't
Keep this ship off a slant.
Hold it level, no lean, even keel."

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The school board's demanding compliance.
They'll try to enforce the alliance
We formed to ensure
That our rules could endure—
To abjure would be utter defiance.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This restaurant's cozy and small,
Neither posh nor a hole in the wall.
Penne pasta's the dish
(Portofino's delish!)
At our favorite bistro of all.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Moving here was one stupid mistake—
So inhumanly hot, for God's sake,
It could sauté your brain.
Man, I'd murder for rain.
In this hellhole, I'm just gonna bake.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Olden times, was a "gentleman caller" —
'60s found him a hang-in-the-maller.
Now bf finds gf
In Cancun or Kiev.
And this planet becomes that much smaller.

limerick_list.author: Nan
limerick_list.text:
When they put up the dam at Aswan,
Abu Simbel was going to be gone.
So they moved it uphill,
Where it gives us a thrill
As it glows on the shore in the dawn.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Counterplotting, we've fashioned a plan
To intrigue against foes in Iran.
We'll brand them as kooks,
Say they're dealing for nukes,
And then bomb them as hard as we can.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Will our torture plans ever be viable?
Ask our lawyers (who seem very pliable).
"Go ahead. Use the rack
Since we're under attack."
Just in case, make our orders deniable.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If good drainage you wish to attain
To protect your ground floor from the rain,
Dig a ditch, throw in stones,
Cover up, make no bones
About what you have made: a French drain.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
'Cross the moor came a blood-curdling sound.
"It's the hound!" cried poor Watson, "The hound!"
But then Holmes, through the fog,
Scoffed, "It's only a dog!
And we'll soon drag him off to the pound."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A woman with child cried, "Hey rummy!"
To a drunk who was getting too chummy.
"We're not friends.  I don't know
Who you are, in fact, so
Get your scuzzy, damn hand off my tummy!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An attaboy's meaning is plain:
"You've done well!  Let's break out the champagne!"
Still, they fade away fast.
One mistake sends your last
Twenty attaboys right down the drain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm insulted, as wise men advise
That by using this word Sy implies
I do not tell the truth.
Why, the guy's damned uncouth!
Yes, a fabricator's one who tells lies.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Obsolete is this word, that I know.
It used to mean "husband", although
He must have had nous,
For he mastered his house,
But he's gone, yes it's go, goman, go.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The mother bird tends to her brood,
Unaware that she's hunted for food;
And the man tries to lasso
This lovely curassow,
Or shoot her (if that suits his mood).

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Douglas Bader: a top wartime fighter.
Shy two legs, but for this gutsy blighter
That just made him an ace;
His plane won every chase
'Cause its pilot was forty pounds lighter.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The suspension beneath this new pram
Is equipped with a shaft and a cam
That cause back-and-forth motion
Like waves on the ocean,
Which babies might like—if they swam!

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Right-wingers used heavy artillery
In their efforts to tarnish and pillory
Clintonistas who swore
They'd forever adore
Wed politicos William and Hillary.

limerick_list.author: Blind Pig
limerick_list.text:
Richard Byrd, that adventurous soul,
Flew over the North and South Pole.
Those flights made his name,
They're his main claim to fame.
On the Moon, his name graces a hole.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
When this fish you just cannot abide,
To your waiter be sure to confide,
"When making my pizza
In old Srebrenica,
Please leave the anchovies aside."

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
There's a poet, a bard known to preen,
Who writes epics both long and obscene,
But OEDILF and he sparred,
His raw limericks barred.
He's locked out 'til his language is clean.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
By the chickenhawks you were seduced,
So you ordered the dogs be unloosed—
Playing chicken, no doubt.
Now you're chickening out,
Since the chickens have come home to roost.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
Let me tell you the story of Claire,
Who detested her straight, dark brown hair:
She shampooed it and dried it,
And curled it and dyed it,
But her ringlets brought tears of despair.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Abaxial refers to a part
Of a plant facing out from the heart
(That's the stem of the plant)
Or the surface that can't
Get the rays of the sun when they start.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
At the book fest I read from my book
Titled Look at a Gangster Named Crook,
When a man came who pouted
Then hollered and shouted,
"I'm John Crook, and it's my name you took!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Beware Alternaria blight:
While it won't kill potatoes outright,
Early blight, you should know,
Is a tough row to hoe.
Would rotation of crops help? It might.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
As some foolhardy bathers have learnt,
Do not swim in the Benguela Current.
From Antarctica's coast
To Angola's shores, most
Of those in for a dip wish they weren't.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
When I visit my brother today,
They will limit how long I can stay:
I'm confined for an hour
To his cell, feeling dour—
But that's nothing to him: he's "away."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I no longer respect him—my ex.
With his mom down in Waco, he necks,
In a complex of flats
(Where she lives with her cats).
There his nickname is Oedipus Tex.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
The fossils of Tubulidentata
Are found in Cretaceous substrata.
The aardvark, resplendent
Sole living descendant,
Provides us with much-needed data.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's so droughty, so dry, that no doubt
All our seedlings are failing to sprout.
Just forget your boy-scoutiness;
We're trounced by this droughtiness.
Hope the government bails us all out!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Who splattered the guests at my kegger?"
Yelled McGregor. "The cad is an egger!"
"What? That moth with no mouth
That I found in the south?"
"No, a bad-tempered, egg-throwing beggar."

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The church offering's called the collection,
And I feel it requires introspection:
For the preacher to live,
Just how much should I give?
With a twenty I find no objection.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Our family's good name you're besmirching.
Don't you know right from wrong from your churching?
Shut the branch lines? Dear me!
Are you out of your tree?
Richard Beeching, you need a good birching!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
With new rumours of lay-offs, we're heading
For a go-slow at work—no more shedding
Of sweat from the brow:
Look, we're all needed now.
It's a practice that's called featherbedding.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Yes, your fancy-dress costume is great,
Being last to arrive, though, I hate:
Hurry up! (I confirm
You look just like a worm.)
Get a wiggle on, else we'll be late.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
An android from East Yokohama
Caused eerily humanlike drama
By claiming a Segway
(In a non-sperm-and-egg way)
Was his abiological mama.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
If you come from a land occidental
And you're dealing with trade oriental,
Keep in mind: what you do
Rests on face, it is true.
Reputation is quite fundamental.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Do you have to employ condottieri?
These soldiers of fortune are scary!
They're hairy as apes,
And they wear, neath their capes,
Hidden weapons—you'd better be wary!

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"We are going to marry," said Hugh,
"There is no way Jack's marrying you.
He's a bounder, a lout.
I've deposed him, no doubt—
A without-any-mercy beau coup!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Assessed value was high. "YES!" I cried,
"Let us sell this old house!" So we tried
To unload it, but NO!
Appraised value was low:
The damn market was oversupplied.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
A caponier spans a wide ditch:
It's defensive, a structure from which
Gunners shot at invaders,
Intruders and raiders,
Then choked on the fumes—there's the hitch.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I can sing, I can dance, I can act;
Crowds go nuts at the jokes that I've cracked.
I'm a great entertainer,
And here's a no-brainer —
I strip, 'cause I'm pretty well stacked.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
On the waves our ship tossed, lightly laded.
But once Africa's coastlands were raided,
The weight was increased
And our sea-sickness ceased—
With the ballast of slaves to be traded.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A cantankerous banker named Bunny
Had discovered that something was funny:
All her tellers' accounts
Had astounding amounts,
Though the bank didn't pay them much money.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Circumlocutory speech is your friend.
Forget candor — a bitch to defend.
Do the old bob-and-weave;
They all long to believe.
The mob should be confused in the end.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The aardvark explores after dark
Every inch of this African park
With his tongue and his claws
For those termites he gnaws
So he won't end up starving, and cark.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
I'm told that I'm stubborn. Some hope
That I'll be less inflexible. Nope,
No can do. Here's the drill:
Just consider my will
To be adamantean. Then cope.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Who cares if they're odd or tongue-twistery?
Archaisms add to the mystery
Of English, say I.
Thou wouldst banish them? Fie!
And gadzooks! Hast thou no sense of history?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The candies are thin, and their whiteness
Suggests an aetherial lightness.
They're certainly nice,
But I peeked at the price,
And I'm feeling a little uptightness.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
She's cheerful, so cute and petite,
With her pompoms all bouncy and sweet.
Still, this cheerleader fears
That despite her best cheers,
All her teams will go down in defeat.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A smart alec thinks this is true:
That he's smart, and he knows more than you.
But Australians, I hear,
Are quite likely to jeer,
Cuz he's not, so just alec will do.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
She's a wordsmith whose heart's on the mend;
I've been easing her tears (as a friend).
But sooner or later,
At least when I date her,
Her teasing my ears has to end.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The court order I met with derision.
The judge made me pay a provision
To someone I'd jilted.
The system is tilted.
I'll fight this horrendous decision!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"This meat's fibrous; it's stringy and chewy.
It's sinewy," moaned toothless Louis.
"For a stew it might do,
But for stir-fries it's too
Blooming tough. I can't eat this chop suey!"

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
As a dandy, Beau Brummell loved clothes.
He eschewed knee-length breeches and hose.
Plain black coat, white cravat,
Tight black pants, opera hat
And high boots were the wardrobe he chose.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
In your age bracket, Pa, people are
Retired from work. You're by far
Not the fittest on earth,
So for what it is worth:
Take the bus and do not drive a car!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Birthday bumps are embarrassing things.
When your bum hits the carpet, it stings.
And though Chris might be smug,
There's a bell on the rug.
Is he young? People shrug. Count the rings.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
He's an audist who thinks I can't cope
Just because I speak sign. What a dope!
But I still have to grin —
His cooked books are within
My forensic accountancy's scope.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Carbohydrase: an enzyme that acts
To metabolize pasta and snacks
That we eat as we please
In our carb-loading sprees
From those regular fast-food attacks.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
Ah, this limerick writing of late
Has me laughing from midnight till eight.
And I'm sure to get thinner
By skipping my dinner!
But the kids'll get hungry. Aw, great.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
As old Lion lay dreaming, his keeper
Fed Crow, to buy peace for the sleeper.
But though fed, the foul beast
Grew more eager to feast,
And the danger to Lion grew deeper.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Make this lens and you'll not only pass,
You will rise to the top of the class.
It must never diffuse
Long-wave reds from short blues.
Hint: You might want to check out crown glass.

limerick_list.author: Jeter Coffee
limerick_list.text:
We've been married for fifty short years;
You've brought cheers and sustained me through tears.
The plain truth now appears
Through the gold souvenirs:
I'm indebted for life — in arrears.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
All the onlookers studied her feet
As her skirt swished in time to the beat.
They all would agree — a
Superb bulería!
Flamenco — a real Spanish treat!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Where full costs of a show are excessive,
In an act some may find quite impressive,
Concert versions may be
About all we will see,
Though for some that's an act too aggressive.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
"What's the name of those palms in my yard
With their leaves by the drought hardly marred?"
"Those are fan palms," said Penny,
"And species are many.
Taxonomical certainty's hard."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The runaway's clothing, they say,
Was cloth strips she had hidden away.
To describe such a bird,
Use this seldom-heard word:
"Her disguise is all clootie today".

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My wife is the bellyaching kind.
To her constant complaints I'm resigned.
Like, "Your breath's awful smelly;
Its scent's muscatel-y.
Your wine palate's so unrefined!"

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
While I stared at our second course (curry),
I observed that the currants were furry.
It appeared to be mold—
Which will grow, I am told,
When the currentness goes, in a hurry.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The word dew-worm's a noteworthy term
For an earthworm, I'll gladly confirm.
Guess I've gathered a few
In the morn, in the dew—
Hence the name, I assume, for this worm.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Does the Amistad's story give pause
To Guantanamo's jailers? Our laws
(1840) protected
From Spain those dejected
But lucky black slaves in their cause.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
My girlfriend's a ghost. Oh, don't fear it;
That howling means love. Can you hear it?
My sweetie's discarnate —
Can't feel her, gosh darn it.
I've learned that you can't spear a spirit.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As an airman, whenever I choose
What to wear, I prefer my dress blues.
One: They make me look hot.
Two: The guys who get shot
Are all wearing those drab BDUs.

limerick_list.author: David R. Litwin
limerick_list.text:
"Please ready the liquid for tests:
Look for particles, min'rals and pests.
If you give it gyration
Does deflocculation
Occur? Go and check," he suggests.

limerick_list.author: Tom Foolery
limerick_list.text:
Real essential (you bet!), an agenda
Lists the things that you gotta attend ta.
You can check one by one
To make sure they get done—
Or ignore 'em and go on a benda.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
As to health, it is all about stress:
Steady workouts will lead to success.
But if you don't move
Then you'll never improve;
Sit around and you'll end up a mess.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I've encountered an interesting term,
Namely earthmad.  I'd like to affirm
It can not mean the planet
Is bonkers (or can it?),
This outdated word for a worm.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Your lame claim that you've scored a big deal
Is pure hype, though I see its appeal.
You're so bogus!  It's clear
That your motive's just sheer
Phony crap—it's your lying that's real.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
THX! LOL! OMG!
TTY! G2G! BRB!
Looks 2 weird 4 ur i's?
Plz don't fret, u'll get y's!
It's a lingo called chatspeak, u c!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A cub whose behavior is grave
("You're unbearably bad! Now behave!")
With the loving forbearance
Of both his bear parents
Might be sent to his room in the cave.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A biaryl has two aryl groups,
And the aryls have resonant loops.
Her motif goes beyond
What makes pharmacists fond,
For she'll conquer the rest when she stoops.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Beer and milk, beer and wine made a drink
That was surely repulsive, I think.
It was balderdash (eeew!);
No one's pique would accrue
If you tossed the whole thing down the sink.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
This person, considered a pest,
You would never invite as your guest.
In behaviour and talk,
This cock of the walk
In his own eyes is best of the rest.

limerick_list.author: equinox
limerick_list.text:
Plastic, metal and glass played a part
In the Russian constructivist art.
Other schools were suppressed
At the Party's behest:
"Make industrial forms without heart!"

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Count the stoves, pans, and sinks in this kitchen.
All these knives have my right hand a-twitchin'.
Fridges, pantries—all filled,
And with teachers so skilled,
Yes, this culinary school will be bitchin'!

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The long ranges in chains that cascade—
The high peaks, with their valleys, arrayed
In this view from the air
Are so massive we stare
At the broad cordillera displayed.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
It's been many a day and a night
Since dainty meant "joy" or "delight."
This sentence I saw, sir,
From the era of Chaucer:
Gret deyntee have we that he write.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The Bedlamite told me a story
Regarding a spongiform lorry
With pencils for vents.
It lacked any sense:
A case of advanced amphigory.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
My creative juice flows at full stretch
As my best-seller outlines I sketch.
My last blockbuster's sales
Were sky-high, but that pales
Beside what this new novel will fetch.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
(He'd decided, "All right, invite Lynne!")
"See my etchings?" (He wore a bright grin.)
"Where the ink doesn't show
Is where acids don't go
To bite in." (But he thought, "Tonight, sin!")

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
Strong beliefs and opinions are used,
And the proof of a matter abused
By those challenged with fact,
Who'll most often react
With presumptions and truth still confused.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
If absinthe, a greenish liqueur
With an anise-like taste, you'd prefer,
Better hold on real tight!
The effects last all night,
And your mind will be left in a blur.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Ashamed to admit he's a brony,
A Mafia hitman named Tony
Acts tough whacking men
Every day.  Ah, but then
He goes home to watch My Little Pony.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This drug's alviducous. It will
Surely give you the runs; you'll feel ill.
But if you have the urge
And you really must purge,
Go ahead and just swallow this pill.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Geoffrey Chaucer, the courtier and poet,
Wrote in English in order to show it
Could match French or Latin
(Whose shade it still sat in),
And his Tales help the rest of us know it.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
The top of this hill's called its crown,
And from here all the paths must lead down.
At the bottom there's mud,
Full of brambles and crud.
And beware of the quicksand—don't drown!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The medical meaning I seek
Of this term, which I think is unique.
Called elective-type  mutism,
It involves absolutism
In a child who refuses to speak.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Is the evidence science or con?
Just one glimpse of a track, then it's gone.
Can this particle be
A new chi b(3P)?
Seems that 'ugly' and 'beauty' locked on.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
He's the man known for pardoning Dick
Milhous Nixon, a final slick trick
From that crook and the first
From Prez Ford. Was it worst
Case or wise? It was such a big shtick!

limerick_list.author: Gumby and Jonathan M. Guberman
limerick_list.text:
When aiming for fortune and fame,
It helps to adopt a big name.
Though Tom Cruise is quite short,
He had longer support:
Lafayette Ronald Hubbard's to blame.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
The old angler, to no one's surprise,
Stood in waders, aspersing the guys.
Then a wag who heard all
Said out loud in his drawl,
"He is casting aspersions, not flies."

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
As we wander this way, it's morality
That guides us far more than mortality:
Pole to pole is our goal,
But free will takes its toll,
So we drift from a pure axiality.

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
When stealing a car, I got caught
And attempts to stay free came to naught.
Now I've finished my time
For that silly old crime,
So have I forgiveness abought?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This necklace I'll have to exchange,
As its price is too high—out of range.
Though I should have resisted
When the salesman insisted
"It's chump change!" I bought it.  How strange.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Courageousness isn't the same
As courage, because it's the name
We give to the state
Of possessing this trait.
That's my claim. I'm to blame if it's lame.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
An announcement by bosun's mate Frye:
"British history's great. That's no lie.
And your flick starts at eight—
'Bout the life and the fate
Of their queen, called Elizabeth I."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This flick has me biting my nails;
The tension is right off the scales.
Rustling leaves in the dark,
A forlorn city park,
And the gore — I eat up these old tales.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
In dissecting my mind's aberration
I've uncovered a simple salvation.
Personality splits:
At the job one mind sits;
To the beach goes its mate — bilocation!

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
The term gobbler refers to the male
Of a turkey pair, grown to full scale.
But a more fitting name
For the tykes, I proclaim,
Would be "goblets."  (They're tiny as quail.)

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
To sit down and to calmly discuss
Makes more sense than creating a fuss.
If we shout and complain,
There's just pain without gain,
I maintain; and it's ever been thus.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"This gravy tastes better than most;
It's so flavoursome ..." prompting my host
To chuckle and pour
Me a quarter-pint more
Of the juices that flowed from the roast.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
An inductive young thinker, named John,
Had a thought that he acted upon:
"Quaffing beer after beer,
These should all disappear
If I drink 'til the last is all gone."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antishark spray that didn't smell pleasant
I received from my mom as a present.
"Take this canister when
You're in bars to meet men,
For attackers," she said, "peer or peasant."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
When the missile went wobbly, we ducked,
And I ordered: "Proceed with destruct!
Don't just sit there, you dunce —
Push the button at once!
If it falls on our heads, we'll be — out of lucked!"

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
For the learnèd and scholarly, you
May have need of some lexical glue:
There's a word you can use
For their literate views —
They are clerkly, an old word but true.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
The clever cylindrical lens
Is one whose refracted light bends
To form a straight line,
And thus is quite fine
To cure astigmatic sight trends.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Thus wrote Gilbert: "Oh, bother the flowers…"
Pester tulips? Beyond human powers.
What he meant was, "To hell with 'em."
My advice: "Spend a spell with 'em.
Settle down and enjoy them for hours."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The tall ladder and winch and the rope meant
The scene had been set for elopement.
"No big church has the room
For our love!" claimed the groom,
But "I'm stingy" was more what that dope meant.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
A sensitive singer is Dottie;
Her ear is attuned to Vallotti.
When she sings with the harp,
All her F's will sound sharp.
Said the harpist, "Poor Dottie, she's potty!"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
My love life goes straight down the tubes
Once the twins begin sharing their doobs.
Marijuana all night
Leaves me high as a kite,
And I'm cross-eyed from counting their boobs.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Should I tackle this problem statistically?
It won't help me," thought Liz, realistically.
"With this word I am struck—
How to understand schmuck?"
Liz should study the word cross-linguistically.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Stop your shouting!  Stop shaking your fists!
The Canal Zone no longer exists.
It's all Panama now;
Let's look forward (yet how
My sweet longing for past times persists).

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
An arboreal monkey agrees
That there's nothing as lovely as trees,
 As did Kilmer (you know him),
 Who wrote that no poem
Can do more than nature to please.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
I've extracted, from mould in my basin,
A metabolite, cytochalasin.
Cell structure's attacked in
Its latching to actin.
Now what should I wash hands and face in?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Now the "fair sex," accused of frivolity
All through history and in each polity,
Seeks protection in laws—
Not because of such flaws,
But in fairness; we ask coequality.

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
In their habitat, haddock (marine),
Or Atlantic red perch can be seen.
This bergylt's head is spiny.
Fish are mottled when tiny,
But when grown, rosefish glow with a sheen.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
When I'm spying, I'm used as a dangle:
With enemy agents I tangle.
Once they think I've defected,
My ruse undetected
Then lets me learn secrets I wangle.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though she's eighty, my dauntless great aunt
Just last Monday slipped out for a jaunt.
To remain au courant
She decided upon
Taking lessons to dance the courant.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Please don't leave me — I'm locking the door,
And I'm tying you down on the floor.
And now I will chant
A dissuasory rant:
Give it up, change your mind, I implore!

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Eric Blair fought in Spain's civil war
And came back to his home, sick and sore.
But he still rose to fame
As George Orwell, the name
Of the author of 1-9-8-4.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
The ad called it "airy and light,
With views of the city at night."
Three bedrooms, one bath,
But the walls were just lath.
It was certainly airy, all right!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I don't drink any booze, so the label
Of teetotaler fits—yet I'm able
To visit with ease
When my friends serve their teas
On a low-to-the-floor cocktail table.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Though it's based on the Julian day,
The Besselian epoch's passé.
All those tropical dates
On astronomers' plates
Indigestibly got in the way.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Administratorship's duties are many;
All you leaders-to-be, nota bene:
It's a management shmuck
Who sees only the buck...
Not the nickel, the dime, and the penny.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
To Denmark I went, for a lark.
I read Hamlet in Tivoli Park.
I got drunk and was bed
By a mermaid who said,
"Den Carlsberg, sig makes os Danes bark."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
When in port on a West Indies cruise,
Though they could wear their whites, sailors choose
To dress up and not down
For their shore leave in town;
They enjoy hearing rhythm in blues.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There's a bike that my nephew admires.
In the shops it attracts many buyers.
It is very well made,
Its design is top grade,
And it rides on select black wall tires.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Time to bivouac, sir, Captain Harrison.
Or would you prefer we engarrison?"
"The former, old sport —
Do you see any fort???"
"Why, no sir, I don't.  How embarrassin'!"

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
"There's a soft spot, see, right in the middle,"
Said the quack, "but for me that's no riddle.
I'll just smear some smegma
On top of his bregma —
Then your child will be fit as a fiddle!"

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
Albugo's plant fungi, white rust.
A silvery bonefish discussed
Is the Albula kind.
On Albuca plants find
Yellow flowers in clusters robust.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The least pliable hairs that one grows
(They were braided for fun, I suppose—
Not because of a curse—
In Miss waterrocks' verse)
Are the bristlelike hairs in your nose.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
The medicine tries to stay hid
As I find I can't open its lid.
I'm trying to twist,
But it's hurting my wrist.
It's child-proof — I'll go ask my kid.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Draped in flags, tightly packed, in the zone,
As a unit, they'll get up or groan.
The Olympics are here:
For their nations they cheer,
Chauvinistically backing their own.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
If I told you I wanted dimission
I'd mean that I had an ambition
To go or depart,
But I know I can't start,
Whilst lacking your leave and cognition.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The field geoscience is where
Dan and Dotty began their affair.
With each other? Oh, no.
Out to diggings they go.
It's a love of the Earth that they share.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
This fellow's a bit of a lad,
And he loves all the good times he's had.
The children he's fathered?
He couldn't be bothered—
Yes, Deadbeat's the name of this dad.

limerick_list.author: Znirk
limerick_list.text:
An anacoluthon — I'll show
What this means. When you start with — although,
Just as soon as you reach —
(Less in writing than speech) —
With a different sentence, you know?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cuban trogons have reason to brag:
"We're the national bird," says one wag.
"Our feathers are blue;
Some are red or white too,
Just the same as our national flag."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Ian Fleming wrote novels that rocked
Of James Bond, so urbane, never shocked.
With a gun, in command,
Femme fatale close at hand,
He's the spy who is never half-cocked.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our exiguous share of the crop
Didn't bring very much at the shop:
A rough tick for our bed,
Needed dry goods and thread,
And for Timmy, a store-bought'n top.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A brass ring's like a real pot o' gold
That says, "Grab me! Be daring and bold."
So I've had a few whacks,
Slipped and fell through the cracks.
For the present, my gold is on hold.

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
This Averroes chap was quite keen
That the Stagirite's works should be seen.
In the West he was taught,
And they said that he thought
That two truths that are true contravene.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
All the women—for me they're fanatic.
I breathe heavy—it makes them ecstatic.
They think I'm so passionate.
Truth?  Not a dash in it.
Fact is, I'm merely asthmatic.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My son Tyson is all of a dither —
He's about to perform on his zither,
So he's nervous, a mess —
That's for sure; but we guess
Once he starts, all that dither will wither.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Blind Freddy could see that, Charmaine.
(What on earth do you use for a brain?)
There are no shades of grey.
It is clearer than day.
As the nose on your face, it's as plain.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
If a striker who's catching a pass
Takes a hit and then falls to the grass,
The advantage may go
To the man who can show
To the ref all the green on his ass.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
By their oaths, the coswearers are bound;
Both are steadfastly standing their ground:
"The defendant did not
Kill the victim—he shot
Someone else on the day that she drowned."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Of some spiders we needn't be wary,
While others are ugly and hairy.
Beware if you find
The citigrade kind;
They're the wolf and tarantula—scary!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
In Latin, to hurl or to throw
Is said iacere. Now, dontcha know,
If you consonantize
I to J, try for size
Eject or ejaculate. Yo!

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
"Your limerick's lifeless and weak,"
Said the editor, "but you can tweak
(You can fine-tune) the thing
And thus give it more zing—
Make it ring, make it sing, make it sleek!"

limerick_list.author: psh and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
If a dervis (or dervish) should whirl,
His white garments stand out in a swirl.
He may point with his hand
To the sky or the land,
But the faith of this monk won't unfurl.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
As its colors change hour by hour,
You discover this world of the tower.
So take a companion
On walks through Bryce Canyon:
Enjoy nature's rock-sculpting power.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Why, today's Francophonia Day!
It  means "Speaking in French Day"!  Let's say
Chargé d'affaires,
Monsieur Stephen Colbert
And that discount store's snob-name, Target.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes and S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
The Airstream's a trailer of fame
With streamlined design (hence the name).
Its aluminum shell
Casts a vagabond spell
That a stay-at-home heart cannot tame.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Here's a riddle:  Where milk may abound,
Name the place fathers monkey around,
Yet to feed it's devised
(And you might be surprised
At the source where the answer is found).

limerick_list.author: RCK
limerick_list.text:
I applied to become a Freemason,
But they laughed at my lone application.
Said, "You need the support
Of a member cohort
To get into this organization."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
An absorbable gelatin suture
Has a place in my medical future,
To stitch up my lip
When I clumsily slip
On some jelly and land on my smoocher.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I jumped in Big Muddy to drown.
My girl left me.  I thought, going down,
"God, how gross!  While I'm sinking,
The townsfolk are drinking
Their tap water so dirty brown."

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Harry Bailly let beds and made sales,
At Southwark, of suppers and ales.
But a fabulous fame
Has attached to his name:
He's the 'hooste' in the Canterbury Tales.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Paint a portrait: the typical case
Depicts beauty, delight, maybe grace.
Picasso's were mangled,
Distorted and angled:
Two eyes on one side of the face.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My young sons, Kenneth, Leonard, and Ben,
Have MD, and the type is Duchenne.
Seems they all have defects
In sex chromosome X.
I just hope they all live to be men.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My poor daughter's reduced to a shell.
Her bulimia's worse, I can tell.
She's developed the urge
To lose weight, binge and purge.
Can't she see this could be her farewell?

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Some crewmen rose up with a cry,
Casting loose loyal sailors, to die.
"Your unabashed mutiny
Will never pass scrutiny.
You'll hang for this!" shrieked William Bligh.

limerick_list.author: Comicoffee
limerick_list.text:
Adult day care is where we send Gramps.
It's got wheelchair-accessible ramps.
He plays bingo and bridge
With a biddy named Midge.
They're the elderly game-playing champs!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Sheila's seen tufty green fluffy flocculi,
Which she spies with her eyes (that's her oculi).
Now she pants for a rhyme
For those plants that can climb,
For to write something sprightly on cocculus.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
As low-cut Liv practiced her pivot,
A golfer tripped over a divot —
A decided dommage,
But the décolletage
Of her polo dress really does rivet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Thus did the surgeon instruct:
"Slide a cannula into the duct..."
As with great trepidation
At my first operation,
A gall bladder, deftly, I plucked.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Said Sir Oliver Pilkington-Pie,
"These aphids I cannot let lie.
I can see at a glance
They're destroying my plants.
Each sap-sucking greenfly must die."

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
At the fortress his ensign was furled
As his crown from the ramparts he hurled.
He resigned. He is free.
The Welsh king's on a spree
Like he hasn't a caer in the world.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Glycemic's the index (GI)
That tells you (how fast and how high)
The food you ingest
Makes your blood glucose crest.
Diabetics: Shun ice cream and pie!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I've been schooled, sir, and well know my duty.
I beg leave to beau Betty, your beauty.
Get a lady home whole
Is a gentleman's role.
But I'll need self-control. She's a cutie.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Lovely, low-growing shrub from Australia,
The Coral Gem's not an azalea—
Grevillea's the genus—
And strictly between us,
For flowers, it outshines the Vidalia.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
It was covered with lights — how they strobed!
And like angels they were, all enrobed.
It was too much to bear!
We were raptured in prayer...
Well, until we were anally probed.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
"Neither borrower nor lender be,"
Says Polonius. "Loans aren't free.
They can cost you a friend,
Or get lost. In the end,
If you must borrow, borrow from me."

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
"I'm no bastard, don't yell that at me!"
He retorted, but she'd not agree.
"Though your parents were married,
I still feel I'm harried—
You mean, hateful partner!" cried she.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
If your children grow sullen and vicious,
Light candles to St Aloysius,
That the patron of youth
Might bring virtue and couth
From outside (that would be adscititious).

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
You ride bathyscapes like submarines,
Underseas: cruise the blues and the greens.
Embark through the hatch.
Get sealed in. Lock the latch.
Now you're canned like a school of sardines.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Early morning, the day's just begun;
German tourists arrive, on the run,
To mark out their base,
To reserve the right space
And to bag the best place for the sun.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
After opening night at the play
Came a wonderful finger buffet:
Vol-au-vents, canapés
They'd been making for days—
All utensils and plates stashed away.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Paul Bunyan's young stepbrother Russell
Was lacking in Paul's famous muscle.
All Russ could uproot
Was a shrub most minute:
A dwarf tree, i.e., an arbuscle.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I've gone everyplace I've wished to go —
To all regions, save one, as you know:
I've wished from the start
To visit your heart,
But wishing does not make it so.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
These freshwater denizens spawn
In the ocean each morning at dawn.
It's the sea that appeals
To catadromous eels,
Who are saltily getting it on.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
An affluent man of great wealth
Once diverted the sewers by stealth,
On the self-centred grounds
(Not as rich as it sounds)
That effluent's bad for the health.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Not all food fights involve throwing food.
When opponents indulge a bad mood,
Here's what often occurs:
They throw taunts, scorn and slurs
Spiced with name-calling — childish and rude.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Her malign disposition is shown by
Her scowl as the decades have flown by.
Since she's frequently seen
As the crabbiness queen,
Grandma Nasty's the name she is known by.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Alexander the Great conquered Greece,
Then continued his march without cease.
He took Persia by force,
And then Egypt, of course.
After India? Homeward in peace.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A young shepherd cried, "Lads, did you see
In the sky there? An angel, and he
Said a baby's been born!"
But his mates said, with scorn,
"He's been drinking again, let him be!"

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Just after my seventh divorce,
I began to feel bitter remorse.
So I joined with a church—
Left my sins in the lurch—
I'm enjoying my new change of course.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
On a hot date, this food-loving dude'll
Have Italian—it's well worth the boodle.
It seems pasta enhances
My sexual advances:
My girl and I eat, then canoodle.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Paul poops parties; his temperament's poor:
Starts to gripe when he steps through the door,
With his carps and complaints
Unrepressed by restraints—
He's the pleasure-polluter du jour.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The word blivet may cause some confusion.
It's an optical type of illusion,
Or a battlefield urn,
Or a lapse of concern,
Or a hopeless or mindless intrusion.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
These herbarium plants, a collection
Of alpines, are here for inspection.
Exsiccatae, well pressed,
Provide some of the best
Of dry records, when made to perfection.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Young Arthur was always outshone
By Kay until Art was near grown.
Then Sir Kay, wholly floored,
Owned King Arthur as lord
When the sword he abraid from the stone.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Global warming is based on historical
Sets of facts, which elicit rhetorical
Ripostes by defiers
And science deniers:
"Your measures are just Al-le-Gore-ical!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An accident happened to Matt.
He was hit on the arm with a bat,
And since Matt never cursed,
As his elbow he nursed,
The worst he came out with was "Drat!"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's confirmed; we've just tallied the get:
This year's fair's the most lucrative yet.
While the "food police" fumed,
All the eats were consumed.
(Chuchi's chili's still making me sweat.)

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
The Warners would run 'round the lot:
Young Yakko, and Wakko and Dot.
Their behavior was zany,
The dialog brainy.
(They were locked in the tower when caught.)

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Who'd sing hymns when I die? Why, the choir would.
And who'd light my pyre? The friar would,
In sackcloth and sandals,
With two tallow candles
Applied to a pile of pine firewood.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
It's a slow, lazy pattern of speech
With the vowels drawn out — fun to teach!
I'm describing the drawl.
Try it out: "Hi, y'all."
See, it's well within everyone's reach.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An anti-shock body's a pod
On the wing of a jet. It looks odd,
But reduces the drag
So an airline can brag
About "carrots" that save them a wad.

limerick_list.author: Mr. Parx
limerick_list.text:
The wee gymnast performed in Korea,
But sadly she had no idea
That the price of her talents,
With her weight in the balance,
Was the onset of amenorrhea.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
C: a grade that some gentlemen get.
CR: symbol that oft follows debt.
CRO: Balkan nation.
Crow: to brag with elation.
Crown: a headpiece above coronet.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Cumu-cirro-stratus I see — it's a cloud
That I wouldn't be naming out loud.
If this nimbus brings rain
You won't see me again;
An umbrella's a pain in a crowd.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"We take care," said the man from Siberia,
"In our products, to count the bacteria,
In our certified milk,
And kids' foods of that ilk—
As infections can bring on deliria."

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
A prune is a fruit that is dried.
Should you eat a whole bag? You decide.
My grandpa ate tons,
But they gave him the runs.
In fact, I think that's how he died.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The late, luckless barfly, Jim Lear,
Was waked 'round the first of the year.
Friends, in passing the stiff,
Thought they heard a soft sniff,
And observed, "He's still cry'n' in his bier."

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Maurizio, anglice Morris,
Joined a coro, or anglice, chorus.
He made Roma his home—
That is, anglice Rome—
And learned English from Roget's Thesaurus.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In the gloom, sensing danger or harm,
I would freeze on my dad's steady arm.
Mine was no gentle clutch,
But he'd smile at my touch
And allay the least trace of alarm.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
I have carpetweed growing in spades;
Every inch of the floor it pervades.
It's invasive, indeed,
And runs quickly to seed,
But at least it goes well with the shades!

limerick_list.author: rbalexx
limerick_list.text:
For the game — USA versus France —
The bilateral rules took this stance:
Since the French could not pass,
The Yanks showed real class:
Just by lateral would they advance.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Being agammaglobulinemic,
My auto-immunity's hemic:
Sure, my blood hasn't got
Antibodies: so what?
I'm just glad I'm no longer bulimic!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Said a shivering seal, feeling low,
"It's so icy and cold—think I'll go
Far away from this beach;
The whole world is in reach,
So I'm just gonna go with the floe."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a genus I love: Commelina;
These flowers are native to China.
Its blue blooms, it appears,
People call widow's tears,
But for me, they're more cheerful, benigner.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Their high aspirations are bald;
They act as if they have been Called.
My Wheaties grow sour
With each morning's glower:
"Choose me! I'm completely appalled!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My amplificatory remarks
Will expand on those made by the narcs:
Keep your children at home;
Don't allow them to roam.
There are drugs being dealt in our parks.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
After losing his job, in lament he
Said, "Agism? I have seen plenty.
'Help wanted,' ads say,
'Please apply here, today!'
But only for those who look twenty."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This detachable stub is your claim
To the seat you reserved for the game.
Pull your counterstock out
For that twenty-stone lout
Who won't move and then tell him, "For shame!"

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
Many singers of old sang the blues
With such grace, no one dares fill their shoes.
But they got through their nights
Thanks to reds and to whites
And to liberal helpings of booze.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Dress whites, says the plan-of-the-day.
Full honors for those passed away.
Piped over the side,
In God's deep they abide —
The warship gets back under way.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A conduit, pipe, tube or duct
Is a passageway; see how it's tucked
In a ceiling or floor.
There are those and lots more,
Like the soda-pop straw that you sucked.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
These dorsal-finned, spiny-gilled fishes
Were toothless and likely not vicious.
Acanthodes are known
By their fossils alone.
Who can say if they tasted delicious?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The large wrought iron stars on that wall
Are called anchor plates. No, they won't fall.
Reinforcements or bracing,
They true the stone facing.
Must have worked: there they hang, after all.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Of course, everyone's heard of a dogcatcher,
And some of a greased pig (or hog) catcher.
But most likely don't know
Should one lack rain or snow,
One can drip H2O from a fog catcher.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
My friend's acuphagia grew
As each day he ate sabers anew.
All aghast, we watched painfully
As his mentor disdainfully
Told him to swallow, not chew.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I'm a green-hearted arbitrage planner,
Taking cans from Fort Wayne, Indiana,
To Detroit, where they each
Yield a dime — what a peach! —
Which explains my insouciant manner.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Mental/physical slowness you see.
Closed-head injury when I was three
Killed off brain cells.  Repair
(Or cytothesis)?  There
Is no way.  Just accept me as me.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
My bedroom was terribly messed.
But "Mom doesn't know," I had guessed.
I was wrong; 'twas my doom
When she yelled, "Clean your room!"
Well, I pouted, but then acquiesced.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Corroborative detail? Pooh-Bah
Had a penchant for that. The Mika-
do prescribed melted lead;
For the head that was dead
Was his son's — just one detail too far.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Come one and come all! Be enthralled!"
Bawled the circus clown (short, fat and bald).
So I shelled out me shilling.
The act the most thrilling?
The tigers (old Baldie got mauled).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As a kid, she was never a shouter;
As a teen, an agnostic, a doubter.
Now her silence is broken—
At thirty, outspoken—
She's a loud pro-abortion come-outer.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
While you bounce on your heel and your toe,
I'm flat-footed wherever I go.
When it comes to my sole
I needs must place the whole
Of it touching the ground; it lies low.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I fancy tall trees, green as jade,
And a premium price I have paid
For the branchiest maples
And elms (they're my staples)—
The trees that provide the most shade.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Like a moccasin, maybe; Mom knew:
Shield the foot from the dust and the dew.
With a soft leather sole
(Needs no heel to be whole),
A cack is, for Baby, a shoe.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Debunking is sport on the Net.
The experts won't let you forget
Your citing Petronius,
Which they say is erroneous,
In that paper you've come to regret.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
When the Yank asked her beau, "Like my bangs?",
The young Brit said, "I crave you with pangs!
Yes, I love banging you."
She replied, "That's good, too;
But by bangs, I meant fringe, where hair hangs."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
On the field we looked skillful, well versed,
And in baseball tradition immersed.
'Round the horn we would throw
Just to watch the ball go
Straight to third, then to second, then first.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
At the kennel (a canine hotel), a
Requirement is stop! show-and-tell a
New verification
Of immunization,
So dogs cannot cough Bordetella.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
You're a swindler, a blackleg, a crook,
And you've tried every trick in the book.
You'd ensure that you win;
Beat it now — save your skin,
