And just pray to be let off the hook.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The coffin was placed catercorner
At the funeral.  There as a mourner,
I said, "Surely this change
In the setup is strange,
And for me, makes the service forlorner."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
The great Hamlets (Oliviers, Burtons...)
Bow deeply, aware that what's certain's
The end (one fine day,
At the close of the play,
The applause dies away, and it's curtains).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A DP is the sort who might say,
"From my home I've been driven away
As a war escapee."
Then again, it might be
When two guys are both out on one play.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
What capacitates sperm and allows
Them to break into eggs and arouse
Any gametes they meet,
Then unite? (Ain't it neat
To consider the whys and the hows?)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
What desiccative climates will do
Is preserve things through drying.  Who knew
Paw was shot in the head
In the desert?  Long dead,
Dear old daddy's a mummy, it's true.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
I'm a father indeed (for my sins):
My wife has gone way beyond twins.
To mark her fecundity,
Here is this fun ditty:
One line for each of the quins.

limerick_list.author: Randall Hamilton
limerick_list.text:
From the pacifist to the barbarian,
And the youngster to octogenarian,
If you simply can't deem
Them of equal esteem,
Then you're antiegalitarian.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
To get onto the freeway, I'll take
The new access road here, once I make
This right turn.  But, oh, hey—
What's this sign say? WRONG WAY?
Golly, maybe I've made a mistake…

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
To Brazilians, the samba is king;
It's a dance with emotion and zing.
In the '60s they wove a
Subdued bossa nova,
Which passed with a sway and a swing.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said the ad: "BBW." Great!
A "big, beautiful woman" to date.
I'm not doubting her gender
Or the fact she's not slender,
But that middle word's up for debate.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The ship, decked with crossbones and skull,
Struck a storm; called the mate: "Lie ahull!"
Soon its mainsails were furled,
But instead, no wind swirled:
'Round the helm, lashed alee, was a lull.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
In your throat, near the larynx, there juts
The cricopharyngeus.  "What's
A cryco-...?"  you ask.
It's a muscle. Its task:
Muscle morsels much nearer your guts.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
You do a diskindness to boys
When comparing the size of their toys.
Their egos deflate
And they'll feel second-rate
Till they get something big that makes noise.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"It's just ignorant use. I reject
All this verbing of dull disrespect."
"Oh, Dad, don't be snide.
As a verb," I replied,
"It dates back to King James. I just checked."

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
From the scaffolding ledge Bobby slipped,
But with harness and wire was equipped.
Dangling high in midair,
He kept cool, didn't swear;
"Look at that — he's Aplomb Bob!" we quipped.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I feel a profound enervation
Of body and mind... dissipation
Of energy... tiredness...
That follows the wiredness
Whenever I'm led to temptation.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
What's Equuleus mean? Little horse
Constellation. What tongue, Greek or Norse?
What else could confuse
With consecutive "u"s?
Yes, the name's from the Latin, of course.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the first part of life, the skull grows,
And feels soft, as each grandmother knows.
At the top of the head,
Where the bones are still spread,
At the bregma, the softness best shows.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At the officer's club on the base,
Five lieutenants got slugged in the face.
(They had called me a name.)
Then the air police came,
Said hello, and subdued me with mace.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
The student Prince William, ere regent,
In first year, while only a wee gent
And recently fledged,
His beak yellow-edged
(A bec jaune / béjaune), was a bejant.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Sniffed a Formula One racing star,
"Autognosis is better, by far,
Than pedestrian knowledge
They teach you in college.
It means, I believe, Know Thy Car!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Were the opera rewritten today,
Gypsy Carmen would slay Don José.
His incessant possessiveness
Would ignite her aggressiveness.
(Okay, so it's not Mérimée!)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's a death march? Three meanings, say I:
 People herded in groups—many die—
Or a pace slowly made
In a Christmas parade,
Or a bike ride that may go awry.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Dressed in blue jeans, a boy can't go wrong,
'Cause they're washable, popular, strong.
If they drag in the dust,
Fold 'em up—readjust:
You can cuff 'em when legs are too long.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This limerick's objective: it traces
The story of dental-type braces.
If your teeth are not straight,
Have them braced, then just wait,
And you'll see how much nicer your face is.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
He's my counselor, advocate, friend.
He's a helper on whom I depend.
One of Trinity's parts,
He can dwell in men's hearts—
Holy Spirit will guide and defend.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a mother and father have mated,
Their offspring are frequently fated
To bother each other,
Like sister and brother,
Who wish they'd been born unrelated.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I read blurbs on the back.  In the flaps,
I read summarized contents.  Perhaps
If the book jacket's piquing
My interest, I'm seeking
The middle to fill in the gaps.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"These designs have excessive adorableness.
For my quarters I favor ignorableness,
With decor that is plain.
In the main," explained Jane,
"They're just more of this artist's deplorableness."

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
If he lives in a sett underground,
And a stripe on his head can be found,
Then we say that his name
(Well, the one of less fame)
Is a brock. They no longer abound.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Our geological survey has found
What's upon and far under the ground.
Let us therefore take stock:
Say, an aquifer? Rock?
Diamonds? Clamshells (an Indian mound)?

limerick_list.author: kandabongo
limerick_list.text:
I nibbled a bit on her auricle
(As foreplay, licked ears are historical).
But just then—oh my dear,
What I feared I might hear—
She complained, "You have slobbered galorical!"

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
I love Mexican food, but I'll pass
On your homemade burrito. Alas,
While I like the idea
Of beans and tortilla
Together, I don't need the gas.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
When the first sheets seemed overly blue,
The pressman computed the hue.
"We would — back in the day —
Guess at CMYK.
Densitometers keep colors true."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There is Capricorn up in the sky!
In the Zodiac, where does he lie?
He's beside Sagittarius
And next to Aquarius—
He's a goat and a horny old guy.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
What does $ mean? Why, it means "peso"
Down Latin America way, so
When know-it-alls holler
"That symbol means 'dollar'!"
Say, "Not so, señor, 'cos I say so."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In a Biellmann she skates, slowly spinning.
His eyes focus; he's mentally sinning.
Her costume's been slipping;
He's secretly gripping
Himself, while maniacally grinning.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My ticker may soon need replacing;
My heartbeat, from drug use, is racing.
It's pumping like mad,
And I'm amping so bad
That a heart attack surely I'm facing.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
The flight's landing: the captain's last call
"We are dropping!" had shocked one and all.
Though he'd only been joking,
We thought we'd be croaking,
On course for a hair-raising fall.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The new lion they got at the zoo
Is so wild, they don't know what to do.
He's so savage (ferocious),
His conduct's atrocious.
In a way, he reminds me of you.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our best striker's a sought-after chap—
One more game overseas, one more cap.
International matches?
Great stature attaches.
All his caps keep our team on the map.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What Jed wrote wasn't clever or cute.
It was nasty—mistaken, to boot!
Much too crude to be edited,
His work was discredited—
Disgraced, held in deep disrepute.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
As our marriage is losing its glow,
Oh, how jealous my wife seems to grow.
She enquired, to ensnare,
"Who's your new love affair?"
I replied to her, "Who wants to know?"

limerick_list.author: buttonbright
limerick_list.text:
You'll pray for the patience of Job
If you've married an agoraphobe.
It pains him to face
The mobbed marketplace,
So he sits round the house in his robe.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A dayworker's paid by the day.
So at night, when collecting his pay,
His heart's filled with sorrow:
("Will they need me tomorrow?")
But the boss only says, "I can't say!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Peace and quiet is just what I need,
Not your rude pack of rugrats on speed.
They're not welcome, I say.
No! Please take them away!
They will chaoize life, guaranteed.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
They said that no man could approach her,
Be he stalker, or burglar, or poacher.
But I just had to ask,
While presenting a cask,
If she fancied herself as a broacher.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My pappy would whoop and he'd cuss,
"I'm so weary of riding the bus!
I don't bring home  the wages
For sixteen fare-stages,
And the stops are a tiresome fuss!"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
From a mustardy cabbage-shaped plant
Come the Brussels sprouts served by my aunt.
Small and cute, looking great,
They appear on my plate;
But to actually eat them? ... I can't.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Though you're lonely and drink-reminiscing,
Should you really be hugging and kissing
A man full of booze,
Knuckles scraping his shoes?
That's a link that should surely stay missing.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My first-born I named Allen Huey.
The second I named Alfred Louis,
The third? Same type name.
But the fourth? Not the same:
Al Dente (in lieu of Al Chewy).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Gain control of the Senate? No way
Can the Democrats do this, folks say.
Still, the polls could be wrong.
Once Ms Clinton looked strong,
But who sits in the White House today?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Grandma's ashes (don't call them her soot)
In a cube have been lovingly put.
It's twelve inches each side,
Meaning high, deep, and wide,
So she measures now one cubic foot.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The box says, "Add color to jar
With actuator; shake." Good so far.
"Then apply to your head
And—"  Oh, no! Creeping dread:
My scalp burns and this tone looks bizarre.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
A console can house all the switches
Connecting the thingummy, which is
Controlling the flights
Of rockets, or lights
So that movies can run without glitches.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Granny Phelps sorts her knickers by code
According to colour. Each load
Is, by kind Grandpa Phelps,
Stacked away (thinks he helps):
But he's mixed pinks and blues! — Gran explodes.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The increasingly adamant king
Said, "I wish thee to dance and to sing.
Both thy feet and thy voice,
Master Jester—no choice.
It isn't an either-or thing."

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
In an effort to stop being bored,
Since the firing fiasco with Ford,
Susan's learned how to code
And her programming's flowed
To create an A.I. code-named "Sword".

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Start with "All men are mortal" and then
Declare Socrates one of these men:
Alogically, thus,
The 9:30 bus
Is coming at quarter to 10.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Arame (that's seaweed, to you)
Can be stir-fried to feed a whole crew.
As a side dish with fish,
Some will say it's delish,
But tonight I'd prefer a fondue.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Man's all-powerful? Give me a break!
Such pretension's not easy to take.
He cannot bring to term
One diminutive worm,
And yet gods by the dozen he'll make.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The call "cock-a-doodle-doo," most concur,
Is what roosters say. I say, no sir!
Whoever invented
That term was demented.
It's more like "ur-ur-ur-ur-urrrrrrr."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
He remembers a lass of low station
Who rekindled a certain sensation.
He desires to be kissed,
So he pays for each tryst
In the bawdy house, per assignation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mayor Strauss gave a rousing oration:
"To protect us from utter predation,
We must build a great wall
Round this town—strong and tall,
Topped with cannons.  That's fortification!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Say you're caught in a messy dispute
Since your neighbor, perhaps, has brought suit.
In a court altercation,
Use this: disputation.
You're bound to sound far more astute.

limerick_list.author: timon
Randy Lee
limerick_list.text:
The team under Johnny Unitas
In Baltimore used to excite us.
But now they're in Indy
And had to go win de
Darn Super Bowl trophy to spite us.

limerick_list.author: zqms
proof
limerick_list.text:
In a battle made famous in verse,
A Brit officer started to curse
At the farmers he'd seen
Standing fast on the green:
"Disperse, you damn rebels, disperse!"

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Mean ole Devil will jinx and torment
You with all kinds of troubles. A gent
Like him can possess
You and make life a mess.
You'll be cursed, all twisted and spent.

limerick_list.author: Philip Chris Erickson
limerick_list.text:
An unfortunate victim of theft
Doubtless hasn't a single cent left.
No nickels or dimes—
These uncivilized crimes
Have left him, of coinage, bereft.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Every confidence game demands art,
Which well played can take dough from the smart!
Every con artist knows
How the "pigeon drop" goes,
Where a fool sees his money depart.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
On a dare she once streaked through a dairy,
Then dove in a vat, feeling airy,
Emerging so buttery—
My heart went all fluttery—
I knew that this girl I would marry.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
I have never been tempted to eat
Any artichoke I've chanced to meet.
Since it sounds hard to swallow,
I just tend to follow
My instinctive distaste for the feat.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Electronics: the current must flow
Where electrical fields make it go.
No switches here, mister,
Just tube or transistor.
Not physical — physics, you know.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I've only betrayed a small fraction,
Toward this patient I feel great attraction.
I am filled with elation
When she has inflammation—
She displays such acute-phase reaction!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Its shape, an elongated stub:
It's eruciform, more than a grub;
It's an eater-in-chief,
Hard at work on that leaf.
Its objective? To finish the shrub.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
He is eight years of age and loves chess;
I can beat him most days, I confess.
But at meets at his school
He's the champ, as a rule,
And his confidence soars with success.

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
Cartoony's a cinch to define:
Brightly coloured, with clearness of line.
But what isn't so clear's
How that critter appears
So unhurt when he steps on a mine.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
Now that we're here at the grove, re
The evergreen, tropical clove tree,
Where you can find droves
Of red buds, whence come cloves,
To observe them, I'm grateful you drove me.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
If you buy all the stock from the store,
So there's none of that kind anymore,
It's coemption. You'll love
Your monopoly of
All the stuff that some folks want to score.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In my kitchen, this surface is quartz,
And it's handy for work of all sorts.
The countertop's great
For preparing a plate
Of my signature strawberry tortes.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
You've a penchant to lead men astray
By devoting to each just one day,
But I find it distasteful,
Repugnant and wasteful
To use men, then throw them away.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
At the Cockney Fine Lacemakers Guild,
They're bestowing a trophy for Skilled
Ruffled Ruffs, Cuffs and Collars
On Fanny, who hollers,
"Oh, fanks! — oo'd've fought? — I'm so frilled!"

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
From the Persian world taken—there are
Narrow streets often called a bazaar,
If they're crowded with shops,
Offering tops amongst flops:
Real Rolex and gewgaw guitar!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She was raised in an ivory tower,
But now rules in the corridors of power,
Where her every decision
Shows prudence and vision.
Her influence grows by the hour.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The tree's fruits are astringent and bitter;
To eat apples and grapes would be fitter.
I will not bandy words—
They're best left for the birds
Who eat chokecherries gaily, atwitter.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
How you always harangue and complain
To diminish me, drive me insane!
But your mission is futile —
You're self-diminutal.
I see through your legerdemain.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
At the edge of the sidewalk Big Herb
Was impeded and fell off the curb.
As he rose to his feet
He addressed the whole street,
With a quite unambiguous verb.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
"Ugh! This chicken has yellowy skin—
Shall I throw it away in the bin?"
"No! No hormones were fed
To that bird, which, now dead,
Shows by colour that corn was within."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I fix divots; my tracks are unseen.
The Club has a view less serene:
"It's expensive, this sod,
And we don't want a clod
Like yourself chipping shots on the green."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Aunt Daisy, a spry golden-ager,
Can beat you at tennis, I'd wager.
But now, seems her leisure's
Been ruined by seizures—
Grand mal (epilepsia major).

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Black storm-clouds assemble on high,
Piling up till they cover the sky.
The thunderheads swarm
In a gathering storm.
But hey — skin and hair are drip-dry.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A dear friend, of his own daft volition,
Tried to drive in an awkward position.
He sat on the wheel
But then sighed, "Oh, I feel
I've adopted a bum steer condition!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When his cardiac failure began,
Docs concocted a radical plan.
What they take from an ermine
Will serve to determine
The fate of a stoat-hearted man.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
To the Chief:  Sir, we cannot attack,
For it's proton disruptors we lack.
This weapon deficiency
Threatens the mission, see?
Cut the flack, give them back. — Men in Black

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Mine's a punishing, stressful profession.
I must choose every word with discretion.
Though I'm serving my nation,
I need a vacation
To unwind, simmer down: decompression.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The president's lacking in will
To fight terrorists looking to kill.
He's so feckless: he's weak,
Ineffective, and meek.
Strength of character?  That would be nil.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The political strip Day by Day,
Like the rest, is left wing? Hell, no way!
What they tend to evoke
Is an ignorant joke—
Just conservatives having their say.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Finest masers and cesium beckoned
To devise a way time could be reckoned:
When the microwaves knock
We atomically clock
About 9 billion cycles a second.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Our chanteyman sings of the ocean,
Of whale-fish, of drink and devotion,
And of work: heave a pawl;
Furl the sail; haul, boys, haul!
His aim: to coordinate motion.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The word's gotten out; it's abroad
That humanity's socially flawed:
Loser lads still make passes
At lasses, while lasses
Smell wealth and are instantly thawed.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
These short-barreled guns, carronades,
Were of help during freebooter raids:
Sink a ship on the spot
With a blast of large shot
And avoid doing battle with blades.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Possessions can sometimes be charming;
An excess to your health may be harming.
With necessities bare,
In the world you've no care—
That's a prospect I find quite alarming.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Peter's seeming indifference, his easiness,
Is admired, but to me it brings queasiness.
When conditions were rough,
He was careful enough,
But success has engendered a breeziness.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
This discarded used cardboard's my bed,
Where at night I can lay down my head.
It's cast off;  there's a lot—
Don't need mattress or cot.
It ain't fancy or cool, but 'nuff said.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"You want tissue removed from my brain
To examine?"  "Please, let me explain,"
Said the shrink, "My apology.
Through biopsychology,
Not biopsy, insight I'll gain."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The young golfer, on top of his rank,
Hit a bump on the way to the bank
When a bevy of beauties,
A group of real cuties,
Claimed a Tiger had been in their tank.

limerick_list.author: FunkyTuba
limerick_list.text:
My valence is one. That will do.
A radical ring, well, who knew?
Should this still not suffice,
Then to be more precise:
I am C6H5CH2.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I called out to Patricia, "Hey, fatty!
You're the beast that consumed Cincinnati!
You should watch what you eat.
For a sweet no-fat treat,
Would you care for a peppermint, Patty?"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Aborigines love their corroboree,
Engaging in festive hobnobbery.
There's singing and dancing
All night (some romancing),
But little dissension or snobbery.

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
He choked up as he took the long trip
To the plate to test out his new grip.
He choked up on the bat,
But struck out just like that.
He choked up, and they lost three to zip.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A bandster was clearly the guy
Who bound wheat sheaves at harvest. That's why
If you played clarinet,
It's a pretty safe bet
This is one job you'd want to pass by.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She typed "BBFN." I thought, "Wow!
She is telling me 'Bye-bye for now.'
I remember back when
She'd type 'TTFN.'
She is really maturing, and how!"

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
Aphotic means dark as can be,
So dark that you really can't see
Past the nose on your face,
Not a glimmer or trace.
So how can you aim when you pee?

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
You look deep in the sky from your car.
Something small twinkles there from afar.
Astronomical light
That you see in the night
Is an astral appearance, a star.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
Both my front teeth are loose and one's chipped
From a smart-assed remark that I quipped.
I was drinking last night,
When I got in a fight.
But I think that I'll say that I slipped.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"I do." With these words, she did vow,
"Dear, to you, my whole life I endow."
When he led her to bed
(Legs atremble), she said,
"First things first.  The dotation, sir.  Now."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Creamed corn? No, there's no dairy to it—
Just the kernels with gunk running through it.
On the cob, corn is utter
Delight spread with butter,
But creamed means it's easy to chew it.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your nagging, your scolding, your goading—
They're the cause of an awful foreboding.
The burden keeps loading;
I feel like exploding.
Our friendship, my dear, is corroding.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
An aristo named Bartleby Bourne
Returned from his holdings, forlorn.
His estate, once a grand
Aristiferous land,
Now produced not a smidgen of corn.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
My barbershop cuts down the price
Of a haircut each Wednesday; that's nice.
When I said, "Please cut more,"
All my hair hit the floor,
I meant "discount," but now won't have lice!

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Said a botany teacher called Reeves:
"See the bottoms and tops of these leaves?
Those two sides aren't the same.
Such a leaf has a name:
Dorsiventral's the tag it receives."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My gal Val done me wrong, took a groom.
So I sentenced them both to their doom.
Tried to shoot 'em both dead —
Aimed my Colt at 'er head,
But she bolted clear outa the room.

limerick_list.author: neilski
waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
For an adatis, cotton is grown
In India; then, when it's sewn,
It's transported afar
To where cloth-buyers are
And where such cultivation's unknown.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Clarice, just be strong; don't you fright.
You must learn what we need—start tonight.
Even though Dr. Lecter
Will goad, tease and hector,
His bark is much  worse than his bite.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I can lighten a bit of a print
In a darkroom exposure, by dint
Of some dodging. It's neat,
But it's hard to repeat,
And the quality's best when I stint.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Confused by the words gigue and gig?
For musicians, the difference is big.
Gigs will income enhance,
Whereas gigue is a dance
Done in France that's derived from the jig.

limerick_list.author: Margaret Ford
limerick_list.text:
They give many fine hobbies a toss
For the one labeled "down" and "across".
Cruciverbalophiles
Greet each morning with smiles:
They'll be showing new crosswords who's boss.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
They say clothes make the man (of course, yes,
Make the woman as well).  How we dress
Is a status sign.  We
All size up what we see.
That must be why I'm not a success.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
There's a whole lot of -oaching in coaching:
Encroaching on athletes, reproaching.
Some, coaching, attest
That they're coaching their best
When approaching and broaching — then poaching.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Wicked wind's whipping in off the shore,
As a devil dancer's rattling the door.
Mini-whirlwinds are eerie.
But the fireside is cheery.
Let's cuddle up warm, mi amor.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Old man Stokes seems unusually dense.
Folks make jokes at this elder's expense.
Though an old-timer, he
Claims he's just twenty-three,
Speaking dotardly—making no sense.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
He had wordlessly pointed his gun,
And in silence the stick-up was done.
Then by accident he
Shot himself in the knee,
Acting dumbly in more ways than one.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I encountered a fellow who sold
Me this rock; it's worth riches untold!"
"Brother, learn how to buy right;
The stuff's copper pyrite.
Poor soul, what you hold is fool's gold."

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Little ditto marks: simple and neat.
   "       "         "     : aren't they a treat?
Place them right below text,
    "        "     there to show next
Where each word, up above, should repeat.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
"I hate politics," Abbott declared.
Then he served as PM when ensnared
For a "caretaker" term.
He resigned as infirm.
By and large, he is not well compared.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The everyday language I use
Deals with meanings I'd never confuse.
In my active vocabulary
Are words like constabulary,
But not quahog, fusain, or chanteuse.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
I'm a pro-cocarboxylase prattle-ist:
It comes high on my "enzymes that matter" list.
Though it's true TPP
Comes from vitamin B,
It rates A — all known life needs this catalyst.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
An appreciator wrote to relate
That, "Those guys at the zoo were just great!
Their comical skills
Brought us action-packed thrills:
They're penguins — who cares they're not straight?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My sister, a banker, says, "Please!
You have got to invest in CDs."
Though I love the gal dearly,
My future's quite clearly
Secured by my stock of LPs.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
If you think that acidic food's scary,
Then be wary, avoid acetary.
It's acidic, that pulp,
So if such you can't gulp,
Then you're better off sticking with dairy.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Cop aims Colt and calls, "Stop or I'll shoot".
The kid runs — does a bolt. See him scoot.
Big mistake — made a bolt for it.
Shot by that Colt for it.
Justice?  That question's now moot.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"This whole curtilage (building plus grounds)
Stands protected," our agent expounds.
"Every change needs approval;
Even litter removal:
Reviewable. Lose those huge hounds."

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Soft as silk, hard as steel, she was head
Of the party her father once led.
Eight years exiled from home,
She returned, soon to roam:
Now a bomber's made sure that she's dead.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Central Asia's the place of my birth.
Its farms tell you much of its worth,
With rich chernozem soil,
As dark as crude oil —
It's the region, they say, of black earth.

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Your biodegradable cache
Should never be dumped in the trash.
Make compost to feed
That garden you weed.
You'll get great potatoes to mash.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Is it painting? It isn't, not quite.
Is it etching? I think that you might
Consider it so,
But I'll tell what I know:
It's an old aquatinter's delight.

limerick_list.author: proof
Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
We entered the courtroom and saw
Vast proportions, intended to awe:
Ceilings thirty feet high
Carved and bossed to imply
All the grandeur and glory of law.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Does your stereo chirrup and squeak?
Has your datacom path sprung a leak?
Reduced interference
Means mulish adherence
To strong common-mode-path technique.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My friend Atticus claims Bora Bora
Has delightful assortments of flora.
The blossoms gals wear
Gaily twined in their hair
Make him constantly shout, "More-a! More-a!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Kirstie Alley, once bloated, looks great,
Since her figure has shrunk as of late.
Acting talent? Somewhat.
I'm not wild for her, but
She's a diva at taking off weight.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Fetch your father, my boy, but don't dally.
Lurking footpads await in each alley.
They'd confront you, or, worse,
Slit your neck for your purse.
God forbid you face such a finale!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My mama fell into a trench;
Now my nostrils reflexively clench.
Such aroma — she reeks!
The air curdles my cheeks!
Help demephitize Mom — kill the stench!

limerick_list.author: Jonathan M. Guberman
limerick_list.text:
As autocratrix, Catherine led
All of Russia, and aided its spread.
And, although she was "Great,"
There has been much debate
'Bout how much of that spread was in bed.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
It's me mate as I'm having to thank
For last night. I suppose that we drank.
For surely said he,
"Let's us two barleybree."
Then the rest of the evening's a blank.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My urologist treated the flow
Of my pee, which was coming out slow.
"This prescribed medication
Will help urination,"
He said.  "You're all set, good to go."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I don't dive into dumpsters, you fool,
In the same way you'd enter your pool.
Eating scraps every day
Folks like you throw away—
Dumpster diving. My lifestyle's not cool.

limerick_list.author: Dixon Wragg
limerick_list.text:
Ascendance is dominance; might.
It's about who's on top, not who's right.
As we jockey for power
Through each striving hour,
The ascend-dance goes on through the night.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Focalize:  This is a word
That you heretofore may not have heard.
It means simply "to focus
On one certain locus."
Why not just say focus?  Absurd!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Alley cropping: this system, we find,
Brings forth crops and trees growing combined
On the same plot of land.
Here the outcome is grand;
For the welfare of both it's designed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When you visit a capo, my son,
Just be sure you don't carry a gun,
As his goombahs will frisk you.
Being armed is a risk you,
To avoid getting whacked, ought to shun.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
Although some folks are physically fit,
I lack muscles; this fact I'll admit.
 But when co-workers name me
 As "Amyous Amy",
It bothers me just a wee bit.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
On her tour of the plant, our new mayor
Got her head caught athwart a conveyer.
But she proved quite refractory
In her ride through the factory,
And her lawyer insisted we pay her.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
My wide waist is a thing I deplore.
Finding trousers to fit's a big chore.
Nurture: ate jelly beans?
Nature: big belly genes?
I'm not sure I can stomach much more.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
"Come on, give me a point I can use!
Baby's needin' a new pair of shoes!
Show me money, you saps!
I'm an expert at craps!"
"Roll, already! ... It's boxcars! You lose!"

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Anemocracy (rule by the wind,
Or by whimsy) might leave us chagrined
If defined: it's seen use,
But it's rare and abstruse.
(Forgive me, my friends.  I have sinned.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A bazooka's a killer, indeed.
That's when crack is mixed in with your weed.
It's a joint that'll cause
Intellectual flaws,
And your driving skills surely impede.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A cardholder, new in September
To Visa (a platinum member),
Was shocked and made ill
By the first monthly bill,
So she canceled the card in November.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The CEO beckoned, "Come in!"
And his nephew approached with a grin.
"Uncle Vinnie, choose me.
Let me be your VP!"
"No, a  clerkship is where you'll begin!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An augury is a prediction
That allows us, with utter conviction,
To find prescient words
In the entrails of birds,
But to me it's just avian fiction.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A Catholicized country rejects
What the Vatican leader directs.
Though the Pope pushes rhythm,
These Catholics ain't with 'im—
They're putting on condoms for sex.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
We have fun when I ask sleepy Lee
Who his lullaby singer should be.
"So it's time to choose, chum,
Dolcemente from Mum
Or basso profundo from me?"

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
You're entitled to question the Chief,
But remember to beef up your beef.
Cite your sources and quote
An informant of note,
Or your chutzpah will bring you to grief.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"For a birthday gift, what shall I send
To my hard-drinking, high-living friend?"
"Send a death's-head. He'll mull,
When he looks at that skull,
Over life's inescapable end."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
I have found something new to be mad about,
And what's more I am feeling quite sad about
Being called an odd geezer
By my wife. How to please her?
She claims I'm a cranky old gadabout.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I see in the Saturday Mail
That they've scheduled Prince Charles for a sail.
The court circular says
He'll be wearing a fez
In Izmir while on watch for a whale.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The closedown has happened so fast.
We were certain the money would last
Through recessional dips—
Now we must come to grips—
Our employment's a thing of the past.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Alloparents: My "mum" and my "dad",
'Cause I wasn't a baby they'd had.
Of course, they did hold me,
But they never told me
That I was a foundling. That's sad!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Though accountants for Bitten & Claude
Can confirm that their records are flawed,
They'll be forming a firm
While they're serving a term
With a cellmate con-victed of fraud.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The baby's a cute little chappy.
With liquid refreshment, he's happy.
To show he's no dunce,
He does two things at once:
He can throw up and crap in his nappy.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Priest to organist: Just keep on playing.
The church choir's found more cause for delaying
Their processional, and
Seems their latest demand
Is for hymn books that match.  I'll be praying.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
The Damianists say there's just God
And the trinity doctrine is flawed.
They say Father and Son
And the Spirit are One.
I don't think so. That math is just odd!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In the '50s, when I was at school,
We spoke English according to rule.
Now the kids of today
Use some words their own way
Such as awesome, and innit, and cool.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
These fruits of my loins are bad kids.
They display to the world only ids.
I am sick of all three —
You can have them for free!
(They're on eBay, but nobody bids.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A lithograph courier thrives
In the business of brightening lives.
He's delivering prints
By Nat Currier, since
He enjoys seeing Ives hung in dives.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
Consumers, cut costs! Get the scoop on
All the ways you can double that coupon.
"Half Price" and such jargon
Means markdowns: a bargain!
Save bucks, from potatoes to Poupon.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A gammadion cross marks our door:
A vile swastika — hatred hardcore,
Most accursed of brands,
Scrawled by odious hands.
"Pass it over," you counsel? No more!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Recent medical studies on weight
Show particular parts correlate:
Waist-hip ratio's fine
If it's zero-point-nine
In a man; for girls, zero-point-eight.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
My young niece (an enigmatist) Peg
Talks in riddles, and sometimes I beg,
"Won't you give me a rest
From the one you love best:
'Which came first—was it chicken or egg?"'

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
For the apple and cherry and pear,
Common crown gall's a blight they all share.
The bacterium's routes?
Through the crowns, not the fruits.
So don't damage while tending — take care.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I'm home from my job I repair
To my beautiful butterfly chair,
Where I rest in its sling,
And I don't do a thing.
Call me lazy? A slug? I don't care!

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
He staggers home drunk, what a mess!
How he gets there is anyone's guess.
As he wobbles and coggles,
The mind simply boggles:
Does he have an innate GPS?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
No more stalls, Dad — let's put this to rest.
Who's the daughter that you loved the best
Of all six of us girls?
Was it June, with those curls —
About time you came clean and confessed!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In his suit against Dad, Uncle Mort
Was vindictive and not a good sport,
So my dad counter-sued
And he beat that crude dude—
Double damages ruled by the court.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
I had a wee doggie called Maggie; 'er
Coat was quite rugged and shaggy; 'er
Body was fat.
She could run on the flat,
But not upon anything craggier.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The alchemist's goal was auriferous,
But his method turned out celluliferous,
So his output (worse luck)
Wasn't gold, but a duck—
From a barnacle—'twas anatiferous.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Do you long for a strong constitution?
Does your belly need redistribution?
Here's some water — don't spill it.
Now dissolve my pink pill — it
Will become the most perfect solution!

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Cassius Clay's now Muhammad Ali.
Dancing butterfly—sting like a bee.
In Atlanta we saw
This man's trembling paw
Hold the torch that all nations should see.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
'Twas his smoking that finally shut
Off the passion I'd felt in my gut.
Should have known from his strut
He was some kind of nut;
All he left was a cigarette butt.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When she's thin, anorexic, and gaunt,
Take your date to a French restaurant.
It impresses her when you
Look over the menu,
And offer, "Whatever you want."

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The talk show had scheduled a date
With the author, an object of hate.
He arrived at the show
To a warm, rosy glow:
'Twas a book burning, not a debate.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a bug that can't fly, never leaps,
Yet the bristletail gives me the creeps.
King-sized spikes on their tails
Look like stingers or flails,
So I stomp on the (bleep) (bleep) (bleep) (bleeps).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
If you think that we're nude, you're excused.
In that scene, body doubles were used:
Not my co-star nor me
The neck down.  What you see
Are two stand-ins.  We're seamlessly fused.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
He scowled as he walked through the door —
Waved his gun, looking mean to the core.
Then with no further sound,
He chambered a round,
And the patrons collapsed to the floor.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
A gold-plated, filigreed hammer
Is a Scotsman's idea of glamour.
It's impeccable fashion
And useful for bashin'.
It's bonnie. This yin is a brammer!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Two friends of mine, Klaus and Marie,
Are as ugly as ugly can be.
"We're about to be wed!"
They surprisingly said,
"And we're registered." (Yeah, AKC!)

limerick_list.author: Doug Harris
limerick_list.text:
Betweentimes is sort of betwixt
The present in which we're now fixed
And the future that's due.
(I hear tell Doctor Who
Is in trouble for getting them mixed.)

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
It's so hot in Japan, I'm so glad
I can join the Hawaiian shirt fad.
When I doff suit and tie,
Comfy-cool, I can sigh;
My aloha shirt makes me look rad!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though it's called "candy corn," I'm suspicious
Of this Halloween treat.  It's delicious,
But as sure as you're born,
Though the name contains corn,
I suspect that it's not that nutritious.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan M. Guberman
limerick_list.text:
An astrophile's likely to spend
Many hours staring up without end
At the twinkling night sky.
Seeing stars, for this guy,
Makes his telescope start to extend.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
The birthstone of violet quartz
Known as amethyst, legend purports,
Protects one from drinking,
So imbibe without thinking
From cups made from gems of these sorts.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At the wake of my Great-Uncle Glen,
I'm surrounded by grim, somber men.
Made from different stuff, kiddo,
I hit on the widow;
I'm acting the fool once again!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Father Flynn is both dapper and chipper
Now his cassock's equipped with a zipper.
All those buttons were slow
(His arthritis, you know);
Now he's ready to go, and looks hipper.

limerick_list.author: psheil and Anna Pestic
limerick_list.text:
From amaze comes a shock (not of hair),
But from hair comes a lock (brown or fair).
Now this lock needs a key;
Music scales next we see.
We amuse with this maze. Oh what flair!

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Lou Pruitt said, "Screw it, I blew it,"
When his rare insured vial, a cruet,
Was stolen one day.
Would the policy pay?
He forgot he forgot to renew it!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The trail in this tale led to Dale
When his Christmas card came in the mail.
Merry Christmas? Guess not,
Since his card contained pot.
Sending drugs through the mail? Dale's in jail.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
He's collapsed, and can't budge—not a fraction,
Cataplectic defines the reaction.
He's just seen her. It's her!
She's come back; he can't stir—
Till a part of him springs into action.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am tossing out paper.  I binned
Many sheets to protect from the wind:
IOUs from my debtors,
Old memos, and letters
That document how I have sinned.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
There's a loopy-tailed character that
Now allows half the planet to chat.
When your e-mails cross seas
And deep oceans with ease,
Please remember to thank the great @.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Desert rat is the label bestowed
Upon various rodents who've showed
They can live in the sands
Of American lands.
(A dessert rat is served a la mode.)

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
An intense ecological vision
Steered this author's thematic decision.
When engaged in contention
With specious dissension,
He would just mow it down with derision!

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
There are granules of proteins right there,
In the outermost endosperm layer
Of a seed, and they're bound
To the vitamins found
In that place, but the chickens don't care.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've a friend who likes working in zoos,
And this pal's often part of the crews
Who retrieve beasts gone loose.
He's been gored by a moose
And been kicked by some crude kangaroos.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Arcaro was cool, not a ranter.
He rarely enjoyed tack room banter.
Each mount he'd inspire,
Galloped wire to wire.
Opponents cried, "Please Eddie, canter!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Horse's mane where it grows 'twixt his ears,
Or the seat where a cart driver steers,
A platform made fast
To a sailing ship's mast;
Yes, a foretop's all these, it appears.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
You can trust to the oak and the ash;
Ophelia though was more rash.
Aslant the deep brook,
A crack willow she took
As support for her garland; then…

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Start with H, He, Li, Be,
B and C, N and O, F, Ne,
Na, Mg, Al,
Si, P, S, Cl,
Ar, K, Ca; next is Sc.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Your pastor hates pasta? I'll bet he
Hates Monsters of Flying Spaghetti.
No true Pastafarian
Finds noodles scary, an'
Doubting their glory is petty.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Our landlord had dropped out of sight;
He'd defaulted. The sheriff said, "Right,
You must vacate these rooms
'Cause a repo now looms."
We were blindsided: no chance to fight.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
When we dawdle three times then it's thrice.
When we saunter two times it is twice.
When we amble the once,
Then it's eight less than nonce.
If we tootle five times — it is fice.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Asteroidea (starfish) aren't fleet,
But can smell through their small, sticky feet.
Their first stomachs extrude
To engulf largish food;
At their top, they've a hole to excrete.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
"Adore" sounds like "love" plus some more,
But when placed between ceiling and floor
In a frame in the wall,
From a room to the hall,
Without passion, it's simply a door.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I'm accused of a horrible crime—
In a lim'rick I thought was sublime,
My fanciful meter
Would suddenly teeter,
And my first and last lines didn't rhyme.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Someone's hurt and I'm first on the scene.
I'm no doctor or nurse, but I clean
A cut knee's crimson ooze,
Or put ice on a bruise —
First aid's my domain: I'm the queen!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
The Columbia Icefield may slide
Down the great continental divide,
But meltwater goes forth
To the west, east, and north,
And Canadians view it with pride.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
In order to rule on a case,
The district judge looked at your face.
"I can give you a pass
If you'll give me some ass."
Yes, that judge was disbarred in disgrace.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In the ring is a heavyweight stiff
Who'll be knocked to the mat in a jiff.
He's incredibly slow,
And a biff from his foe
Brings the smelling salts out for a sniff.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
"Now why don't you tarry awhile,"
Smirked the boss with a lecherous smile.
"I might just have tarried,"
She said, "but you're married —
And also I think that you're vile."

limerick_list.author: agingjb
limerick_list.text:
King Claudius murdered his brother,
And married the young Hamlet's mother.
This resulted in trouble,
Reducing to rubble
The court, as they slaughtered each other.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Every newspaperman in the East
Calls me "Bigfoot," though I'm not that beast.
Each new column I write
Seems insightful and bright
And ensures that my rep is increased.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
In a pool game there's one ball that's white;
When that cue ball's struck well, you just might
Make your shot and then find
You've been left well aligned
For your next, if your English was right.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Beck described his manure-filled projectile
In words that, to me, sounded rectal.
"What a potty-mouthed boor,"
I thought. "So immature!"
But his language was just dialectal.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When he was in high school, my dad
Danced dumb dances that now are called fad.
They were great for a while,
But were soon out of style.
Mashed Potato, Watusi — man, bad!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"See? Cucurbitins — worms." "You say what?
They eat cucumbers?" "Anything but.
Growing 80 feet long
And segmented but strong,
They are tapeworms and live in your gut."

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Near the mousehole old Pusscat would wait
For the mousie to come for the bait—
A chunk of aged Cheddar;
But mousie knew better,
Thus foiling a fat-feline fate.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
Simon Jackson developed a plan.
To protect the white black bear from man:
He would save 'Spirit Bears',
And while safeguarding lairs
See the government bring in a ban.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My dissolute son who's a rover
Returned Thursday evening from Dover.
His clothing was mud-shot;
His eyes were all bloodshot.
I figured he must be hung-over.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Geological surveys revealed
What the aeons of time had congealed:
The earth's ancient stocks
Of its wide range of rocks
With their long-hidden secrets unsealed.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
It's a name of old fame for a boy,
And a place to embrace, don't be coy:
Alexanderplatz, Alex,
Aptly set in italics,
When you visit Berlin, you'll enjoy.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
So what does a coastguardsman do?
If at sea, should a problem ensue,
He will rescue and search;
No one's left in the lurch.
And our coastlines he guards for us, too.

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
When it comes to delicious creations,
Take a tip from the colourful Haitians.
Their seafoody gumbo
Has shrimp that are jumbo,
Crabs, crawfish and other crustaceans.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
The hills of the Apennine chain
Attract most of Italy's rain.
So wear your fedora
When with your signora,
Although you'll look frightfully vain.

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
To some in the East, this food's manna—
Right up there with soy and banana.
The coconut meat
Is considered a treat
That you eat in your copra cabana.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
In the high Middle Ages in France,
They used discant to dress up their chants.
While the tenors held strong,
Those on top clipped along
Sounding much like they'd ants in their pants.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My feet stink so bad they're unsmellable.
My jokes are so gross they're untellable.
As I email and tweet,
Though I swear I delete,
I've found delible things are indelible.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In football, a cross buck's a call
Where a back fakes receiving the ball,
And then charges the line.
It's a play that works fine
By deceiving the defensive wall.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My cat ran so fast none could beat 'er;
No feline alive could defeat 'er.
Then this fella, Pete Fenster,
Ran a cheetah against her.
Now my race-cat's dead meat.  Pete's a cheater!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I pay extra for caller ID
Since a screen on my phone lets me see
Just who's calling.  My mum?
Sure, I'll take it.  But from
Telemarketers always I'm free.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
I've heard that in Germany there's a
New cheese that's quite creamy, yet shares a
Formaggio thrust
With its white fromage crust —
Cambozola: a composite Käse.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
A chevron's the shape of a V,
Like these « guillemets » used post and pre.
It adorns soldiers' shoulders,
And forms out of boulders
Thrown inland as storm-tossed debris.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, Doc, can you take a quick glance
At my leg, where the ants crawl and dance?"
"Formication—psychosis,"
Came Doc's diagnosis,
"You think you've got ants in your pants."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Do gathered skirts make you look fat?
I believe it would take more than that.
If you added some weight,
I am sure you'd look great.
But, for now, you look bony and flat.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Massive earthslips are no fun at all.
So stay clear when you see a part fall
Off a mountain or hill
Or a cliff. Better still:
Hide behind a stout fence, or a wall.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
When you learn the piano, the key
That is easiest seems to be C.
It's quite elemental—
Unless accidental,
From black notes you're totally free.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
If you love ostentation, you know
Eating caviar's mostly for show.
Serving fish eggs, I guess,
Suits my fancy address:
Number One-Seventeen Sturgeon Row.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
That each church runs itself is a chief
Congregationalism belief.
It was key to reforms
Of society's norms:
Freeing slaves, women's suffrage... Good grief!

limerick_list.author: Surieal
limerick_list.text:
Gray issues hang right at the fray
And, like fringe at a hem, tend to splay:
Is it wrong? Is it right?
Aye or nay? Black or white?
All things dubitable sway either way.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I'm a church member. That means, in short,
That my church I'll attend and support.
I have taken this vow,
And I'm keeping it now,
And in my life this has great import.

limerick_list.author: Amelia A
limerick_list.text:
A church abatvoix is a board
Whose acoustic effect we applaud.
It gives amplification
Of Reverend's oration:
We hear him — and so can the Lord.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Ain't that smartlamppost camera just great.
It can serve up your soul on a plate,
Reading each facial part.
Oh, so state of the art!
Lo, behold the dark art of the State.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
An event makes you go back in time
And, whilst there, what you do is the prime
Starting link in a chain
That will loop round again
To the point where you go back in time...

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Burned in effigy—that was insane!"
Called the rioter. "Let me explain:
This would normally be
Just symbolic, but we
Burned the bastard in Effigy, Maine."

limerick_list.author: Matt
limerick_list.text:
The  apple  that falls from the tree
Doesn't go very far, you'll agree.
But, if dropped on a hill,
It could roll to a rill
And then possibly float out to sea.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You think things are bad now?  Just you wait.
With the Dvapara Yuga our fate
Here and now, times get worse:
Kali Yuga's a curse.
Live through that, then the Satya is great.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
My favorite psychic, named Clare,
Is an augur beyond all compare.
That's why I was shocked
When a customer knocked,
And Clare promptly inquired, "Who's there?"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a circle rolls 'round in the plane,
'Round the rim of another, obtain
From the trace of its path,
As they teach you in math,
Epicycloids, a curve that's arcane.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Facinorous, aren't you, my dear?
You're more wicked than anyone here.
You're a dirty old stick,
And it sure makes me sick
When you sneak baby's pee in my beer.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Guano helps in my garden," Frank vows.
Using birdshit sounds strange, he allows,
"But you can't let plants droop.
My petunias love poop!"
(Well, it works when the stuff comes from cows.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am now a decided believer
That this term is an awful deceiver.
It goes on as it pleases
To name two diseases,
So who has got which famine fever?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Countersignatures go on the line
Just below where another would sign
To endorse what is stated
Above and, when dated,
Say legally, "Everything's fine."

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
What a blow the young virgin was dealt,
How uttterly foolish she felt,
When a stopcock, she learned,
Was a tap that you turned:
She had thought 'twas a chastity belt.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If it's out in the boonies you are,
And from civilization you're far,
And you're bit by a snake
I suggest that you take
Button snakeroot (that is, blazing star).

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Dear, I'll go to your scary church supper,
But I'll keep a stiff lip (the one upper)
At that late faith-group meal
Where for bucks they appeal —
I'd be glad if such suppers they'd scupper.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Was he sick?  Did he have diabetes?
Was he weak from not eating his Wheaties?
She'd loved Troilus; how strange!
Why did Cressida change
And just dump him for Greek Diomedes?

limerick_list.author: Pie Snelson
limerick_list.text:
When Pa got his luggage in Reno,
He found he'd forgotten his Beano.
He lit up the joint,
But more to the point,
His win(d) emptied out the casino.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
To analyze codes weak or strong
In hopes you may crack them ere long
Is useless, say critics
Of cryptanalytics.
(I'm happy to tell you they're wrong.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For Santa, 'twas all going well
Till he slipped on the rooftop and fell.
After banging the chimney,
He now has a grim knee:
A partially torn ACL.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Eddie Cantor, a favorite of mine,
I still think of whenever I dine.
I don't sit and recall
His routines—not at all—
I just drink Eddie Cantor of wine.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
If the genes you were born with have flaws,
And you can't fix the primary cause,
Get a brace for your feet,
Or adjust what you eat.
Called euphenics, it's cause for applause.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
This asthenia's making me mild
(I am weak, with the strength of a child).
Now let's guess at the reasons:
I've too many seasons?
Or maybe my lover just smiled!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That was wrong, even though you were right:
Stupid comment — we're in for a fight.
Call their editor pompous?
He's boxing the compass.
We'll lose his endorsement tonight.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
The trouble with call-fire, folks,
Is it's fired by brotherly blokes
Who might hit one's position
With live ammunition,
Delighting one's foes when one croaks.

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
I'm synonymous now with defeat,
Since a ski jump I failed to complete
Caused my fall down a hill,
And that televised spill
Means my agony still will repeat.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Said Obama, "I'm taken aback.
We have drawn down our troops in Iraq,
And the peace, I say sadly,
Is going quite badly:
I just don't deserve all this flak."

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
When them hippies up thar on their farm
Tol' me "Earth nut pee" cain't do no harm,
I purt' near had thrombosis.
But L. tuberosus
(Or earthnut pea) shouldn't alarm.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
He raves on—like a brook, unabated,
He keeps babbling and babbling. His hated
Logorrhea is awful—
They should make it unlawful.
You'll take him away? We're elated!

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
To debilitate (weaken) your foe,
You should taunt him and deal him a blow,
Make him suffer and sweat,
Be as mean as they get,
Box his ear, bite his nose, break his toe.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
In dochmius, syllables sound
Five full times; in this order they're found:
Short, long, long, short, long
(Two are weak and three strong),
But it's anapest that is renowned.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Cushion calamint (dog mint) is found
In dry grasslands and heathlands, where ground
Holds some limestone or chalk.
I squat on my walk
To see paired hairy leaves, flower-crowned.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
I have not heard a word since we parted.
Did I dream of the fire that we started?
Was it real? Was it true?
Did you feel the warmth too?
Will you leave me ensnared, broken-hearted?

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I'm incensed by your vicious review
Of my Beethoven's Fifth on kazoo.
That critical tweaking
Is why we're not speaking—
No way did I "suck" as I blew!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Made with orange rind, almond, and raisin,
This coffee cake's truly amazin'.
A baba who's sweet
Is the source of my treat.
All her babkas are worthy of praisin'.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
We call a thing dentate, dentated,
That's jagged or cogged, crenellated,
Displaying erections
Of tooth-like projections
Or points making edges serrated.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The coruco that sucks on the hen
That we keep by the barn in a pen
Is contented and snug.
A hemipterous bug,
He enjoys a good bite now and then.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
At the checkout, a shopper named Jo
Showed impatience, which started to grow:
"Though my buying's complete
I await my receipt
As their dot-matrix printer's so slow."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Tom Bosley deserved all our praise
As the dad in the show Happy Days.
He was warm, never phony,
And he once won a Tony—
Fiorello!, the best of his plays.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
And S. Mason (ostensively K)
Sobs, "Aw, pants, Alnoy. K's sordid. Say
Alalaya's Di Drossky,
On last nap, was bosky...
Levis net Son o' Sam's DNA!"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
In the pet shop I stopped as I shopped,
But that floppy-eared pup had been chopped:
Ears and tail had been lopped,
And his hair had been cropped,
Leaving too little dog to adopt.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
A domain name's an address for sites.
Over good ones there often are fights:
IRS.com's one,
Google/Groovle — what fun!
And the winner takes all website rights.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
In a fury, my father appears.
He has steam coming out of both ears.
So we swiftly deduce
That it's time to vamoose.
Just one end is in sight—it's our rears.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
To interpret this page, use the key
To the legend above; or else see,
If a word isn't clear,
What it means, given here
In the clavis—it's no potpourri.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The cigarette leaf that I'm foldin'
Was smoked by Chileans of olden.
It's hypnotic! I'm fried
By the kicker inside:
Glucosidal, the alkaloid boldin.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though Death Row's overcrowded today,
The electric chair causes delay.
With a sofa, however,
By pulling one lever
We could execute more straightaway.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Grandiloquous people (and yes,
Now grandiloquent) tried to impress,
Being fancy and formal—
Thus, far above normal—
Using ten-dollar words in excess.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Cravened wussies, that's just what you are;
Your fraidycat-ness is bizarre.
Here a black widow flits
And you both lose your wits —
Though she sits in a jar in a jar.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
At a nightclub in Bahia Blanca,
A gullible Argentine banker
Paid 10,000 pesos
For two small espresos
And a dance with a dame called Bianca.

limerick_list.author: Chris Baker
limerick_list.text:
Autographically: written by me
(I give you my true guarantee.)
But for reasons of clarity
And showing great charity,
My girlfriend has typed it for free.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Here's a royalty check I'll encash
(Change to bucks) from my books. They're a smash.
About scandalous nuns,
They are making me tons —
How sales jump when the Church calls 'em "trash"!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On the beach, when you wear a bikini,
Think of plates etched by whom? P. M. Pini,
From Eustachio's dissection.
They had a connection;
Was Pini the scientist's genie?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
You have anabohitsite in stock?
This pyroxenite-olivine rock
Will become my new pet—
A possession I'm set
To appreciate, pamper, and grok.

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Reading microfilm's hard on the eyes,
So expand it to legible size.
If you're cheap when you copy,
The blowback is sloppy:
Yours left grit on my hands and my thighs.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Where communitas spirit pervades,
Any self-centered interest just fades.
All members are equal —
The natural sequel
To loving and caring in spades.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In business, where waste is provoking,
Our days are consumed with colloquing.
We meet and converse
While our problems grow worse.
Let's sit down and discuss why we're choking.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Cirrocumulus catches the eye:
Ice-particle clouds, way up high.
You may well lick your lips,
Adding salt to your chips,
But you can't eat a mackerel sky.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Losing power while landing, he's miffed,
So the pilot's reaction is swift.
With the airflow that wraps
Around wings and their flaps,
He can give the plane much-needed lift.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
As if using an adze were not pure enough,
And spelling it adz weren't obscure enough,
A fellow named Gaddis
Would call it his addice.
A triple archaism, sure enough.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Being broke gets you down, if you let it.
Go ahead, seek a letter of credit.
As account party, you
Will be no longer be blue.
(That's assuming, of course, that you get it.)

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
To commode once had meanings "to suit",
Or "to furnish with something quite cute",
Or "to put in good order".
My lines here record a
Few meanings now given the boot.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
When climbing a tree that starts bending,
You'd better start quickly descending.
If you fail to turn back
You might hear a loud crack
And may find you've got bones that need mending.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If your forebrain works well, you've a keen brain,
And your cerebral hemispheres mean brain;
But the thalamus and
Hypothalamus stand
For emotion—the mighty "betweenbrain."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The grazing's well-nigh given out—
Cattle carcasses scattered about.
Fourteen months since it's rained;
Our capacity's strained.
This die-up is caused by the drought.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Misguided — arresting the young
For acid drops placed on the tongue.
When the cops found out we
Didn't do LSD
But did lemony drops, we got sprung.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
That helmeted Pilgrim, Miles Standish,
Loved blondes, and he started to blandish
A lass who was blondish
Of whom he was fondish.
His actions were branded outlandish.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Used by Audubon, arsenic was
A preservative needed because
As insecticide, he
Could keep bird skins bug-free.
Its sweet almond smell stays, yes it does.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Diarrhœa has some difficult bits
(That's apart from loose motions and squits).
If the ligature's missing
(That's 'o' and 'e' kissing)
It's a Yank's; if it's there, it's a Brit's.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A critic who's captious upsets
The poor folks who fall into his nets.
To a captious inquiry,
Responses are fiery.
I suggest we shun both of them—let's!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
"Leonardo's bike", clearly a fake,
Puts the bicycle's history at stake.
Not as rapidly cleared
As it once had appeared:
Some "historians" back that mistake.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I don't dare to say this aloud,
And not over here in a crowd —
But lim'ricks are fun,
And I've only begun
(Though I'm still just a tiny bit cowed).

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
The instructions admonished: "Take care.
Add the yolks to the mix you prepare
Gradatim; that is,
By degrees." Now, pop quiz:
Tell me how to clean egg out of hair.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The crocodile lives in the river,
And his jaws can deliver a shiver.
As he's smirking beneath
That great mouth full of teeth,
He's contriving to dine on my liver.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The bwave hunter was hopelessly muddled;
In a snowbank, he'd shivered and huddled,
'Til he spotted a wabbit,
And twied vainly to nab it:
That wascal had Elmer befuddled.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Waste no time, barman, hurry and bring
Me a drink, and your praise I will sing.
Guests arrive, briefly stay,
But they all pass away;
In this pub, you're the one constant thing.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
At the clinic, Diseases (Venereal),
I am told my infection's bacterial.
"It's a chancroid," they say.
That rat Hank's gonna pay!
Rodent bait will go great in his cereal!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
American bluehearts aren't blue
But the palest of lavenders. Do
They feel blue 'cause we slur 'em
With names like bupleurum?
That's "ox-rib," you parasite, you.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Though my brain I have thoroughly racked,
I don't grasp all this art that's abstract.
You proclaim that white patch is
An egg? It soon hatches?
The egg and the artist are cracked!

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Her assets she  manages  well.
Her portfolio casts quite a spell.
Her stocks always rise
And so,  in his eyes,
She could cause his investments to swell.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The sport floorball should not leave you bruised.
It's like hockey, but don't be confused.
There's no puck, there's no ice,
There's no roughness (play nice!)
And what looks like a wiffle ball's used.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
A ville near Paris called Clichy
Belonged to the lords of Livry.
It was once used for sport
As a hunting resort
And has ties Neolithic, aussi.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A young senator jumped in the fray;
He's the Democrat running today.
Will this talented dark horse
Who's steering a star course
Be president? Many say nay.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
An androphagous hullabaloo
About comic and harlequin stew:
An annoying buffoon
Said while dipping his spoon,
"Does this dinner taste funny to you?"

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Astronautically speaking, an ape
Anteceded a man to escape
Far from gravity's clutch,
Where he didn't do much
With no porthole through which he could gape.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
Part four in a song makes it strong;
With the bass all the rest get along.
Like a "ding" without "dong,"
Or a "ping" without "pong,"
To omit the deep voice is all wrong.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
He eyes me, the glint greenish gold,
Until in my arms I enfold
That smooth sorrel fur,
Wrapped around a loud purr,
Which this "Rasta" cat doesn't withhold.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The officer labeled commissioned
(Not a sergeant) has long been conditioned
To a life free from sin.
If it's trouble you're in,
With cheap sex he won't be propositioned.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On our streets they are neatly arrayed—
These attractive Dutch elms that give shade
As their branches are spread.
Will they all soon be dead?
There's an illness we dread, I'm afraid.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When you cruise in a car, then you go
At a speed that is steady—just so.
Near the limit is best,
Though the safety-obsessed
Often drive unbelievably slow.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
"Give us glasnost!" the dissidents say.
"Let us see what's been hidden away!"
It's transparency's friend;
This aberrancy trend
Is a break from the Bolshoi ballet.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Since coffee's a cheap agrypnotic,
My counting of sheep is robotic.
Each morning I rise
And another man dies.
This insomnia's why I'm psychotic.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Marlon Brando! A name that still smacks
Of virility jerked to the max.
How 'bout you?  Take a swig,
Say, "You....scum.....suckin'...pig!"
Play the lead in his film One-Eyed Jacks.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
My pirate friends always have said
Tales aren't told if the teller is dead.
So I'll bury my gold;
Where it's hid won't  be told
'Cause I'm shooting myself in the head.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's aculeolate (something that's prickly),
Not sagging, or sad, and not sickly.
Each tiny point sticks
Out, and each of them pricks;
On the stem it is covered quite thickly.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
This limerick's free-
form. It does
Not
belong
in the lim-
er-
ick
class.
Its rhymes are
off
And its rhythm, too,
But I like it.
It's
neat.
It's a gas.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Said a C++ programmer, Lee,
"Cross-compilers are great tools for me.
I have earned some nice wages
Writing code for smart  gauges,
And those robots that brew up your tea."

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
There's a trunk in your trunk that extends
From your heart, full of blood, then descends.
The aorta will feed
Every branch that you need—
The most heartfelt of all bosom friends!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Same old cola, now flavored with peach:
Our new flanker's extended our reach.
There's a market untapped?
Add a flavor, adapt —
Variation! Step into that breach.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
No Washington Redskins appear
To have noses to grindstones this year.
They're just rich sons-a-bitches—
Too big for their britches—
All chiefs and no Indians here.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A divisive old dude who was bright
