Argued, "Issues are black or they're white.
Those shades of off-gray?
They don't make my day.
Don't agree? Well, then go fly a kite!"

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
You're cocksure, presumptuous, slick.
You think you're the best, but you're thick.
You are so immature—
It's not that that's "for sure",
But a rooster that grew from a chick.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
As our conscience, Elizabeth Chace
Believed slavery the nation's disgrace,
So her home was a station —
An escaped slave's salvation —
When he needed a good hiding place.

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
Now our land has some laws (antitrust).
Corporations may feel the codes' thrust.
You desire to merge?
Better rein in your urge.
A review of your plan is a must.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A falling-star teased at my eye;
Meteorically fast, it flashed by.
My opinion is strong:
The professors are wrong.
You think rocks really drop from the sky?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Most writers would rather have less
Disconcertion—discomfort and stress.
But we editors know,
As our efforts here show,
That exacting demands breed success.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
Those Dems who have collars of brass
Aren't easy to rattle with sass.
For they wear the same sign:
"Vote the strict party line!"
Seems the Donkey makes each one an ass.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
To a building that looks like a yurt,
They ride in and let treasures divert.
From the Capitol steppes
You know each of these Reps
Will just take while you give till you hurt.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Are we landing our plane? No, we thought to,
But we can't see the runway we ought to.
These pea-soup conditions
Dictate our decisions:
We go around, as we were taught to.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Glenda Phelps's face lit up with glee:
"Gleeful Glenda's the new name for me!
Always merry and bright,
I'm a constant delight."
Others cried at the wake, but not she!

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The rest of our rhyme clearly shows,
In the garden, the Maid hanging clothes,
When a blackbird (now free)
From his perch in a tree
Swiftly swept in and pecked off her nose.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
There's a musical statement I know
Called a break strain, that ruptures the flow
Of a march or a rag.
It's a battle-sound flag
That for war tunes is most apropos.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
If the Torah's law leaves you perplexed,
Then the learned halacha's your text;
But if it's a peek
At the folklore you seek,
The aggadah's the thing to read next.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
In the North, where the countryside's hilly,
Lives a naturist, William Lillee.
He'll expose, when it snows,
From his nose to his toes—
Silly Billy!  No wonder he's chilly!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Drive the limo?  My parents won't let me.
Where's that driver they promised to get me?
Now my driver's appeared:
It's a golf club.  They're weird,
Going out of their way to upset me.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Though it's naming's a trifle ironic,
Tex's mouth organ skill is demonic.
His tin sandwich blows blue
Or a sweet "howdy-do."
That French harp has a range that's symphonic.

limerick_list.author: PGS
Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
While I watched educational shows,
A serious question arose:
Could I earn a degree
Just by watching TV?
Cable's cheaper than school, I suppose.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Now we come to our best item yet.
Place a bid on this nice bassinet!
It's authentic Peruvian
Antediluvian
Wicker. And look, it's still wet!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When it's autumn, what chore makes me smile?
To coacervate leaves in a pile.
I jump in when I'm done,
Which is not as much fun
When they're placed on the ground single file.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Conversing in bars was normality
Till the smoking ban hit this locality.
Are they joking? "No smoking"
Provoking our soaking
Is choking our conviviality.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Aaron was the brother of Moses.
In Old Testament verse he reposes.
A priest of some might
For the Israelites,
And that's about all that I knowses.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The resorts of Spain's Costa del Sol
Have long been a popular goal.
Moor your yacht at a club;
Do a spa, get a rub,
Hit a beach. It'll help you feel whole.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The dog collar worn by a priest
Is so stiff that it never looks creased,
And it's always pure white—
Quite a comforting sight.
It's a shame it was named for a beast.

limerick_list.author: Bill Dorner
limerick_list.text:
Marco Polo went trekkin' and mappin'
Through the East and the West overlappin'.
With his Orient trade,
What he certainly made
Was an Occident waitin' to happen.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
From that pulpit appointed for prayer,
Compassionless words chill the air:
Not the least understanding,
But cold and demanding.
He's a merciless, smug doctrinaire.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
On the logo of Auntie Peg's pies
It's repeated in much smaller size,
And on that one, it's true,
Can be seen you-know-who
If the viewer has excellent eyes.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
In the course of my life I've tried lots
Of packaging, packing up pots.
Bubblewrap is fantastic,
Just air trapped in plastic—
Technology calling the shots!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
For assembling the famed Model T,
All components were strictly snag-free.
Each part faithfully true,
With nothing askew:
Sure fidelity, that was the key.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Grandma threw Grandpa's shirts all away,
As their cuffs were beginning to fray,
And the collars as well.
Now he's giving her hell —
Poor old girl has the devil to pay!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Sitting down in the barber-shop chair,
Moaned the bald-headed man, "It's not fair
That I pay the full price,
Since I'm done in a trice
Now my head's growing up through my hair."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That stuff's gross, and you've just had a drink of it?
It's viscous and black — and you stink of it.
You go back to that store,
And you give them what for!
'Cause it makes my flesh creep just to think of it.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"Lads, it's one out and all out!," cried Mike.
"Every boss treats his labourforce like
We're machines — plus poor pay:
We'll down tools, have our say."
We're like squaddies, and Mike's General Strike.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Said Smokey, "I'm sworn to report
I observed him committing a tort:
The defendant's a liar
Who started a fire,
And now I'll bear witness in court."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Folks attended, way back in the day,
To what Franklin Pierce Adams would say.
He was wise: "Too much truth,"
He once said, "is uncouth,"
In a column he signed F.P.A.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Junior's stance is attentive, en garde,
As he waits with his sword in the yard.
Sure, he's ready to lunge,
But his blade's made of sponge,
So I'm certain you won't end up scarred.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Does my girlfriend love ferrets? And how!
She perceives them to be her cash cow.
In groups, they sell well.
She's a hit, I can tell,
In the busyness business right now.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I pray that you ladies excuse
My three sneezes, with forceful "achoos."
So fast did they issue,
I hadn't a tissue;
I fear I have moistened your shoes.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Befriend: "be a buddy of mine,"
Is a word from 1559.
We're not friends any more?
The year 2004
Brought defriend: "friendship's end of the line."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our exclusivism doctrine appalls
Idealists, but we've had the balls
Since about '62
To forbid any crew-
cutted hippie from walking these halls!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Most everyone knows you don't dare a bull.
In a similar vein, it's a terrible
Resolve you incite
If you're picking a fight
With one dormant whose might is unbearable.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The word eugh's an old word for a tree
That is common. You're likely to see
Its fine wood in my bow
(I'm an archer, you know),
Though the tree's named for yew and not me.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Foliicolous fungi of leaves
Parasitically thrive, thick as thieves,
Leaving lesions, dark dots,
Early leaf-fall in spots.
Trees live on, though, so nobody grieves.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
I have noticed alluvious themes
And connections 'twixt cultures and streams,
For my forebears did lay
Down the subconscious clay
That's the base of my own field of memes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your abscess requires aspiration?
There's no need for undue hesitation.
We are docs; come to us
And we'll draw out the pus
Without muss, without fuss or frustration.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Stern rebuke: carbon crisis reviewed.
If we fail to take action, as cued
By this desperate warning,
The warming that's dawning
Means famine and floods; then we're screwed.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Yes, that brown stuff that's stuck to my skirt
Is quite vile, and the worst kind of dirt.
Over cobbles unwashed
Through the muck I have sloshed.
Say I stink, and you too will feel hurt!

limerick_list.author: Allison C. Liddell
limerick_list.text:
An abactor is somebody who
Likes to take things (not his) that say moo.
But there's one little flaw —
If he's caught by the law,
He'll be up to his eyes in cow poo.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You told me she's cute.  That's a stretch.
And her odor?  I wanted to retch!
That blind date went just ducky!
You say I'm real lucky
To find her?  Oh, yeah!  What a catch!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I'm a symbol of protest up north,
And the better to body it forth
I will build me a soddie
(They'll say that I'm dotty)
With turves from the capitol's swarth.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Abstractness is seen throughout art—
It's a style Pollock had in his heart.
Two drips and a splatter
Are all that might matter
In telling, from trash, it apart.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Auntie Dee, on this holiday—Easter—
On both ham and roast lamb was a feaster.
Every year she'd pig out.
You'd have thought she'd be stout,
But each summer a diet decreased 'er.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
That religious indifference you see
Is acedia; call it ennui,
Call it apathy, boredom
Or sloth.  (I've ignored Him.)
Whatever you do, don't call me.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
To call it a "dimmer" seems right,
When we make our surroundings less bright.
But its name seems a glitch
When, by twisting that switch,
We're increasing the brilliance of light.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
A czar is a tzar is a tsar —
It's the plum job in Russia by far.
At the top of the tree,
Decked in purple, is he
Who commands proto-U.S.S.R.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
I am sorely bereft of elation
To find I'm defining causation.
No philosopher, I'd
Prefer spears in my side.
The causation? Elation's negation.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Agapanthus are lilies of the Nile,
But where have they been this long while?
Their summery blooms,
Brought indoors, brighten rooms,
But it's winter, so none make me smile.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
I felt cool, shooting pool with young Max,
But, on cue, my technique showed its cracks.
Badly aiming my cue
Meant my kudos was through:
Never slack, shouted Max, "Don't pot blacks."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
She farms them both out willy nilly,
Her two children, young Arthur and Billy.
She will send them away
To her neighbours to play.
They are rarely at home, which is silly.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Chocolate ice cream's my favorite treat,
So I hijacked a truck in the street.
Now I'm pleased to report
It'll never fall short;
It'll take me a lifetime to eat.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
A bug with a name I can't say
Will wipe facial wrinkles away.
No muscle contractions
Betray your reactions
While Botox holds nature at bay.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A hectoring, tense-atmospheric,
Hysterical lecturing cleric
Is Derek. His class
Has defected en masse
Toward Eric, who's more esoteric.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Sweet potatoes, with harvest complete,
Need curing with moist air and heat.
This aids their survival
And flawless arrival
For sale — with the roots firm and sweet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Of the argan you seldom will hear.
It's a tree found where grass is most sere.
Though you won't find a taco
Way out in Morocco,
Argan oil may on menus appear.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The hole in my bladder was mended
With sutures. Says Doc, "It's now splendid!"
Though I always abhor a fee,
Pricey cystorrhaphy
Saved me. My cash was expended.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
We have similar looks, me and Ike;
Corresponding; resemblant; alike.
It's a cross I can't bear,
Though I doubt I would care
If he wasn't a Pollicle tyke.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
First he waved, then he motioned mysteriously.
I thought: "Am I seeing deliriously?"
But he earnestly beckoned.
"It's a signal," I reckoned;
The policeman was calling me seriously.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Your airship floats high in the sky,
But you don't have the slightest clue why!
The gasbags inside it
Are there to provide it
The lift when you guide it to fly.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The commandments of God numbered ten.
They were given to Moses who then
Said the words, "Do not choose
To abuse or refuse
Them, for God loves you dearly." Amen.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Out of luck, out of work, made a choice:
Hung his shingle out, gave himself voice.
Now he's called a consultant
With high fees resultant
To go with his leased, used Rolls Royce.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A Biltmore stick's neat as can be.
It's a way that I measure a tree
And determine how thick
Are the ones that they'll pick
To be felled (once the cutters agree).

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
The arctangent's a function from trig
With a fanciful S-curve, not big.
I could further expound,
But most folks, I have found,
For this subject could not give a fig.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB and nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
Tight-lipped Benny had asked me to sup;
I was happy and really dressed up.
Over coffee was when
He said, "Cupulate?" Then
I freaked out. (It means "shaped like a cup.")

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Enabling legislation, we see,
Was passed in nineteen-thirty-three;
And one Adolf Hitler,
Once very much littler,
Now posed as the powers that be.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
Study water-filled, bubbling tubs,
Or a spa, where the wealthy get rubs.
Take a look at geography
For more balneography:
A city in England (with pubs).

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
There are versatile types of bacteria
Called facultative. Yes, son, I hear ya.
Thrive with air, thrive without,
That's what these are about.
What? You don't want 'em anywhere near ya?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Many people debate over dinner
Famous author (deceased) Doctor Skinner:
"Pigeons cannot portray
Mankind's psyche today.
Never label bizarre Skinner winner."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Whilst to atheist ears Father-God
May be words that will sound rather odd
(Like The Spirit and Son
With The Father are one),
Many Christians will reverently nod.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
A recent upgrader named Shawn
Said, "I once thought the 'Net was a yawn;
But now I'm just swimmin'
In half-naked wimmin:
This ADSL's tops for porn!"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Gracie comes through the door and the most
Piercing scream meets her ears, as her host,
Unaware that a face
Pack helps Gracie look ace,
Sees a white, lathered mask and shrieks, "GHOST!"

limerick_list.author: RalphTheDog
limerick_list.text:
Since common sense is, at best, chancy,
And inventors endure flights of fancy,
Some American fools
Came up with some rules
And created a group known as ANSI.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A young barman, who meant no offence,
Had a way of predicting events,
Or perhaps, to suggest
How the day might end best:
He would call out, "Now ladies please gents!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Our declarative memory's a kind
That's long-term.  We can easily find
Our stored facts and events.
With emotions intense,
It improves.  My lost love springs to mind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Not a capital city, Chowchilla
Isn't famous, like Rome or Manila,
But a horrible crime
Made it known for a time:
Kidnapped kids, buried van—what a thrilla!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Bring such riff-raff for beef on a bun?
Social mixing is simply not done.
Please, curb your hilarity.
Such gross familiarity
Breeds contempt for their betters, my son.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I hear you'll be leaving us soon, Yun,
Thrown out of our Catholic union.
Henceforth shall you be
Excommunicate, see,
Never more to take holy communion.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
If by chance you could get introduced
To the whalebird, you might be seduced.
With a bill like a shoe,
It would grace any zoo —
Yes, Balaeniceps rex rules the roost.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Caloricity's why, I'm surmising,
I'm flushed and my temperature's rising.
It's the opposite sex
That provokes these effects.
We're animals — what's so surprising?

limerick_list.author: Beverley Sharp
limerick_list.text:
Way down south of the ol' Mason-Dixon,
There's a dark, headless cabbage we're fixin'.
Have you tried collard greens?
(Not blue-collared; that means
Something else.)  Now, y'all come! Get your licks in.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
It's a cloth made from cotton that's dyed.
It is woven, and has no wrong side.
Gingham often is checked.
That's how Dorothy's bedecked;
So was Brigitte Bardot as a bride.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In a war, you should always enhance
Your position when given the chance.
Never say you "retreat,"
Since that sounds like defeat.
What to do in that case? "Disadvance."

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
The cochin's a fine fowl with a lot
Of grand plumage where others have not —
Looking fluffy and neat,
Feathered down to the feet,
But just chickens when plucked for the pot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"This drawtube works smoothly," said Mother.
"One tube slides inside of another
Of larger diameter—
The latter parameter
Casts the outer as, well, the big brother."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is hard to be charming and smart
When you're asked to explain abstract art
Where the line and the smear
Of paint there and here
Speak not to the head but the heart.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Sometimes anger and rage levels spike,
And you just wanna yell, "Take a hike!"
When you feel boiling mad
Cuz your day's going bad,
Count to ten... and then make your first strike.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
In a typical mystery story,
Some detective inspector wins glory
By explaining those clues
That were meant to confuse
How that corpse became bloodstained and gory.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Common knowledge suggests," proclaims Louis,
 "Universally known."  I say, "Phooey!"
We all know it's true
There are always a few
Who don't get the message.  (Or do we?)

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
In baseball, the Sox were the worst;
Some other team always came first.
When they traded Babe Ruth,
They just sank—that's the truth—
All the fans thought the team was accursed.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
There are exits that end with no pang
Of remorse, or a knell's muffled clang.
Thus this chapter I'll shut
Not with whispering, but
An explosive, loud noise called a bang!

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
When your credit is caught in the crunch,
Don't rely on a whimsical hunch—
Double-check what seems best
And play close to your chest
In a world that seems right out to lunch!

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
I'm aware you need food and a drink, cat,
But my bird's not a meal, as you think, cat.
I'm not giving an inch,
So stop eyeing my finch!
You're not chewing my pretty chewink, cat!

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Can we think of Creation as mere,
Sheer, mad culture—a mess of some beer
Being brewed in a Pe-
tri-like dish in which we
Are evolving? That's how come we're here!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
He elaborates details he's planned
For a home on his new piece of land.
A huge mansion, ornate—
And, alas, it's our fate
To live opposite.  (Let's hope it's banned!)

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
My decision to pose in the nude
In the classroom was not at all shrewd.
First the girls looked insulted,
Then fighting resulted...
And rows, plus a long drawn-out feud.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The capuchins called white-faced excel
In intelligence—service, as well.
The handicapped choose them,
Organ grinders would use them,
And on Friends, there's the role of "Marcel."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I was challenged to rhyme the word indigo.
'Twas a test that impelled me (chagrinned) to go
Booze with a friend,
And so here's what I penned
Just a while (when three sheets to the wind) ago.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown and Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
My grandma's a knickknack collector,
A trinket and tchotchke detector;
But she likes them for free. Below
Coats go the bibelots.
She shoplifts, though none will suspect her.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A technophobe hailing from Perth
Wished Bill Gates had been strangled at birth.
His considered opinion?
The fellow's dominion
Proved the geek shall inherit the earth.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Their motions are graceful and true:
An aquatic ballet pas de deux.
Can a synchronized swim
Lead to accidents grim—
If one drowns does the other drown too?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In today's presidential campaign,
Who'll prevail? Will Obama? McCain?
With the truth stretched to lies,
It will prove no surprise
If the voters decide to abstain.

limerick_list.author: John Weigel
limerick_list.text:
High oration, that is the term:
This altiloquence makes a man squirm;
So when hard a golf club ya
Swing at balls like G Dubya,
Just ignore the prov'd truth and stay firm.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Airelle is a bilberry (wild),
They told me when I was a child.
But its flavor is tame,
So when served with some game
It tastes pleasantly subtle and mild.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A conduct disorder's not sporty
In women or men over forty.
It's simply a pain
When they're childish again
(And in children, we just call it "naughty").

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm chimerically planning a trip
To the moon. When I land, I'll unzip
And explore the terrain.
There'll be lakes of champagne
Where I'll skinny (with moon maidens!) dip.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
May the Earth Day we celebrate bring
Understanding for each living thing:
For all humans, all creatures,
All earth's simple features;
Give nature a thought every spring.

limerick_list.author: Fergus Follower
limerick_list.text:
If the chromosomes won't make a pair
To grow wings that can soar through the air,
You'll end up with a duck
Who is quite out of luck,
Asynapsis his cause for despair.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I saved lots for a boat—a whole pot
Of Canadian dollars," said Scott.
"But devalued, their worth
In each country on earth
Is the price of a raft, not a yacht."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend has a problem.  He's seeking
My help, and I fear that he's freaking.
To ask why is absurd,
As he can't say the word
Baryphonic; his trouble is speaking.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Disestablishmentarian, well,
His intention is clear as a bell;
He'd like to unmate
The Church from the State,
For some Anglicans, 'ringing the knell'.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Dear taxpayers, now kindly bail
Out our bank — that's the sting in the tail
Of your long spending spree.
(Nice fat bonus for me:
It's great to be 'too big to fail'.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The dread dogs of war are set free!
That means havoc's unleashed, all agree.
There'll be pain; the young dying,
Their mourning kin crying;
Oh, what death and destruction we'll see!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A chalder's an eighth of a keel,
But I question this unit's appeal.
Forty bushels of buns,
Or if coal, then three tons,
Is, for carrying, less than ideal.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Saying darling shows love, he will claim.
Maybe so, though when used in the game
Of romancing may mean
Other dates on the scene—
And he's simply forgotten your name!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
White supremacists feel great relief;
Under Trump they shall not come to grief.
He's a bigoted guy,
Just like them. Their new cry:
"Heil Donald, heil Bigot-in-Chief!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's nothing quite like almond butter.
Just try it, your kids'll say, "What're
You spreading here, Mom?
You're the best!  You're da bomb!"
And this treat will delight like no utter.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
While to jump off a bridge would be stressful,
The result could be lastingly restful.
Steve Brodie, however,
Exceedingly clever,
Survived and became quite successful.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
"The risks of infarction and stroke
Are lower for guys who don't smoke.
To prevent these bad ills
Take clopidogrel pills,"
Said my doc, "—no, I really don't joke!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Beneficiation's improvement of chips—
Where more bark is removed, so what ships
To the paper mill earns
A good grade as it turns
Into pulp for our Post-Its and slips.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
These migraines increase, to my sorrow;
Analgesics I beg and I borrow,
But my doc is blasé
And just waves me away:
"Take two aspirins and call me tomorrow."

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
An acid (alloxanic), while dating,
Met a base and combined in a mating.
Through nobody's fault,
They gave birth to a salt—
An alloxanate well worth the waiting.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Coming gropingly forth from the dark, it
Was soon an emerging young market.
Our commercial relations
With burgeoning nations:
"Here's my ride, kid—find somewhere to park it."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
For her dance set, an ostrich's plumage
Graced the head of one Honeybee Rumage.
A strap of pink hearts
Hid her netherly parts,
While a boa concealed her bazoomage.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Here's a grand corbel arch that we made
When your dad was a mason by trade.
See, up over our heads,
Like paired upside-down treads
On small stairs? Ah, the courses we laid.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You're in need of a shave? Here's a Bic
That can manage a beard, thin or thick.
No, I haven't a laser,
Just this pink plastic razor.
Take care in avoiding a nick.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Having seashell valves equal in size:
Equivalvular — that's no surprise.
Your face is bemused;
Perhaps you're confused.
Thinking vulvalar? Fine, roll your eyes.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
I'm incensed and I'm bent out of shape!
When you filmed us, you promised that tape
Was for you, not the Net!
Please—I want to forget,
But my fans will not let me escape.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
The ball park was emptied of fans,
Who'd left in their coupes and sedans.
The chopfallen batter
Saw pennant hopes shatter
And knew it had been in his hands.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In some parts of the world the earth's crust
Has to give or its surface will bust.
Tectonic plates press
On each other. This stress
Crustal movement creates — dust to dust.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A DF can find out the direction
Of incoming waves in connection
With radio-receiving
Antennas, achieving
Its task to the highest perfection.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Nerve impulses," said Doc MacDougal,
"Whether sensory (hearing a bugle)
Or motor (adjourn
And get out!)  take a turn
First axipetal, then axifugal."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The fashion designer Max Sokoff,
Decided to knock Loehmann's block off.
Without any compunction,
He obtained an injunction,
Effectively blocking their knock-off.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
When a government dares thumb its nose
At its parliament, arrogance shows.
Soon they're found in contempt,
'Cause no party's exempt
From the law. Is it time to depose?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm in school to become a detective.
With my courses, I must be selective:
How to Handle a Gun,
Drugs and Vice 101,
And Interpretive Dance (an elective).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I start off with five dollars of clay
And make 25 bowls every day.
Glazed and painted, they sell
(Twelve bucks each) very well.
I can make a good income this way.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Adjuration's a word that's ideal
For describing an earnest appeal,
The kind, truth to tell,
That is solemn as well,
Not to mention both heartfelt and real.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
At your label of Rattus norvegi-
cus, brown rat admirers get edgy:
"Norway rats" came from Persia!
Though the world may all curse ya,
Come and perch on my scalp, dry and ledgy.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With bulk purchasing, here's your first clue:
Just buy basics, like kangaroo stew.
Once I happened to spy
A full lifetime supply,
And the price was so low I bought two.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Turning seventy-five: My assignment?
Stay at home in a boring confinement.
Can't stock up at the store —
Can't go out any more;
I'm locked down 'til my final enshrinement.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A man shearing sheep threw the bull,
Even boasted of mafia pull.
Then his bragging increased,
And he's turned up deceased
In the fleece. Seems he's died in the wool.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I shall publish this verse and be damned.
So what if you think you are spammed?
It's a poem to share
And I really don't care
If my soul into hellfire is slammed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Wrought iron's functional, Jack, and no fooling;
It's our baker's rack, mainly for cooling:
There's a load of fresh pies
And warm bread, some supplies.
Get a hold of yourself. Jack, you're drooling.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
My girlfriend loves pickles and fries,
And garlic with kippers in pies.
Her rank halitosis
Has caused this chemosis;
Her breath's bringing tears to my eyes.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
My cofounders helped me to start
A place to enlighten your heart.
Much coffee was perked
As together we worked.
The result? This museum of art.

limerick_list.author: Screenhog
limerick_list.text:
If you suffer from fever or cold,
And don't like what your pharmacy sold,
Try this East Asian root
Decongesting your snoot.
Take some ginseng! It's helpful, I'm told.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
He was Deputy Secretary of State
Under Bush — Richard Armitage.  Wait!
That's who outed Ms. Plame.
Most have not heard his name,
'Cause it's Rove the press told us to hate.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
An embarrassing bed-wetting case
Can evaporate, leaving no trace.
Enuresis might seem
Like it's just a bad dream,
But for children it's quite a disgrace.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Azonal: of worlds without lines,
Where no fence and no wall redefines
What was once open space.
Could we live in a place
Without boundaries or no-entry signs?

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
The forensic accountant's aplomb
Was apparent when dropping this bomb:
"As our audit trails show,
There's extensive cash flow
To a veep of this conked out dot-com."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Fwd: Check out this staggering list!
FWD: Yes, all these people exist!
FW: Found this on Facebook!
Fw: Lemurs in space, look!
I fear it's too hard to resist.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A copter's a rotary wing
Type of aircraft, a marvelous thing
Whose blades' fast rotation
Imparts elevation:
Ascent with a vertical spring.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Though the judge had said "cease and desist",
The man still hit his wife with his fist.
So she pulled out a gun
And counted to one—
At her funeral they whisper, "She missed..."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
You're connusant of property law,
So should recognize, sir, there's a flaw
In the claim that you own
The whole lobster alone
By possessing nine-tenths of one claw.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A double-wide packed full of grass
Is not what you might think, alas.
It's a paper that's big
For a head who's a pig
Or who's failing his joint-rolling class.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Though religion no longer could con him
Once the bright light of reason had drawn him,
Could the skeptic be blamed,
When the prophet was named,
For murm'ring a fervent "Peace on him"?

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
We're a band playing show after show,
And from city to city we go.
San Francisco today,
And tomorrow, L.A.,
That's the concert tour way to make dough.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The speech she delivered was blinding;
It was brilliant. Soon she'll be finding
The thoughts she expressed
With excitement and zest
Mean her audience needs no reminding.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Have you ever met up with a dabb?
In the wild? In the zoo? In the lab?
Ask the Bedouins—they
Eat dabb tails, by the way—
And they'll claim this large lizard is fab.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
You're hungry, of food you've a lack.
Now is time for a light meal or snack—
Yes, a chack's what you need
So sit down, have a feed
And your fast with great speed now we'll crack.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"At one's pleasure (discretion), at will"—
Ad bene placitum gives me a thrill:
I can do what I like,
I can drive, swim, or hike,
Or learn Latin, or lie down and chill.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Play the "Lay for the Age of Aquarius."
Air it out on your sweet Stradivarius.
It's an aerious air,
Like a spiritless prayer,
Yet exalted. I find that hilarious.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"We eat everything!" bragged Tom and Flo.
Their hostess served blackbird —go know!
Flo gulped, "Thanks for havin' us."
Tom gagged, less than ravenous,
"Well, I guess we'll just have to eat crow."

limerick_list.author: geniuswaitress
limerick_list.text:
Correctness means much in society.
For example, in church, aim for piety:
No belching, no cheers,
No chugging of beers
(I suppose I could start with sobriety).

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I've invented the best-tasting candy bar —
And its size is just right! What a dandy bar!
It's a no-flour sweet
In a hand-shape that's neat
And compact, so I call it a "HandiBar".

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
You judge books by their covers? Not wise,
Because outward appearance belies
What lies hidden inside,
And what's seen can have lied.
See—I'm not what you thought...so, surprise!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Every birthday, Aunt Babs would send cash.
Each Thanksgiving? A huge family bash!
Christmas, Easter, and more,
She'd throw parties galore
With great celebratory panache.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Engrasp me, you lovable fool!
Embrace, grip and hold me — you're cool.
Lay your hands on and clinch
So I can't move an inch,
Until Mom says get ready for school.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Dear Aretha, I find I'm compelled
To remark that the word you have spelled,
Being L-O-N-G,
Hurts my H-E-A-D.
Disrespectfully yours, [name withheld].

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, Boatswain, please save us — and think
Who's on board!" He retorts, "On the brink
Of submergence? Away!
In your cabins — and stay!
Do you want this fair vessel to sink?"

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
His dislike for his cellmate was hearty.
What to do? Nothing subtle or arty:
He jumped him and wrapped him
In bedding, then sapped him—
He threw him a nice blanket party.

limerick_list.author: psheil
Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A HazMat retiree named Gene
Took to cookery: Tex-Mex cuisine.
But to him what appeals
Are leguminous meals;
In the end, he's become a Haz-bean.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Kids deserve, if they study, good grades.
Sometimes heroes deserve big parades.
But your ignorant crack
About gays is off track.
Truly no one deserves to get AIDS.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Fissile means "able to fission",
If an element can make the transition
Into two or more bits
As its nucleus splits —
A change from its old composition.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
Account debtors are customers who
Owe you money. If they try to screw
You — not paying when due —
You should threaten to sue.
It's a choice of pursue or accrue.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In traditional roofs, timber frames
Have their parts known by various names.
A crown post's one part
Of a truss. At its heart,
To support a short crown plate it aims.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
To get hired, Simon pees in a cup.
Driving home, he of course buckles up.
When his wife asks him, "Hey,
Did you have a nice day?"
Compulsorily, Simon says, "Yup."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
From the dag-tailed hind end of the sheep,
Bo cut daglocks while time seemed to creep.
Exceedingly bored,
Ms Peep's task was ignored;
Shunning shearing, she snored, deep in sleep.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
On one's bike if the axle set breaks
A mechanic should not make mistakes.
With cones, washers and nuts,
If he works like a klutz,
When you ride all you'll feel are the shakes.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
Banana slugs ate my new fern.
I sputtered some "dangs" and a "durn."
Under mulch they lurk smugly—
Ten inches of ugly.
Salt shaker in hand...it's my turn!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Assertedly, Elvis is dead—
But according to something I read,
He's alive. Don't you trust
All those doubters; you must
Read the National Enquirer instead.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Old astronomers thought it was clear —
Crystal globe, the celestial sphere.
Stars in perfect rotation
Reflect God's creation,
With wandering planets quite near.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
Said the White House aide, "Sir, please decide
What music the band should provide.
Do you want something light,
Or is Haydn alright?"
"It sure is," said George. "Let's go hide."

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
When yer speakin' of math stuff, closed sets
Ain't a concep' that all of us gets,
But we all understan's
They're fer keepin' us fans
Away from them movie starettes.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Down the block, I shoot hoops wit' my boys.
We gots hopes of big money and toys.
We know basketball stars
Drive those Cadillac cars—
And we's getting them NBA joys.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
As a butler, I felt quite respected,
With my upper-class family, connected.
Their bad times, I'm afraid,
Make me work as their maid.
It's a comedown I should have rejected.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
This café's delightfully quaint,
But the coffee we've bought here just ain't.
It's nasty and bitty,
Disgustingly gritty—
I'd say we've got grounds for complaint.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Now that Christmas is here, Dad is wired
As he looks at the toys you've desired.
Yule learn it's the label
That made him unstable:
Please note: Some assembly required.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'd be happy to row with the flow,
But a contrary current says, "Whoa!"
It turns me around
So I'm opposite-bound,
And it's back cross the inlet I go.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light and Engineer
limerick_list.text:
Clever me, got a deal on my ride!
I mean, sure, the transmission is fried,
And the tires lack air,
But the salesman said they're
Quite all right—they're just flat on one side!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The coiner confessed to the thief,
"All my counterfeits filled me with grief.
Then I found some machines
That strike pictures of queens:
Anaglyptographs—what a relief!"

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Funky music can feature a groove:
Repetition that spurs one to move.
Nodding heads, tapping feet
Mark the cyclical beat.
Southern Baptists, though, may disapprove.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
There's a vaguely disquietous air
As the camera pans up at the pair
In the rain-spattered cabin —
Someone soon will come grabbin'.
(Cue the creaky door.) Lights out! Beware!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A battledore's kind of a racquet,
To play badminton, if you can hack it;
In this old Asian game
With a modernized name,
When the shuttlecock comes, you must whack it.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
The speed cops will not derestrict
Quiet side streets, but don't think I'm licked.
Although racing my chopper
Is gross and improper,
I like getting residents ticked.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Our beliefs have wrought death on this earth
By creating more mayhem than mirth.
Now billions have died
Due to addle-brained pride
Over this or that marvellous birth.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
With a goal at each end — mine and thine,
Today's football game got off just fine.
As the ball I kicked met,
Though, the back of the net,
I did wish the net hadn't been mine.

limerick_list.author: GAD
limerick_list.text:
A fluorochrome's that which fluoresces,
To mark biological messes.
To say any more
As to what they're used for,
Your guess is as good as my guess is.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Al Capone was a guy who would choose
To make offers you couldn't refuse.
It was best to decline
Such a hot Valentine:
"Line 'em up, and I'm not talking booze."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a worm gets enraged, it can wriggle:
Apoplectically wiggle and jiggle.
But in dreams, it flies higher,
And screeches in ire.
It aspires to get sore like an iggle.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
That geneticist does lots of screens.
There's so many I know what it means.
Though each test she does daunts me,
I'm willing—she wants me!
She's trying to get in my genes.

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
She's a robot; she doesn't look real,
But she still has a certain appeal:
She has silicon eyes
And molybdenum thighs
And an ass made of chromium steel.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Of our teacher, James isn't afraid.
He maintains she's a crazy old maid,
And in inkwells he dips
Paper clips and the tips
Of the painstaking plaits Mom would braid.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Dear editors: Please, will you stop
Making changes?  You add, tweak and chop.
Is this poem so bendable,
Warped and emendable?
No! It's the cream of the crop.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
I'm a fantasy fan to my core;
Over Gaiman and Tolkien I pore.
I've got shelves upon shelves
Full of dragons and elves
(And a few stacks of books on the floor).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
On her presence, I'd come to depend.
In depression, I now mourn a friend.
How I wish, with this gloom
Taking up all the room
In my head, that my own life would end.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Adrift in the waves on the beach
Was a beachball  I couldn't quite reach.
Each time that I tried,
A wave swept me aside
And my toddler let out a sharp screech.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It came from a transgenic goat;
It was stuff firms tried hard to promote.
They sought out subscribers
To buy these fine fibers,
But biosteel just didn't float.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Far-off India's where they are from,
And these cluster beans give us guar gum,
Which gives thickness to food.
Though its name may seem crude,
To its charms the food chemists succumb.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Over these eyes you can't pull the wool
About Indian cheeses. I'm full,
Day and night, of one kind:
Bandal's dry with no rind.
It's the best, and that's no (Sitting) bull.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Johnny Appleseed's legend had grown
Like the trees from the seeds he had sown
Near the southern Great Lakes,
But his fans made mistakes—
Johnny Kudzuseed's less fondly known.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
My English was painfully scanty,
So I readily put up the ante
At an evening class college.
Since night school, my knowledge
Includes words like euphoric and canty.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She said, "Call me," but later I wondered:
Could it possibly be that I blundered?
She struck me as shy
And demure, so then why
Does her phone number start with "900-"?

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Double stopping's a useful technique
If "one note at a time" needs a tweak.
Hold your fingers just so
On two strings; ply your bow…
From your fiddle, two voices will speak.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
To acacias and similar plants,
Many Beltian bodies draw ants.
Are the structures delicious?
They're richly nutritious,
And acacias crave ants in their pants.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
Every miscreant Limey who sails,
Though the seaman be tougher than nails,
Would rather risk slaughter
Than the cap'n's cruel daughter:
The lash of the cat-o'-nine-tails.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
The teacher called out from his car:
"Ma'am, your daughter's a driver's ed star.
Her steering's quite deft,
She knows right turns from left,
And, with practice, she's bound to go far."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A lissome professional dancer
Sues a grower for Alar-linked cancer.
The suit overreaches
(Never used on his peaches),
But the orchardist's moved to romance her.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
His life was cartoonish, replete
With hilarious scenes of defeat.
When he tried to walk tall,
He would meet with a fall
From banana skins left in the street.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She will kiss, but she won't go the distance.
To break down  her misguided resistance,
Lustful thoughts I'll convey,
Whispered softly each day,
Because nothing succeeds like persistence.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
"You will not get off easy," said Dad,
"Not the next time you do something mad.
You've been getting off lightly —
Being punished just slightly.
No more sneaking out nightly — that's bad."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your lexicon, now, I'll increase
With a word that I find to be dece,
Though it's slang. It means "fine."
Spell it dees, that's divine,
As the joys of our speech never cease.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Because counterpoint writing is tougher
Than straightforward music, the duffer
Should beware of its charm—
Even pros take alarm
At its tune-braiding rules. How they suffer!

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
Amour is a typical word
Used for love if you write like a nerd
In intimate e-mails
Directed at females,
Who scorn such attempts as absurd.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'll be charging the jury today
As to law, and to what they should weigh.
It's a task I hold dear.
Jurors' jobs must be clear,
And this judge never leads them astray.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When our soccer team won, it was heaven.
We called them our "Golden Eleven."
Then four players were hurt
And they had to convert.
Water polo's their game, as they're seven.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Each day you feel steadily dreamier?
You suffer perhaps from anaemia.
Now, I'm different again:
Like most overweight men,
My problem's cholesterolaemia.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
To the Southern cuisine devotee,
It's the legume of choice: black-eyed pea.
They're related to beans,
Served with some sort of greens,
Maybe cornbread, and sweetened iced tea.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a building where courts of law meet,
And the county's municipal seat.
In the courthouse one reads
Public documents: deeds,
Birth certificates, plats from each street.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She's a beautiful girl and she's chased
By the guys who have excellent taste.
Though beneath a slim waist,
Her trim backside is placed,
She stays virginal, chaste. What a waste!

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
A tarantula's what you might choose
For your Pets of Unusual Hues.
Though it frightens and bites,
Still this spider excites —
It's the brightest of bright cobalt blues.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
From the farm it's twelve clicks to a bar.
It's a pain I must travel that far
To meet friends. It's unfair.
All I've got is my mare:
Just a tough, plodding farm horse — no car!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When her candidacy was announced,
The incumbent's machine quickly pounced.
It was loaded for bear
And had money to spare.
At the polls she was thoroughly trounced.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Tell us, why doth the flame draw the moth?
Tell us, why doth he slumber, the sloth?
And moreover, please tell us
(To know, we are zealous)
Why doth doth (does, now) not rhyme with "broth"?

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
My bank clerk's a Brit sort of feller,
Who says in a voice London-meller,
"To clark is a skill
You Yankees cahn't fill,
So don't say I'm only a teller."

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
If your Marlboros cause you to choke,
Try the pepper-like cubeb to smoke.
Nicer smell than cigars,
And the author of Tarz-
an smoked cigs from this berry.  No joke.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Here's a question that's likely to vex you all:
How do you know you're ambisexual?
Do you try it each way?
Or just wait for the day
When some either/authority checks you all?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A scraggly old bird near demise
Made a nest in your home, and—surprise!—
Burned your house to the ground.
You've belatedly found
What a phoenix requires to arise.

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
The mines labeled antipersonnel
A great many soldiers can fell,
So watch where you step.
Protect, please, our rep,
Plus our heads and our bodies as well.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Grassroots lobbying's done with some fair,
Broad-based goal that most groups would then share.
But the Astroturf kind,
Not benign, many find,
Is a spurious sham and a snare.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
"I'm a biblical Beast of mean tricks
With a deadline that no one can nix.
I wish nobody well
As I rise up from Hell:
For some kicks, I'm en route (666)."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When skinning a neighborhood cat
(There is more than one method for that),
After bating the hide,
Tan it, stretching it wide,
So the leather will lie nice and flat.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, what's wrong, mom and pop?  Why the frown?"
"A big box just arrived in our town,
And it can't be denied
All the people inside
Are a threat; we may have to shut down."

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
"We've found DHMO in the seas.
All that coffee you drank, and cooked peas,
Had dihydromonoxide!"
Then, when this news shocks, I'd
Yell, "H2O!  April Fools' tease!"

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
Most banks use a big unarmed bandit.
It gives money as soon as you hand it
Your ATM card,
But those fees then hit hard,
And you're short. That is not how you planned it!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Verses apothegmatical, with
A limerick's concision and pith:
Witty wisdom and more
In lines one two three four,
Then instruction arrives in the fifth.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
After all of our prayers, it's ironic
That the aftershocks weren't demonic,
But from masses resisting
A force that was twisting
A deformable plate that's tectonic.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Worms just ten cents a pound!" (yeah, that's rich)
Claimed the ad. Said the clerk, "There's a hitch.
Worms for fishing? We're out.
Want a horsewhip?" No doubt
This is why it is called bait and switch.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My style's spartan: my books and my cat,
Unlike Fothergill's flossy new flat.
Where I'm warm second-hand,
He's importantly grand,
But as tasteless as mousse made non-fat.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
E.T.  only second? How queer.
Time magazine made it quite clear
That it changed its routine
And acclaimed a machine
In place of its Man of the Year.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I'm a drag-cove: I sit on a wagon,
With my flagon and pipe that I drag on.
I'm engaged to drive (hither
And yonder and thither)
Conveyances one sends one's bag on.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Can't make it to Salisbury Plain?
Visit Carhenge where autos still reign.
There's a sculpture bizarre,
An homage to the car,
In Nebraska. Now ain't that insane?

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Auriphrygia graces my gown,
From the neckline and bodice on down.
A fine golden thread
To white satin's been wed,
By the finest designer in town.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
The language called Flemish is Dutch,
And officially spoken as such
By the  Flemish. (Their Vlaams,
In towns and on farms,
In French Flanders is used, though not much.)

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Knock-off haircolor called Cnicin Kneesy
Made her scalp itch and burn; she felt queasy.
Soon she knelt in despair:
At her feet lay her hair.
Now she's nettlesome, bald; it's not easy.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There are some definitions we've got
That, quite frankly, don't tell you a lot.
For example, acystic
Means this characteristic:
"Enclosed in a bladder it's not."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The falcons amassed in a cast
To enjoy a resplendent repast.
First these hawks made a meal
Of a diving of teal,
Then a trimming of finches came last.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
The Beauty Heart radish is red
In the middle—it's nothing to dread,
For it's tasty inside.
With a white and green hide,
It's attractive when sliced—enough said.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
There's a brash soccer fan from Dundee
Who's, alas, a two-time amputee.
	Though a violent young lout,
	No-one's scared of his clout
'Cause this hooligan's armless, you see.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
How I've fumed every time that I've heard
That a pun is its own fine "reword"!
Let the punning-devoted
Be drawn and then "quoted"
When letters and sounds become blurred.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
White and milky, it's there with a squirt;
If it gets in your eye it will hurt.
'Tween your finger and thumb
Rub it gently, then come
With a lens that's been cleaned of all dirt.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"I imbibed too much brew and was brought
To a drunk tank.  That holding cell taught
Me a lesson that day."
"Don't get soused?"  "For my stay,
I was charged.  That's a sobering thought."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In today's Christian church some have lost all
Division by dogma. They've tossed all
Their thoughts out the box.
Now they're 'Unorthodox-
Anglo-freechurch-RC-bapti-costal.'

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I am zooming along, as I like,
But a bear's over there, on a bike.
And, as a disheart'ner,
His radar-gunned partner
Has clocked my top speed. (Just a spike).

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey and rusty
limerick_list.text:
Tweezers, tongs, pliers, clips are all clever,
Made to hold things in place (never sever).
But no surgeon's stern lips
Would demand tongs or clips.
May their forceps be with you forever.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
My penis is blistered! Folks stare
And they tell me, too late, to take care.
Other nudists here say,
"If you sunbathe all day,
First apply some good sunblock 'down there'."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
This triple-cream cheese, I submit,
With its sweet, nutty taste, is a hit.
Though the product's named Finn,
Since it's wholly made in
The U.K. they should call this stuff Brit.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though the steak is so tough I can't chew it,
Gabby gobbles it down—nothing to it!
Are her jaws made of steel?
How she eats is unreal!
But what gets me is how she can do it!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Could a guy sport an elephant's trunk?
Would it make the girls think him a hunk?
No, he'd look rather weird,
But a pointed goat's beard
(Hair that's grown on his chin) would—slam dunk!

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Svelte Cicely Phelps's proportions
Enabled amazing contortions
With such fabulous ease
That her foot seemed to sneeze,
While her uncle collected extortions.

limerick_list.author: Wattlebird
limerick_list.text:
In that dress she was daringly gowned,
The most striking of all to be crowned;
But she fell with a thud,
Her frock ruined in mud—
And she cussed as her tush hit the ground.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Sink a drill string of pipes in the earth
In the hope you'll hit something of worth.
Just keep twisting the pipe
Down the bore, and don't gripe
Should you fail. Of success, there's a dearth.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
My eavestrough has spouted a leak—
And the lawn has acquired a creek.
If the rain doesn't stop,
We'll be wading in slop,
'Cause the roofer can't come 'til next week.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
My woodshed can't take any more:
There are logs packed from ceiling to floor,
But cordwood's my pleasure
For sawing at leisure—
Cut lengths, which are stacked by the door.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The cosmist John Fiske once opined
On the way that the world is designed:
Not just theism's true—
Evolution is, too,
And its highest achievement? The mind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This great bagel is Maisie's creation.
It's a circle, precise in formation,
With a round space inside.
Maisie's smiling with pride;
She's in charge of the dough's entortilation.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
An embossment is wrongly maligned
When its bulges are hollow behind.
Never call something squalid
For not being solid;
The bumps are the way it's defined.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Ban the back pass: it's one of the flaws.
This led soccer to alter its laws:
So now, "Foul" is the call
If my kicking the ball
Sends it straight into our goalie's paws.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
My voice is the gates of Hell squeaking,
With stutters and stammers and shrieking.
Will my writing outlive
Any lectures I give
Difficultly, in manner of speaking?

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Cole Porter's famed song with those "D"s
 ("It's De-Lovely") had words just like these:
It's delightful… delectable;
So the meaning detectable
Is delitable in the reprise.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A cultured official named Herman
Sent a firman. We couldn't determine
What he meant till a clerk,
Who by birth was a Turk,
Translated it back into German.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Here is one of those "What is it?" things:
Can you guess what has eight legs and sings?
Not a musical spider—
Think haircut provider:
They're heard from Spokane to Palm Springs.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A dipteran insect survives
Via reincarnation and thrives
In the soul of one cow,
Then another, so now
He's become the first gnat with kine lives.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When America sought to get all
Of the leaders in Europe to fall
Into line and say no
To its Soviet foe,
It discovered it hadn't de Gaulle.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Watch your skirt; take the  cross thwart, my dear.
(My, she's tasty, examined from here.)
Yes, the skiff's seats are low:
A bit awkward, I know.
(What a bonus—her panties are sheer!)

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
A field hospital, tents in formation,
Treats the wounded. Its normal location
In a war zone's design
Is behind the front line.
It's a movable, surgical station.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Obedience school? Fido's snicker
Informs me I'll have to be slicker.
His attitude's set;
He thinks I am the pet,
And he knows I can't handle my licker.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
Amenorrhea, the stopping of flow,
Is a term that girl athletes should know.
One might lay the blame
On their leanness of frame,
And an excess of "Go, Go, Go, Go!"

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
The doctor said, "This is a quick test,
And though it is known as a Dick test,
It checks your protection
From Strep A infection,
And isn't a dipping-your-wick test."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My grandma says life's full of danger—
I never should speak with a stranger.
If she'd lived when the Bible
Took place, she'd be li'ble
To cry, "Don't give birth in a manger!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
It's a mobster's young wife you're romancing,
So your kneecaps you clearly are chancing.
I think that you'll find
You'll be changing your mind.
To another tune soon you'll be dancing.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
White hair, and white eyelashes too!
When I saw her complexion, I knew—
She was cute, albinotic,
And oh, so exotic:
Divinely translucent to view.

limerick_list.author: Rich Ristow
limerick_list.text:
Apocryphally, Dwight likes to write
Many grant letters late in the night.
They have many a fact
That ain't close to exact,
With no credible sources to cite.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I say this of those zealots who share
A belief system based on thin air:
Their unholy reliance
On God — and not science —
Fills rational folks with despair.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A forelock's a tuft of one's hair
That sprouts from one's forehead, right there.
When it's tugged, so I've heard,
It denotes one's deferred
To one's betters (one's place, one knows where).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
As a wannabe starlet, she'd whine,
"Unemployment? That role should be mine!"
Why she lines in a queue,
Not an acting debut:
Missing cues and forgetting her line.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Small brass buttons — do flowers get lowlier?
Can't stand hills. Loving land that is bowly-er,
Salty wetlands they settle.
They haven't one petal.
They're  Cotula coronopifolia.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Said the spy, "It won't do to disclose
The message that's hid in this prose."
But he sounded so nasal,
I made the appraisal —
The spy had a code in his nose.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The critic's opinion was drastic—
Devastatingly funny (sarcastic).
In reviewing her fan dance
He proposed we should ban dance
That claims in its ads "It's FAN-tastic!"

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
A critique that will make you my debtor:
Horiatiki for Greeks, nightly feta?
Cretans boast of their cheese;
Their myzithra will please.
Salads eaten on Crete — so much better!

limerick_list.author: Cat
limerick_list.text:
An affected young actor named Shay,
Threw THE most exquisite par-TAY.
"Oh DAH-ling, do come!",
He enthused to a chum,
"If you don't, I'll be forced to pleurer!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In west Africa, Ken's a perplexed guy.
Not bilingual, he's often a vexed guy.
When he asked, "Have you read
Local papers?" I said,
"Akan read 'em as well as the next guy."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Mr. West, in my own estimation,
You exhibit undue estuation.
I sat on your cat —
Just his tail — so it's flat.
Does that warrant such fierce agitation?

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
"It was done by a certain Bob Rose"
Is by some guys in everyday prose
Almost certainly used
In a sense (got confused?)
Of "unknown"—so uncertain, I s'pose.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Bob was raised in a stiff, boring nation,
Where whirling's not viewed with elation,
But tequila puts strain
On his mild, British brain,
Laying naked his skills at gyration.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Our excursion to France was aborted.
Cruddy food spoiled that trip," Courtney snorted
In lines anapestic.
"All their cheese was domestic;
At home I use only imported."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When dining with old Chinese friends,
Your ineptness with chopsticks offends.
Using forkchops, however,
May make you look clever.
There's a fork and a knife at the ends.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
There was rather a lot on my plate;
It's a goodly amount that I ate.
Something pretty to see
May be goodly to me,
Like my ample, attractive estate.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
If you listen to masses or watch 'em
With their old Latin words (please don't botch 'em),
There's a phrase sung or said
While the priest breaks the bread:
Dona nobis, it goes, pacem, pacem.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
Nirvana's a peace that's serene,
An enlightened, composed state of bein'.
For some, meditation
Promotes this sensation,
While some hit the local canteen.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
An astronomer studies the stars
And can plot how to get us to Mars;
Knows how planets align,
But won't ask for your sign.
Being called an astrologer jars.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
He stands in his gloomy patch now,
With thistles, his only known chow.
Poor old Eeyore's depressed,
He's unhappy, distressed,
As he cheerlessly beats his own brow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A dipsogen brings on a thirst.
Drink some fluid; you'll find it's reversed,
But the thirst will return
If its cause you can't learn
And remove it—you'll feel that you're cursed.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
When I woke up this morning, the blues
Were collecting their membership dues.
Lord, I'm feeling so sad,
'Cause my mom and my dad
Don't respect my conservative views.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
They will hold an aqiqah, they say,
Next week, on their son's seventh day:
Give his hair's weight in gold.
And kill goats from the fold.
Muslims greet and name babies this way.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'd a hammer, but nothing to bang,
Till I found an old picture to hang,
But I did something dumb—
Went and hammered my thumb.
Up I sprang, and yelled, "Dang!" (Yup, that's slang.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The First Family's the president's kin.
I have heard, to the staff's great chagrin,
In the White House guests saw
Someone's mother-in-law
Boldly badger a POTUS therein.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Anglo-Saxons presumably found
That a floor level deep in the ground
Made a cozier clubhouse
(Or hut) called a grubhouse.
I'm guessing; I wasn't around.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
You look blue in your skin and your lips:
Let me check if your heart blips or skips.
Cyanosis is scary,
So please do be wary:
Keep breathing, if only in sips.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mix some syrups with oils and you'll get
An eclegm. (Are you wondering yet?)
If you swallow a dose,
You may think it tastes gross,
As it's medicine. Who would have bet?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Attached to this favor I bring
To your Senate campaign is a string.
I won't give it away.
You will have to repay.
Don't expect a free lunch—no such thing.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
A Bush twin (not Barb, but the other)
Is shopping a kid's book. Oh, brother!
Can Jenna Bush write?
Do her verbal skills bite?
Let us hope she takes after her mother.

limerick_list.author: prionix
limerick_list.text:
An adelopod's very discreet
When it comes to displaying his feet.
His dogs aren't transparent;
They just aren't apparent—
Either hidden, obscured, or petite.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Once agnostic and clouded in doubt,
Howie now is a convert—devout.
Once he'd laugh and pooh-pooh ya,
But now "Hallelujah!"
He's shouting, day in and day out.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Although nobody gave me a push,
Still I stumbled and fell on my tush,
And my dress of white gauze
Became spotted, because
I hit land on a cranberry bush.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Would you please sign these forms I've begun,
So that this precious child, my own hon,
Can be my little girl?
Do it quick—in a whirl!
My adoption leave nearly is done!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Let the chain out and drop it down deep.
Mines will catch in the chain as we sweep
'Cross the bay's muddy bottom.
But until we have got 'em
And cleared 'em, no man goes to sleep.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
At first meeting, she'll often put on
A façade, her warm nature withdrawn.
She seems brittle and cool—
But have patience, and you'll
See she's sweet as a sparrow at dawn.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
For years, for revenge I had bided
My time, till today I decided
I had to let go
Of the secrets I know.
Now that dirtbag's disdained and derided.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A jellyfish group is a bloom.
That's a swarm where, together, they loom.
Since you know that these things
Can have poisonous stings,
When encountering blooms, give 'em room.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A dish fit for a queen robed in scarlet,
Or even a quean (that's a harlot):
Stew fruit; with a cutter,
Slice bread; spread with butter;
Assemble and bake—hello charlotte!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
For sale was a property, grand.
'Twould have served for our home. But a stand
Of drab oil-pumping gear
Quickly squelched our good cheer.
This appurtenance came with the land.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She's a dragon? Then say she's draconic
If her nasty behavior is chronic.
If she's fierce and she's mean,
Like Snow White's evil queen,
It's a statement of fact—not ironic.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The job title bobber denotes
You're employed taking fish off of boats.
On the other hand, bub,
Maybe metals you rub
So your work a fine luster promotes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In this joining-with-others reaction
Do atoms find real satisfaction?
I suspect it's (in dating)
The impulse toward mating
That's truly a chemical attraction.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
In bordage, a system that's feudal,
The lord owns the kit and caboodle.
If you served as a bordar
(The lowliest order)
That wouldn't be using your noodle.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antidandruff: its meaning is clear,
It's a product that helps us appear
Free of pesky white flakes
That annoy. Dandruff makes
Of our shoulders a snowy frontier.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Len is wed to a woman who gets
Other women to satisfy debts.
She can play malefactress—
This dramatic exactress.
When she does so, she has no regrets.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The coiffure he so boyishly styled
Was a look that drove womenfolk wild.
This impression would vanish,
For his come-on was mannish.
Their reaction? The women just smiled.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The nobles want something to eat:
Call their dapifer, bringer of meat.
Such a steward is facile
At running their castle
And keeping their household replete.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I've insulted Hernando Cortez.
There's an edge to his voice as he says,
"Let me make this concise:
I don't need your advice.
Plus, I think I look good in a fez."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lord Elgin, at noteworthy cost,
Brought these sculptures—all Europe they crossed.
But now Greece wants them back,
And I fear that, alack,
Elgin marbles will shortly be lost.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Strong and sturdy, and lacking fragility,
This plastic is known for ductility.
I can stretch it out thin
Into yarn you can spin.
You will love its extreme extensibility.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman and Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
A buttercup under my chin
Reflects yellow; my daughter chimes in,
"There's the proof you like butter!"
"Who doesn't?" I mutter
While flashing my cheesiest grin.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Who's the outfitter clients adore,
Forming habits for majors, and more?
The polite, never dilatory,
Civil and Military
Tailor — it's Phelps of Lahore!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At a diplomats' ball in Dushanbe,
An ambassador named Abercromby
Was feeling quite weak,
Till he danced cheek Tajik.
Now he no longer moves like a zombie.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
When an argument seems to be stinking,
And you look a bit closer, by linking
Its theories to facts
To deduce what detracts
From its value, that's critical thinking.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
I've an armil encircling my wrist,
Golden strands that are bound in a twist.
Add more bands and it's clear,
An armillary sphere
Could be made with a flick of my fist.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Once that bouser and noted carouser
Drinks much more than her system allows her,
We'll be needing a hoist
(Throw some rope o'er that joist)
And a block and some tackle to bouse her.

limerick_list.author: Elena Hearty
limerick_list.text:
It's a quite contradictable claim
That your boa constrictor is tame.
It appears that you've lied:
There's a lump in its side
That can still be heard screaming your name.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
With his tongue in a gag, burned alive,
Nine years after he dared to arrive
At Venice—back home—
He was killed then at Rome.
His ideas, however, survive.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I fell while evading some bees
And I scraped up my biscuits and cheese."
My expression looked pained,
So my daughter explained,
"That's just rhyming slang, Guv'nor, for 'knees.'"

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My man Spike is  not really too swift,
And his focus will wander and drift.
You could say he's a dolt,
But just hand him a bolt—
To join wood is his God-given gift.

limerick_list.author: Giri
limerick_list.text:
With fictitious reports, the new team
Tried to fool the reviewers. Their scheme
Truly didn't cut ice.
For their lies, in a trice,
They all lost their high ranks and esteem.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"I no longer fit into my suit—
Better stick to my veggies and fruit,"
Tom addressed his size fittingly,
If somewhat unwittingly,
"And I'll exercise plenty to boot."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was spied with my lover at noon,
So expect I'll be called very soon.
The call will be from
Either Meg (my wife's chum),
Or some horrible blackmailing goon.
