limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At age 90, I say I'm alive
And kicking. The docs say I thrive
On a life filled with action.
You want satisfaction?
Then live! Don't just merely survive.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace and speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
My friend Sven said, "When men have a yen
For Norwegian books now and again,
Knowing Bokmål will do,
As will Nynorsk—those two
Are the dominant tongues in our ken."

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
It begins with Buck Mulligan (chubby),
This day in Bloom's life.  Molly's hubby
Meets Stephen, a friend
mountain flower at the end
I said yes I will Yes feel my bubby.

limerick_list.author: woozy
limerick_list.text:
The cormorant's greatest enjoyment's
The same as the seagull's annoyance.
She can reach deeper spoils
By lacking the oils
That provide, for the gull, too much buoyance.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
It's a word to make verbivores revel:
A fool or a drudge is a drevil.
Add a space, such upheaval!
He's now Dr. Evil:
A fool who has gone to the devil.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Apogeotropic things turn from the earth,
Like they have inflated ideas of their worth.
Noses in the air, leaves turn up;
Little hippopotamus pup
Comes a-creeping up: they'll soon add to his girth.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Here's dextromethorphan, a drug
That is dangerous," Officer Doug
Tells the class. "So don't buy
Some to try to get high.
Want to die? Wave 'bye-bye,' chug-a-lug!"

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Dermatitis is making me twitch;
These Acaridae mites are a bitch.
They've infested the feed,
Fruit and cheese people need.
 From those bugs, I picked up grocer's itch.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They do Immelmans, barrel rolls, loops,
And a sequence of falconine swoops.
They are daredevil fliers
Whose only desire's
To delight and inspire the troops.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
I was poking about for some bait:
Found a bootlace worm. What's to relate?
Well, this slimy brown thong
Was some fifty feet long —
If untangled and  measured when straight.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
A condition will sometimes arise
Where small children will take on the guise
Of some Renaissance creatures
With cherub-like features:
Big jaw, puffy cheeks, upturned eyes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When business fell off, I was fired.
I am young, so I can't say "retired."
With no cash, no enjoyment,
I'm antiunemployment—
I'm hoping I'll soon be rehired.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A blender's a wig with a band
For the forehead. It goes hand in hand
(When your make-up's in place)
With what's put on your face
And the band, so it blends. Understand?

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
It was Jesus who made water wine.
Well, the transitive verb here is fine,
And it's factitive too:
It produced something new.
The effect on the water's divine.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
D-Day landings begin, it's day one:
Tommy Atkins holds tightly his gun,
Checks the barrel and breach
And then, onto the beach,
As the battle fog darkens the sun.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I'm chagrined.  What I thought was a breeze
Has, in fact, caused me mental unease.
I was met with disgrace
'Cause I figured to ace
All my midterms, but got only D's.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Heavy wet left him too drunk to crawl.
In the cage Dummie woke, all asprawl.
When he opened his eyes
He said, in surprise,
"Queer my glims, if that be n't little Paul!"

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
To diphthongise means to exchange
A vowel sound for one with a range
Of sounds that are slurred,
So a new sound is heard,
Which differs but does not sound strange.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Costumbristas write regional tales
That depict both the joys and travails
Of the people they've known.
Local customs are shown
And enrich these Latino portrayals.

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
